review_body: We had a great visitation the Skyline Island Colony Resort! Jaime was so elequint and welcoming he makes you feel the real meaning of Aloha in Hawaii. He has been very useful during this quatrain time.

One of the best bargains in Central Waikiki!! This is the place to stay if you are looking for a comfortable place in the heart of Waikiki. It is a secure condo-hotel with nice views of Diamond Head to the east, and partial view of the shoreline. It is within walking distance of everything in Waikiki and I realized what a great location as you can easily get in and out due to its location. The International Marketplace, and Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center and dozens of eateries are within 10 minutes walk.Parking is a bit expensive with limited on-street parking. Having a rental agency attached to the hotel helps a lot if you're doing day trips - you can save the cost of parking and spend it on the vehicle. Otherwise, it's probably better to share-ride it in.My only criticism is the bathrooms are a bit small; but little inconvenience, considering everything else.

Some kine of compensation for the rust in the tub and the cleanness of the room that we was in which was 3110 and if you guys can double check the room to make sure that I am not lie about the rust in tub

We needed a place to stay during the pandemic so my husband could have surgery. Fortunately the Skyline was open. Thank you for being there. Everyone was pleasant and the room was what we needed for our stay.

Have stayed here several times and find it a great combination location and reasonable price. Parking is available, too, which is a luxury in Waikiki. The hotel is within walking distance to the best beach area, the nicest restaurants, and other amenities. It is reasonably quiet with great laundry facilities, a gym, a sauna, and a very spacious swimming pool area. Also, many bbq units for private use.

Clean room and just a few blocks from the International Market and beach. Salt water pool and jacuzzi were really nice. My complaint is the loud pool noise. The pool closes at 10:00 p.m. and people were making a lot of noise until well after midnight. I called the front desk to complain and the manager said they would take care of it but that didn't happen. Also, 1 load of laundry at their facility cost $15.00!! You had to pay $5.00 for the laundry card and put a minimum of $10.00 on it. Biggest ripoff!

I just wanted to thank you very much to Jaime for giving us room upgrade upon morning arrival , on the 42nd floor with an amazing Waikiki view.It’s a great place , very good location. Good kitchenette and very big balconies. There’s is car rental which is very handy.Every Tuesday 5-6 pm they have free cocktails and nibbles on the roof with amazing view. Thank you very much on behalf of myself and my partner Albert.We will definitely come back and stay again soon.Sebastian

I could say that our stay in the hotel was perfect, we had a beautiful room with a city view from the 40th floor, every sunrise and sunset were a beautiful gift. Additionally a wide and comfortable bed to rest after visiting tourist places in the city. The hotel has an excellent location in Waikiki, a few minutes walk you can find various restaurants, nearby beaches and a boulevard that borders a beautiful water channel, ideal for sports or cycling. The good service of their team was first class, especially Michael at the front desk, he always was friendly, kind person helped us with all our requirements and even advised us to see many beautiful places on the island. They always made us feel very special with their hospitality

This hotel is well located with a great view of Waikiki !!! our stay was great Thanks to Michael who kindly attended to us and gave us information about tourist things we could do! I definitely recommend it
I just want to say thank you to Jaime for being so nice & so helpful on our first stay here in Waikiki. Great service & the place was beautiful & clean! & again THANK YOU JAIME, we will def be back

Amazing! We enjoyed our stay here at Island Colony, the staff was nice and helpful, not to mention professional. If there was anything that we needed they jumped on it right away, whether it was getting extra towels, picking up mail, or assisting us with extending our stay which was a breeze. Jaime was the best! As soon as we met him he had this warm and humbleness to him. He helped us get a feel to the neighborhood, letting us know what to do, and where to shop that was family oriented for my husband, kids and I. Of course we were new to the island so we didn’t have a clue on what to to do and where to go. He took a major burden off us, and helped us to adapt a lot faster, he even gave us discounted tickets to the upcoming Circus! I could never Thank him enough. Overall the hotel was a plus in our book. If you were looking to stay somewhere in Waikiki, try the Island Colony. Highly recommend this place especially since they are a military friendly hotel, and accepts TLA.

Aqua Skyline was a great place to stay close to everything....great food, entertainment the beach and plenty of activities. Room had a kitchenette, nice pool. I would definitely stay here again! Store on the 6th floor was a lifesaver. Staff was helpful and very polite.

We did not get the room we paid for. Listening that they have kitchenettes is miss leading, there is a hot plate but no pots, or frying pan, just a bar fridge and microwave is usable. The floor we are on does not look like it’s been renovated in 30 years. And forget about getting a large SUV in the parkade, and parking in the area is almost nonexistent. I booked this through WestJet Vacations and will never use them again.

If we were forced at gunpoint to return to Waikiki we might stay here again. We had no complaints with our room 4304. The view was good. One elevator was out of order when we arrived, they would need more if they had twice as many. The little restaurant look like it was permanently closed. The hot tub was wrapped with yellow crime scene tape and a stupid sign that said under construction, it looked like a just needed cleaned. The parking garage is practically empty for good reason, I have stayed in cheaper motels, the ceiling is so low our pick up antenna scraped the entire time. It cost more a day to park our vehicle than it did to rent it. Overall, if you must vacation in Waikiki this is not a bad choice, everywhere has a resort fee and a parking problem. We are from Nebraska. After four days we left early and went to California and had a better time for half the money. We found out Hawaii is a lot more affordable in March.

Marlon n the crew at Aston Island Colony were kind easy helpful accommodating with my stay. Place is relaxing quiet safe n island vibe feeling of a short vacay that i got. No pressure no gimmicks no hassle just peaceful stay n thats what u expect when anyone goes away. Loc is perfect block away from kuhio street n easy access to the ala wai road street to get on ur way to other parts of honolulu. I enjoyed my stay n the view amazing of diamond head n partial ocean viewing. I loved sleeping with the sliding door to my lanai bcuz the air is enjoyable. I used the air con at times but to breathe natural breeze air is way better. Hope u get to exp the easiness of this hotel n loc. I did. Mahalo Aqua Island Colony infinity. 5 stars for my stay n hope to b back again soon bcuz Hawaii is intoxicating

We booked through a third party and had to pay some hidden fees so our cheap rate wasn't so cheap, be careful with this. Otherwise the room was nice, the location was great, and the workers on site were all great. We had a blast and everything went well aside from a few things outside of their control. Pros: Nice pool and hot tub, great BBQ's, nice workers.Cons: Hidden fees, slow elevators during peak hours, and the parking structure not operated by the hotel was awful. They had no idea what they were doing and didn't keep track of anything so they continually tried to overcharge me. Be very careful as they seem like crooks trying to get extra money out of you and frustrating you until you give up.

We stayed in a suite with a view of diamond head. It had a lot of room and was comfortable and felt like being at home on vacation. It was close to all of the Waikiki attractions and had great views. What really made it remarkable for us was the staff. We went to the rooftop reception and the sunset views were spectacular. While we were there the staff was very helpful and gave us a lot of information regarding restaurants and tips about tours and getting around. The pool was nice and never crowded and the beach was nearby. You can get beach towels and chairs at the desk. It felt like staying with friends more than at a hotel.

Picked this place solely for its affordability and the nice looking pool. Important for expensive and hot Waikiki. Hotel is well located for shopping with the beach a 10 minute walk. Rooms have been updated and a good size but missing a bedside lamp due to the bed being uncomfortably close to one wall. Was missing a TV remote and a HDMI cable for our free DVD rental but was fixed promptly. Air con was present but in a cheap and extremely noisy after market add on. Would benefit from a ceiling fan.My major bug bear however was paying the $200 "resort fee" which was non-refundable to then find out from a notice in the lift that the pool and spa would be out of order for our whole stay. No mention of this from the staff or even a reduction in the fees to compensate for this. Resort fee is a joke, considering their free shuttle seldom arrived and the route too complicated, so we took the public bus which was quicker. I realise that the pool needs maintaining but some compensation needs to be made to customers staying there as having a functioning pool is pretty important in a place like Hawaii.A good budget hotel but it might pay to call the hotel to make sure their pool is in working order if this is very important to you.

We stayed here for our last 4 of our 14 nights. Our requests when booking a year ago was HIGH FLOOR WITH VIEW. Well we certainly go that! The room is basic but had everything you need & plenty of stations to charge your devices. Air conditioning was on 24/7 & was beautiful a cool. Kitchenette was laughable just little fridge, microwave, kettle & 2 burner cooktop sink was bathroom sink to use. Didn't mind us we never used it anyway except to keep our drinks cold in fridge. Loved that there was a shop on same level as pool which was cheaper for smokes for my husband than anywhere else. Grabbed some nibblies from there too. It's a bit dodgy everyday there were police officers & cars(one day at the one time we counted 6) there looking for some girls (prostitutes) & going up & down the lifts 1 day they even had the fire department come too. Every day we had to complain about not having hot water to shower. Our last morning we had to be up at 4am to catch our 8am flight back to Oz & we had cold showers AGAIN. Very close to main shops & restaurants. Never used pool or BBQ area we were all about exploring especially coming all the way from Australia no time to sleep except when you have too. LOVED the concierge desk they were very helpful booked a couple of tours through them.

Fantastic views of Ala Wai Canal, the sea and the skyline. Great pool and BBQ facilities and the staff and activity booking desk was helpful and knowledgeable. A very short walk to the beach and major shopping and T Galleria where the Trolley buses depart, so very central to get around easily.

Located to all that is Waikiki. Short walk to the beach and shopping. 6th Floor outdoor pool with multiple cabana with full morning to afternoon sun. C-store and laundry on same floor as pool and car rental agency on main floor. My room was on the north side and had wonderful views of the Canal and the golf course.

Stayed at this hotel for 10 days. Staff were very pleasant and accommodating and helpful especially at time of check in when we requested a change of room to meet our requirements. This was not a problem or issue when we asked. Loved our room, which was very clean and had amazing views. We enjoyed spending time at the pool and the comfy pool pod beds were fab. The hotel is situated in a great location, near to the canal for walks and close to shops and restaurants. Beach was not too far away. Thank you to all the staff at Aqua Skyline for making this a special and unforgettable holiday.

Excellent staff. Brian and his team are amazing! Great rooms. Close to the beach and restaurants. Beautiful views. I highly recommend the hotel. I’ve stayed here over a dozen times and I’ve never been disappointed.

I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights prior to boarding the cruises ship. Given the high price of hotels at the time, this hotel suited me perfectly in terms of costs.Location was good in that it was only a couple of minute's walk to the beach and shopping district in Waikiki. There was also car rental office at the hotel, which made exploring Oahu very easy.Check in was a breeze. The staff was kind and very helpful. The room I was allocated was definitely showing its age. While it was partially facing the ocean, the room was quite dark and smelt of mould. The air conditioning was extremely loud, so loud that I had to wear ear plugs to sleep. The television also did not work at all (since I rarely stayed in the room, I did not report this to the staff). The bathroom was also very small, even smaller that that one I had on the cruise ship!!! Thankfully, internet in the room was fast.Would I stay at the hotel again? Probably, as long as improvements have been made to it.

Ok first of all, our check in was amazing, MICHAEL was the first person we met, he is so nice, wonderful person, he took the time to make us feel incredible, gave us advices and tips for all around. was a pleasure to us stayed there, the location amazing, the views breathtaking, on Thursday we had a cocktail hour on the terrace WOW we felt the aloha!!!!! Thank you Michael and all the team AQUA SKYLINE at island colony, We definitely recommend this place!!

We stayed in Aqua Skyline hotel as part of our honeymoon as we knew this hotel is a good location, has quite good amenities nearby and only 7-8 min walk to the beach. The hotel overall is a tiny bit dated but didn' mind too much as we weren't planning to stay in the room too much but would have been helpful to have a restaurant. We arrived early so room wasn't ready but the receptionist Steven was really helpful and friendly whom requested for us and upgrade us to a room with a view. The room has 2 Queen beds with a kitchenette and balcony. The view was stunning, we have the river/lake on left, diamond straight ahead and the beach on our right. The most disappointing part of the room is the bathroom, was absolutely tiny and you would be squished if there was two people. The water pressure was awful for the shower as well, it was dribbling like a leaky tap. The other thing I did not like was the aircon, was soo loud like an airplane landing and wasn't really powerful either. I managed to ignore it as I was so jetlagged and tired but in general it wasn't as subtle as a more modern AC. The areas I did like about the hotel is that it has a self service laundry area, takes about 45 mins to wash and to dry clothes .You can buy the detergents from the machines (1usd) and costs less than 10usd to use the machines, we did the laundry twice. I also love the mini mart located in the hotel, really useful if you do not want to venture out and needed snacks or snacks. Overall I enjoy my stay, convience and views is the biggest tick for me, definitely needs a good deep clean and lick of paint though.

We stayed here for four nights in September 2019. Firstly, the location is great. Only a couple of streets from the beach, shopping and eateries. All public and private transport know the place. You can access everything from this place. We liked the kitchenette facilities in our unit. Plus there is a convenience store on the 6th floor - and it is a sensible store to look after breakfast needs as well as nicely priced wines. The staff were great and even fixed up my television. The pool area (also on the 6th floor) is fantastic. The views are wonderful and the price is easily competitive with anything else. I will stay here again on my next visit.

Located in the middle of Waikiki with restaurants and shops within walking distance. Only problem is the hotel parking lot is run by another vendor and do not allow SUV's to park so it was a struggle trying to find parking.

My family and I had the best staying in Waikiki at Aqua Skyline not only for the best location, but also for the welcoming and outstanding service of Mike in the lobby. Mike was always supportive with all the recommendations, welcoming with every request and gave us the best tips to visit Oahu. He speaks Spanish also, so we felt like home in Hawaii. Love him and all the team. The best thing of this hotel was the great location, steps to the beach and Duke’s Lane , international market place and of course Diamond Head. We walked from the hotel to there and was a beautiful experience. We are counting the dates to come back to the hotel and say Aloha to Mike and the friendly there. MAHALO!

Perfect location, affordable price, confortable rooms, nice amenities.. As this were not enough, Mike, one of the staff member, helped us a lot recommending us all the must-go places, tours, beaches and restaurants, not only in Oahu, but also in some other islands!!! Thanks Mike, thanks for making our vacation the most complete first visit to Hawaii... We’ll definitely see you soon!! MAHALO

My family and I are locals living on the west side. Because of the absolutely ridiculous prices in Waikiki, we usually only stay there when absolutely necessary. Memorial weekend was not one of those times, but our family was in absolute need of some “alone” time and needed a stress free place to recharge. That is what we found at the Aqua Skyline. From the friendly smile at check-in to the 4 walls & 2 beds, our 2 nights of peace and quiet is exactly what we needed to recharge. Thank you Aqua!!

Friendly staff, rooms were a little small but very clean. My room had no kitchen sink, which I found strange. I had to do the dishes in the bathroom sink. The stove worked ok, refrigerator didn’t keep my drinks as cold as it should, but hey that’s what they make ice for.

Such a cool vibe when you walk into the open air lobby! The staff was very accommodating and provided beach towels when we needed - everyday. :) Shout out to Michael who was especially helpful in recommending local favorites including restaurants, beaches and other activities. Our room was clean, nothing fancy but just for sleeping and showering anyway. Even though we didn’t pay for a “beach view”, we could still see the ocean from our balcony. That combined with the city and mountain views were breathtaking! Awesome location with just a quick walk to tons of local & chain shopping, restaurants and of course - the BEACH! I was impressed with level of security which required scanning your room card for access to elevators/rooms as well as a security guard manning that area 24/7. There’s also a little shop on the 6th floor in case you forget something like your razor or sunscreen, which I did :) Great experience overall and highly recommend!

The room was clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful, especially Michael C. He was always greeting us at the entrance with a huge smile and made my first trip to Hawaii amazing. Even the garage parking attendants were charming and personable! The pool was beautiful. Overall, excellent trip!

Excellent hotel staff and superb manager's kindness saved my wedding anniversary!The Short Story:Reserved and paid AirBnB 10 months before.AirBnB host cancelled last minute. I only found out when I arrived at the building.Island Colony manager gave me a special deal so I could afford to stay there.My family could stay at the Island Colony Hotel for 21 nights in August 2019.Hotel was excellent.Great Location (Center of Waikiki, 1 block to T-Galleria/Waikiki Business plaza)Clean and spacious rooms. (Large lanai, good view)Kind and responsive staff.Free 43F rooftop cocktail hour on Tuesdays with amazing views!Great pool.Nice extras and facilities included.Free DVD rental, daily newspaper and PlayStation in room.High power hair drier.Very good security (key cards needed to enter building and operate elevators)Free pool/beach towelsConvenience store on hotel 6F open until midnight.Washers/driers on 6F.Long Story:First of all I want to say a big thank you to Marlon (the manager), Rick (the security guard at the main entrance desk), Mike (at the front desk), and the Island Colony Office staff on the 6th floor. Without their kind help, my 10 year wedding anniversary trip to Hawaii would have been a nightmare.The Island Colony building has both hotel rooms and privately owned condos. I had originally booked and paid for a rental condo on AirBnB 10 months earlier. I always book early to get the lowest prices, otherwise there would be no way I could stay 3 weeks in Hawaii in August. I flew from Japan and got a taxi to the hotel for 31 dollars pre-booked with Charley's Taxis. When I arrived at the hotel and tried to open the lockbox for the room key, the code I had received did not work. I called my condo rental contact and he said "Didn't you get my email?" You can guess the rest. He had sent me an email while I was already on my flight to Hawaii saying that he was cancelling the booking. His reason was "the laws have just changed in Hawaii and this kind of condo cannot be rented for periods of less than 30 days." It turned out that the law had been changed on August 1st, but the condo I reserved 10 months previously had a 30-day minimum stay requirement anyway. So 10 months previously he knew that rule, ignored it and took my reservation anyway. Cancelling my reservation last minute was ridiculously unprofessional. Then, the condo rental contact gave me a number for AirBnB and told me to call that for more assistance. He basically cancelled me last minute and gave me a phone number.It was at this moment that Rick (the security guard at the entrance desk to the Island Colony building) saw something was wrong and asked me what the problem was, took my name, checked it on the computer, said my name was in the system for that room, and told me to go up to the 6th floor office to get more assistance. He could have sat there and done nothing but he actively helped me and directed me to the office.At the 6th floor office, another staff member kindly let me use their phone to call the AirBnB number. After speaking to AirBnB they said they would find another Airbnb property of similar price for me and that I should wait for their email. The Island Colony Office staff then personally took me downstairs and suggested I try the hotel front desk to see if they had any spare rooms in case we couldn't get another AirBnB place, and also at least to have somewhere just for that night. She explained my situation to Mike at the front desk and he then searched on the computer for what was available. He managed to find a room, but the price was well beyond my means, but I thought I at least needed somewhere for that night as backup, so he gave me a key to go and take a look at it. It was a really nice room, so I understood the price.When I went back down to the lobby Mike had taken the initiative to speak to the manager and had been able to get a reduced rate for me due to my unlucky situation. That was really good of him to make that effort when he didn’t have to. So again, another member of staff at the Island Colony had made an effort to help me without me having to ask for it. That was really great in such a stressful moment. AirBnB got back to me and said they could not find another AirBnB property so I should find a hotel instead and they would refund my reservation and cover some but not all of the extra cost. After looking at the internet, I realized even by paying 50% more than I had budgeted, my family of 3 was going to end up in a 1 star small room somewhere in Honolulu, not Waikiki. I could not afford the Island Colony and my anniversary was going to be a nightmare. I even checked how much it would cost to change my tickets and just go back home.I went back to the front desk and asked one more time if they could lower the cost. I didn’t think they could, but I had to try, and Mike again went back to his manager and asked for me. This time, Marlon, the manager himself came to the front desk and did some magic on the computer and gave me a special price that I could afford. Mike then spent 15 minutes on the computer doing more magic and fixed it to get us a better room with two large beds instead of one king and a rollaway that had been offered before. The manger even added in a complimentary bottle of wine and chocolates to helps us celebrate our 10 year anniversary. I couldn’t believe it! They had saved my vacation. Suddenly needing to find a room with 2 beds and a kitchenette for 21 nights on August 5th in Waikiki on a slim budget? Mission impossible. The extra mile that the Island Colony hotel went to really helped get through an impossible situation. A thousand thanks to all of you!The HotelI usually stay in vacation rentals for longer vacations, but my experience at the Island Colony made me reconsider things. I really did enjoy the daily housekeeping, fresh sheets, clean bins, fresh coffee, toiletries, clean towels, prompt support and other benefits that come with staying at a good hotel. With a vacation rental, you are on your own and when I have had problems in previous vacation rentals (blocked sinks, broken fixtures, ants, cockroaches, no hot water, broken internet), it took time for support or help to come and fix things, and sometimes not at all. I recommend the Island Colony hotel very much.RoomThe room was a good size and the three of us had no problems living there for 3 weeks. It had two large beds with space to walk around both sides of each bed. It had a bedside table with drawer, light and socket plugs for phone charging. It had a long drawer/shelf unit in front of the beds under the TV with 4 spacious drawers, 2 shelves and desk area with large mirror. There was enough space to open three large trunk cases on the floor and still be able to walk around the room. There is also a double door closet with hangers, shelf space, security box, iron, ironing board (full-size, not mini).LanaiThe wall with the lanai is all windows to let lots of light in. The lanai was much bigger than my previous experiences in Hawaii. You could fit two king size beds side by side on it. There is a large table and two chairs there so you can eat your breakfast out there or have a drink and stare at the beautiful green mountains on one side. You can also see the beach and ocean through the other buildings on the other side. My room also had a good view of Diamond Head in the distance, too. The hotel is right next to the canal at the back of Waikiki, which gives a nice open feeling. You don’t feel boxed in by other hotels and buildings at all.KitchenIt had a fridge, sink, 2 electric hobs, cupboard space above, cooking utensils, cutlery, coffee maker with daily refills of filter coffee (not instant), both caffeinated and decaffeinated. It had a microwave, rice cooker, toaster and also frying pan and a cooking pot. You can use the coffee maker to make hot water for instant noodles, etc if needed.BathroomThe bathroom was very clean, with shower and bath. Toiletries were replaced daily and included shampoo, conditioner, shower gel and body lotion. The hair drier was surprisingly powerful which was good. (In other hotels I have had the problem of low power hair driers taking ages to do the job and twice actually shorting out the electrics in the whole room.) There were plenty of towels with extras on the shelf under the sink.HousekeepingThe room was well cleaned and housekeeping was very responsive to our requests. Due to jet lag we were sometimes up late and a quick phone call to the front desk made sure our room was cleaned even if we went out at 3pm. On the second day the housekeeper asked me what coffee I liked and then gave me my preferred caffeinated coffee for the rest of my stay. A small but nice personal touch. When my child left his soft toy on the floor, we returned to find it cutely waiting tucked up in bed. Again, a small but nice touch. When I mentioned the DVD player skipped a few times, the same day it was replaced. In all cases there was fast and courteous responses to our requests.StaffI found the staff to be very polite and welcoming. You can build a nice hotel, but you need the staff to make it a great place to stay and this hotel is lucky enough to have that. At large resorts, it is hard to feel that personal touch, but in the Island Colony some staff quickly remembered my name and helped create a welcoming atmosphere. The hotel had an event each Tuesday where from 5-6pm there were complimentary cocktails and snacks on the rooftop (43rd floor, I think.) with some staff members and the manager. The 360 degree views were amazing and it was nice to have a few drinks up there. It all added to a relaxing, friendly atmosphere.LocationThe hotel is in a great location. I have previously stayed at both extremes of Waikiki, near the Marriot on one end and at the Hilton Village and Ilikai at the other. The Island Colony is right in the middle of Waikiki. It is just a short walk (1 block) to Kuhio Avenue and T-Galleria, The Waikiki Business Plaza, Nordstrom Rack, Ross, 24-hour McDonalds, ABC marts and so on. Then just 1 more block to the Royal Hawaiian Shopping center. You are close enough to easily drop off shopping bags in your room and go out again or even take an afternoon rest and go back out again. The location really changed the feel of trip since we were right next to the center of Waikiki. There also major bus stops just at the Kuhio Avenue so you can catch the E bus to Waikele, or the 42 to Pearl Harbor or 13 + A to Pearl Ridge. If you have a JCB card, you can ride the pink trolley for free which also stops nearby.BeachYou can walk to Waikiki beach and the quickest way is actually to walk straight for 2 blocks, past Ross, through the Royal Hawaiian shopping center, through the pink colored Royal Hawaiian hotel to the beach. We could walk in our flip-flops from the hotel to the beach and never felt it was too far. In fact, we went to the beach more times than we have done on previous holidays because it was so easy to pick up fresh towels from the hotel, walk down to the beach, enjoy it, come back and hand the towels back. Very little hassle. I don’t think the Island Colony can advertise to people that they can walk through the Royal Hawaiian Hotel to the beach, but it is the quickest route.Other DetailsTaxi from airport to hotel 31 USD with Charley’s Taxis. Took less than 30 minutes to get there. Can make online reservation.Bus to Pearl Harbor Museum 5.50 USD one day adult ticket. (Children 5 or under do not need tickets). Take the No. 42 bus direct to the museum. Took about 1 hour with no changes.Bus to Waikele Premium Outlets 5.50 USD one day adult ticket. Took about 1h20m with 1 change. Take the E bus, then change to the 433 bus.Bus to Diamond Head 5.50 USD one day adult ticket. Took about 20 minutes with no changes. Take the number 2 bus to Kapiolani Community College (KCC) and walk from there. Takes about 1 hour to walk up and down the main trail once there. There is a 1 USD entry fee per person including children.Pink trolley is free for JCB card holders. Before you go to Hawaii, see if your credit card provider can give you another card with JCB instead of VISA. Then you can get free trolley rides when needed between Ala Moana and Waikiki.(If you found this review useful, why not take a look at my books available on Amazon "Hanatoki: Japan Flower Shop", "Winning Sports Betting Strategies" and "Big Data Betting" by Tom Whitaker.)Once again, thank you so much to Marlon, Rick and Mike for saving my anniversary trip. I highly recommend this hotel for anybody considering staying in Waikiki.

I decided to do a staycation in Waikiki with my mother and 2yr old. We are local Kama'aina but we haven't stayed in Waikiki for over 8yrs. This location was perfect for us! Off the loud noisy Waikiki hustle and bustle and in walking distance to International Marketplace and Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center. Staff was very friendly upon check-in they accommodated me with a slight early check-in because my daughter was throwing a fit in the lobby! (Nap Time)...we enjoyed the nice cool room at end of the night and even though we stayed for just the weekend we wished we stayed one more night! We will definitely come back and stay again and explore Waikiki!

Had the pleasure of staying at the Aqua Skyline Hotel during a recent conference in Waikiki. Great amenities such as the pool, jacuzzi, and store on the 6th floor. Such great facility staff! Highly recommend if you need a great place to stay!

Mahalo to the staff and management of Aqua Skyline at Island Colony. Took my family for the last weekend of summer. Upon check in, the front desk was very pleasant and helpful, providing us helpful tips and towel service for the use at the pool. We immediately got settled and headed to the pool. How relaxing in the hot tub and how much fun my girls had in the spacious sized pool. We swam till dark. More swimming in the morning and returned to a nice clean room with fresh towels and a tidy room. What a wonderful weekend. We look forward to our next staycation at the Aqua Skyline at Island Colony.Mahalo, Ohana Kaai

Located in the heart of Waikiki. Three minute walk to the International Market Place, ten minute walk to the beach, shopping and food galore, and a great place to stay. Friendly, knowledgeable staff that treat you like family. 5 Stars!!

Nice 2 queen beds room. Good service. Nice pool, chairs and day beds. Provide beach towels and beach chairs. Near the canal. Close to bus, stores and restaurants. Can walk to go to Waikiki Beach or Honolulu Zoo

We rented a private condo here for 9 days through Kaina Hale Hawaii Realty in June &July 2019.We were very pleased with the location, only 1 block back from Kalakaua Ave. Very quiet and clean. Everything we needed was supplied in this condo. Plenty of room for a family of 4.A Mini-mart on the 6th floor was so handy for everyday purchases such as milk and water, along with bread, laundry detergent and alcohol. Kaina Hale Realty were very good to deal with, so quick and efficient with their communication. Highly recommend renting through them.

Clean place had no problems. Big pool and bbq area. It’s a self contained place which was what we were after. Everything was walking distance. Beach 10min walk shops and buses 5mins. Rent a car was just next to us. Great location

These condos are clean and spacious. The location is excellent. Thank you to all of the friendly, helpful staff and special "thank you" to Steve! We checked in on our anniversary & Steve made arrangements to have a wine bottle and chocolates waiting for us in our room. Our room was #2413 (1king bed/ 1 twin sofa bed) and you get all the amenities you need. We were a family of 2 adults/1 child but 2 adults and 2 children will fit comfortablyl. Our only complain is the wall AC was incredibly noisy and made some nights difficult to get good rest, and the condensation drained into a bucket on the balcony so needed to ask maintenance to empty it out every couple of days.This is a budget friendly place, if you're looking for a resort feel..this is not the place for you. We look forward to staying here again in the future.

Clean and well maintained room with a great view. Decent sized pool. Very friendly and helpful staff. Wish I had the shampoo/shower gel at home. Delish! Love the louver windows to capture the high rise breeze. Shop on level 6 had cheap bottles of water but everything else seemed expensive. Try the iced coffees in the foyer as they were fabulous and addictive. The DVD hire feature was great, especially since we travelled with a toddler.

Everyone that we came into contact with, from the front desk to the housekeeping were very friendly & helpful. Rooms were clean and comfy. The view was amazing. We will Definitely be back from Cali...

I've stayed at the Aqua Skyline many times and it's a nice, clean hotel with friendly staff and breathtaking views from the rooftop! You can check it out when they have their cocktail mixers up there. I'll keep booking Aqua Skyline every time I come back

We booked this hotel for a family vacation - two separate rooms, as my parents were also traveling with us. The price was right and the pictures on the website looked nice. We were wrong - when we arrived I thought we were at the wrong hotel. The hotel hallways were dated and the rooms were even worse. They were filthy, the curtains had holes in them and mould was growing along the edge of the tub. We could have moved hotels but we would had to pay an arm and a leg as we booked though a 3rd party - so we tried to not be in our rooms as much as possible. The only good thing about this hotel was the pool, fast elevators and friendly staff. My parents room had cockroaches and we overheard another couple complain about what likely was bedbugs. We will never stay at this location again.

Found this hotel/residence tower thru my timeshare travel agency who gave it good reviews . Great price For an efficiency room with a small kitchenette and great views from the lanai. The facility had a weight room, laundry facility, hot tub and pool with grilling facility and a small convenience store. It was off the beaten path and very quiet. We will stay there again as it’s easy walking distance from the main strip. The hotel in cleaning staff were extremely nice and accommodating.

My husband and I stayed here from 16/4 - 19/4 prior to catching our Carnival Cruise. Our room number was 3110 on the 31sr floor. Amazing views fromthe balcony. You can see the mountains to the left of you and the sea to the right. When booking ask for a room as high up as you can get. We arrived late after a delay at Los Angeles airport. The check in was very smooth and easy, the guy on reception was very friendly and helpful, even though it was 1 am. First impressions was, the room was a little tired from wear and tear, so could do with a little refurb. However it was very clean, we had everything we needed and the beds were very comfortable. The towels were really white and fluffy which is always a plus. Main lounge was very comfortable. The hotel is in a excellent location, 5 mins walk to Waikiki Beach, has ample shops, cheap and high end stores. Plenty of ABC stores where your can get all your souvenirs and practically anything you need. We visited the Cheesecake Factory which is a few mins walk from Waikiki beach. The meals were amazing, huge portions so we actually didn’t have enough room to have a cheesecake as a desert.I would definitely recommend this hotel. It is a fair 3 stars rating which is reflected in the price. We hope to return some day.

We loved staying is our studio apartment. It was clean, kitchen had everything we needed and well priced.The onsite management is very good and the place is secure.The pool area was spacious, the BBQs looked after and the gym and laundry were a good size.So close to everything you could possibly need.

We were on the 46th floor and had an amazing view of the city. The hotel is older, but well kept. Our room was clean and spacious and had a coffee maker, stove-top, microwave oven and refrigerator for our convenience. Hotel amenities included a hot tub, swimming pool on the 6th floor, open to the outdoors and a great place to lay out ant get some sun. Parking was a tad expensive as the hotel does not have private parking, you are forced to find parking elsewhere. The closest garage is right next to the hotel and is $25 per day for hotel guests, who are getting a $5 discount from the regular price of $30. All in all, we had a good time visiting Honolulu and the Aqua Skyline was fairly priced.

Stayed in an AirBnB on level 41. Check-in was smooth, the staff very helpful. The lady in the coffee shop very friendly, and nice coffee. The pool deck is huge and the pool well kept, never had a problem finding a lounge to lay on. We didn’t use the bbq facilities but they looked good. Having a laundry and general store on 6th floor was very handy. The shop is open until midnight! We had amazing views and managed to see the Friday fireworks from our large lanai. Location is very good, walking distance to most places in Waikiki. Would definitely stay here again.

Here is everything you need to know about our stay @ Aqua Skyline. First off, why 3-in-1? That's because our group consisted of 3 families all with small children and we stayed at 3 different floors/rooms. Therefore, I will include the experiences of what I've seen and heard from the 2 other rooms plus our own. The building/rooms: The building went up in 1979 and depending on which room you get, you might feel like you walked into the era when it's built. The furnishing, decor, bathroom fixtures all seemed like the original. The wife wasn't happy when first walked in however, the view won me over pretty quickly and her the next day. There are 2 types of rooms, studios with kitchenette or 1-bedroom with full kitchen, our party opted for the full kitchen. Full-size fridge, oven/range and microwave was present along with full supplies of dishware and utensils. All the rooms that end in 20 & 21 and in 00 & 01, are in my opinion, are the BEST. They are 1-bedrooms with the best views especially 21's as they face Waikiki in the living room and Diamond Head in the bedroom. Our room was 3621 and you can check out the photos below. The building has a mix residence, other than unit owners, the front desk also help manage short-term, long-term as well as AirBnB, therefore you will see people with different keyfobs/access cards. Rooms ending in 00 and 01 faces Ala Wai canal in the living room however 01's can see Downtown in the bedroom. Our friends stayed in 2801 and 2501 and their units were upgraded to more modern furnishing with new kitchen, floors, bathrooms etc. 2501 found 1 cockroach on day one and that was the only our entire group saw for 10 nights. You need a keycard to get access to the building, elevators as well as the pool and gym. Enterprise is located within the same building around the back which was super convenient as they share the same car park. Parking was $25/night for hotel guest. The resort fee was also $25 a night (yikes). There is a convenient store ran by some friendly Korean ladies on the 6th floor and bottled water is cheap there.Grab beach towels and chairs from the lobby before you head out and return it at the end of the day as they do track who and how many. Our unit 3621 had drainage issue upon check-in and their maintenance guy had already gone home for the night. However, they made the effort to send someone at a specific time the next day and the issue was resolved.Housekeeping did a good job every time we needed them and lady stocked lots of towels at least 10 pieces of mix sizes. However they knock early, like 9 AM early, I guess we were used to the afternoon ones like in Mexico. The location: Although it located at the "back" of Waikiki alongside Ala Wai Bvd, it only a 5-7 min walk to Kalakaua Ave, and it's located in central Waikiki via Seaside Ave so you are right in the middle to food/shopping and away from East Waikiki where things can get more sketchy. At no time did we ever felt unsafe around the hotel. Biki Bike rentals were located across the street along Ala Wai.The staff: WOW is what I have to say, prob one of the friendliest team of staff I've ever seen and they take ownership of your problems and questions. Special shoutout: Dan, Michael and Steve (I think that's what Steven Aoki will look like when he's older). In conclusion: I rate this hotel 3.5/5 because our suite was old, however, the view really made up for the shortcomings. Had our unit been fixed up like 25/2801 then I would bump up the score to 4.5/5. The price itself isn't "cheap" for what you get, but that's the price you pay to stay in paradise unless you want to fork out 400-600 for upscale hotels. The staff really is what made this place special!

We stayed at Island Colony for the full duration of our trip, 9 nights. The hotel was in a great location with balcony views to the mountains and only minutes walk to shops/ Waikiki beach and a lovely coffee shop in the lobby.With the mixed reviews of the property we were quite sceptical. However, from arrival until departure the hotel front desk staff were always very helpful.We did encounter upon checking in, there were further charges of a daily hotel fee we needed to pay of which was not stated or charge at the time we originally booked through Agoda that had already been paid in full.We stayed in a Studio Kitchenette room on the 19thfloor. Our room was surprisingly large with plenty of space which was great. House keeping serviced our room daily, no issues with cleanliness. The room was equipped with a fridge, microwave, stove, kettle and utensils which was very useful.The only downside to the room was there was no ceiling light in the bedroom. We relied on the bedside lamp, floor lamp and entrance light to light up the room once sun went down. There was also no kitchen sink, we’d had to use the basin in the bathroom as a sink as well.Other than that, we didn’t have any major issues.   The property has just the amenities you need, a pool and spa, a gym, a convenient store and a 24/7 self service laundry room all on the one level.Overall a pleasant stay.

I came across difficulties with my flights and work and had to constantly call and get information to resolve this. Under pressure and stress Dan was an absolute pleasure to deal with. He was polite patient and helped calm me down. A genuine guy and a real asset to the hotel.:)

We chose this hotel based on trip advisors rating of 4 but we were sadly disappointed. We stayed on the 8th floor, March 2019, our room stank badly and we killed two cockroaches. We notified the front desk and they sent a maintenance guy up with a can of raid. We killed another one three days later.. would not recommend this building in its current state.

once I found the hotel/condo it was great. Nice staff and clean room with easy walk to Waikiki. My room had views of the mountains, Ala Wai canal (which is a great place to watch the out rigger teams practice), and even nightly fireworks over the Hilton Hawaiian Village

We stayed in the Aqua Skyline at Island colony in mid january of 2019 for fourteen days and it was a great place to stay. The hotel is close to all the amenities that we needed. Close to buss stops , grocery stores and walking distance everywhere in Wakakii. The service at the desk ,the cleaning people and the minor maintaince people workers is great. Unfortunately, the furnishings were worn, dated, and uncomfortable, which made relaxing an unpleasant experience. We were told to contact the owner, which became a unending quest, and has still been unresolved.Another issue we had was when we booked, the price displayed an average $225 a day, but after paying all the additional fees it ended up at $305 a day on my CC statement. Make sure you check all the hidden fees before booking, as well as the reviews.

If we want to economize for a long stay, we stay here and we liked how laid back it is here. The staff were friendly and just cool. The facilities are good, how I wish they'll be less of that water interruption really.

We have stayed at the Skyline several times. The location is terrific, costs are pretty reasonable and the staff is great. This was the first time we had an issue. I would recommend avoiding rooms ending in 03 or 05, they are too close to the trash chute at the smell can be challenging. Although this hotel isn't right on the water like some other properties, it only takes ~7 minutes to walk there. The trade-off is that you have better access to local shops and places to eat, which is great if you want to explore the area rather than just the beach. If you're just looking for quickest/easiest beach access, consider a hotel closet to the ocean if a 7 minute walk is too far. Otherwise this location is great.

Location is good, backs onto Ala Moana Canal, 3 blocks from beach. We booked a studio kitchenette so we could make breakfast and snacks. Room was clean with generic but modern decor. Note...we booked through the hotel and not one of the condos offered by private owners. We had a minor issue with the balcony door and it was repaired within 10 minutes of us calling the desk. And when we mentioned the bathroom fan was rather noisy he took a look, removed the fan and returned within 20 minutes with a new motor that barely made a sound. That’s service!

We checked in for my wifey birthday staycation.the receptionist was really good and friendly. I asked him if we can move upper floor. Only those with card keys can open the door and even the elevator.one of the best hotel condo in waikiki. Thumbs up ..

We love the Aqua Skyline At The Island Colony in Waikiki, HI. The staff are helpful and friendly. If you are looking for a quality and comfortable hotel, then the Island Colony is just for you. However, if you are looking for an expensive fancy hotel, you should probably try the Ritz, Trump, or Hilton Hawaiian Village. This recently updated hotel sits back on the canal (so it’s a little quieter at night), but, it is only 2 blocks from the beach and right in the middle of Waikiki's best shopping and dining. The Island Colony is the tallest building in Waikiki, 44 floors. The updated, clean, and comfortable studios and one bedroom suites offer well equipped kitchenettes with spectacular panoramic views of Waikiki's skyline, Diamond Head, and the ocean. There is a coffee shop located in the lobby with limited hours. Hotel registration is open 24/7. The 24/7 maned security desk is in the elevator lobby. You must use your room key to enter the hotel/elevator lobby and to retrieve an elevator... this made me feel safe. There is an on-site mini market, laundry facility, Gym, barbecue area, pool, Jacuzzi, and sauna. This hotel has Free WiFi, free movie rentals, and free newspapers. On-site parking is available for a daily fee. Honestly, you won’t even need a Rent-A-Car. But, if you want to venture out of Waikiki, may I recommend just a day use rental car at the enterprise located just downstairs. Everything is pretty much within walking distance. Or, the Aqua Resorts offers a free 30 minute shuttle with several stops in Waikiki and at the Ala Moana shopping center located just outside of Waikiki. Just down the street from the shopping center you can find a Super Walmart and the Convention Center is located about a block away too. Otherwise, The Bus system is very convenient. This hotel does have a Resort Fee now. Also worth mentioning is that the Island Colony management offers guests access to the roof top once a week for free cocktails and appetizers. Also, most of the west facing higher floor rooms are able to watch the free Friday night firework show.
