Travelled for +20 hours. Staff not helpful with early check-in options. I'm in business attire (not like the other shirtless beach bums walking around), and closed my eyes in the chair in the lobby. Got woke up and asked to leave the lobby if I couldn't stay awake while waiting for my room. Looking for some other place to spend my money where I won't inconvenience the staff! Not impressed at all with this place ($25 per day parking also).

We arrived on a tuesday in time to enjoy mai tai tuesday on the rooftop. Our 42nd floor room and balcony provided splendid views. Hotel parking and security made us feel comfortable. Amenities were just as described. Room service was reliable. Concierge was most helpful.With grocery stores, beach, restaurants, first class shopping all within walking distance, we explored the area in a different direction each day. Though we didnt take advantage, local bicycle rental stop was nearby. Hotel was convenient for pickups to polenesian cultural center as well as novictor helicopter tour of island. Even found St. Augustine by the Sea church, home of St. Damien museum, a doable walk away.

Located next to the canal with nice view over the golf course in one direction and the ocean the other way. Helpful staff in the reception. Pool, jacuzzi, laundry machines and an on-site convenience store. Balconies for enjoying breakfast or an evening drink. Our one bedroom apartment was clean and fresh. Daily cleaning was included in the rent. Walking distance to everything in Waikiki. Good wifi. Good value for money.

We were expecting a King Bed and an Ocean Front View, we ended up with 2 Queens and a Panoramic View, which we did have somewhat of an Ocean view and then a side view... It was not what we were looking for, but then again, it was not all that bad, considering we were not there to live in the room, but have a place to sleep and shower.. So we still had a somewhat nice view.

This is not a luxury place so if you are expecting high end service you will not like it.However if you want good value in a central location you should be happy.We enjoy having a kitchen and the added space of the one bedroom units, but the studios are quite adequate if you do not cook much.The lanais ( balconies) are very large in the majority of rooms, a few have extended the interior at the loss of the balcony. We spend a lot of time sitting on the balcony and enjoy our meals while looking at the view.The pool is large by hotel standards and there is also a hot tub, although of course it could do to be hotter. Lots of lounges and some cabanas to hide in the shade if you like.There are very good barbecues and some picnic tables for your use. Two ice machines supply plenty of ice.The laundry is on the same floor as the pool so you can relax by the pool while the washer and then dryer are going.Also a small convenience store on pool level.The lobby has a nice snack bar for light lunch items., newspaper is supplied daily and there are books in the lobby, help yourself.Enterprise rent a car is on site.located on ala wai and seaside corner you are two blocks from the main street (kalakau). Also one block from kuhio for catching the bus.All around this is a good place to stay.

City and partially ocean view from room 4204. Location is excellently my fav udon shop is around the corner. Starbuck for the ones who love it 2 minute walk and the a max 10 min walk to the beach.Love the high rise. 6th floor has a pool with a few cabanas, washing machine, bbq, gym and wrap around the building chill area.Room could be a little bit more cleaner. Windows, vent in the bathroom, and corners of the bed next to the mattress are bit dusty.Washing dishes in the sink in the shower is a bit .Staff very nice.7/10

This place was absolutely terrible!!!Checked in with night staff was beyond slow after a 12 hour flight. He was talking about sports with security for about 20 minutes before he decided to help us. We get our keys to the two rooms booked one room was filthy pubes in the shower, uncleaned bedsheets (with brown stain), moldy smell in the room absolutely nasty.After using room keys once I go downstairs to get the rest of my luggage and wait about 15 minutes for the elevator to finally arrive ( This is each way you will wait 15 minutes ). Some time elapsed and I'm outside the room trying to get back into our second room KEY DOES NOT WORK (this is important because I have to ride the elevator 11 more times to finally bring staff up with a working key).I am exhausted at this point and just want to sleep don't have time to find another hotel room at 4am with my whole family. They also took forever bringing up at metal yes metal baby crib. No way would I let my one year old sleep in that thing and possibly get hurt smh.In another note the parking there is a separate company which is equally as terrible. Finally get sleep wake up the next morning and call the hotel front desk to tell them we are checking out early and not staying the rest of the 8 days. He cannot do anything about it as the hotel manager doesn't arrive til 11am. This is unacceptable I contact the third party we booked this through they argued with the hotel and could not so anything either this manager got there. (Will never use hotels.com again after that) I did finally get a refund but only for 7 of the 8 days because we stayed there for a night was in vacation and couldn't waste more time arguing over a couple thousand doallrs since this is a 12k+ vacation as it is. Since I don't want to keep on with my rant here's the low down :Slow elevatorRude night staff / incompetent (minus two employees who were very nice)Horrible parkingDirty roomNo bellhopsMoldy smellDangerous looking baby cribExtremely unorganized hotelVerdict: wasted two whole vacation days in Hawaii one was the night we stayed here and the second was getting all the stuff repacked and dealing with moving to the Hilton. Who wants to be this stressed out in Hawaii???

This is not what could be considered a "Hotel as such" it is a mix of permanent residents accommodation, hotel style accommodation and Air BnB. In saying this, you are getting accommodation at a cheaper rate. Our room was clean and spacious with a small kitchenette to allow you to self cater. The bathroom was ridiculously small though and the shower head low but overall clean. The front desk staff are helpful but the ridiculous 3pm check in is a joke, especially when your flight gets in at 0600, but this seems the norm in Honolulu. Would recommend you book the room for the day before if your flight lands early. They did allow us to store our luggage during the day, allowing us to explore Waikiki. The bed was a king size but I found it along with the pillows, firm, but that is an individual thing. Aqua Skyline is ideally located being within 2 minute walk of places to eat and drink. There is a convenience store located on site which is a bonus along with a cafe in the lobby, be warned though, it's expensive. Car rental available on site and parking which is also expensive, park on the upper levels as the car parks are tiny on the first level and we came across numerous guests unable to get out as their vehicles were boxed in by bigger cars and pickups. Ask for a room facing the golf course and higher up as the noise is horendous in Waikiki. The pool and Jacuzzi were nice and towels were available at the pool, you could also get towels from the front desk if you were wanting to go the beach which is about a 10 minute walk. I don't think asking guests to pay a $25 USD resort fee is fair, considering we weren't able to use any of the facilities on the first day and last day considering we couldn't get into our room until after 3pm and were picked up at 0400 to catch our flight home. Would we stay here again? Well that would depend if I ever returned to Hawaii which I probably wouldn't, I found it to be overpriced, noisy and to be honest I could find 20 beaches in Victoria that are as good, if not better than any l had seen in Oahu never mind any number of beaches in Queensland that in my opinion are better. If I was to return though I would probably stay at the Aqua Skyline Island Colony for its price and location, if you are wanting that full hotel experience though were someone takes your bags to your room, room service etc, this is not the place for you. Hope this review helps you in making your decision.

Worst hotel that we’ve stayed in. Dirty, cockroaches and garbage chute on every floor. The pictures are deceiving, does not look anything like it. If you stay at this sub standard hotel, your holiday will be ruined.

Loved Island Colony, location was amazing. Our suite was exactly what was in pictures proviced. Only downfall was the lack of sound proofing in the building. We could hear the neighbours music/tv/even talking. It's on a very busy street as well so we could hear the traffic like we were sleeping on the street even with a condo on the 40th floor :(

We stayed here for 8 nights recently. Very good location. Close to the beach, resturants and shopping. friendly staff. The hotel is a bit dated. A small shop on the 6th floor with drinks and snacks. I would stay there again. Free cocktails on the roof at 5pm on Tuesdays.

I read many reviews before booking the hotel. But its really not a hotel. Its an apartment block where rooms are rented out. So if you are looking for resort features you will be disappointed. There are positives. Its in a pretty good location in terms of value for money. Its a secure building and the staff were okay. Its got a nice coffee shop in the lobby and the general store on level 6 was well stocked and reasonably priced (similar to ABC pricing). The pool and spa were very good as was the furniture in the pool area. The bed was comfy. The negatives .... it didn't have that holiday fun feeling to it. Most of the people around the pool were residents in the building and appeared to be largely retirees. Nothing wrong with that and I spoke with many who were lovely people. The biggest issue for me was the AC in the rooms. I was in room 1007 and it was painfully noisy. I thought many reviews were exaggerating, but this was the noisiest AC I have heard. My daughter and her family was in room 1019 and had the same issue. As well she was disappointed in the cleanliness of her unit and the bath room in particular on arrival.

We liked our stay, as far as Honolulu goes, you get the feeling this is as quiet as it gets. The room was modern, clean and comfortable. Good amenities such as fridge, iron, big tv, hair dryer. Bed was comfy and if it wasn't for a very very noisy air con unit (that didn't seem to pump out cool air despite it being on 52 degrees, it was nice enough. If you can get on a higher floor I imagine it would be much quieter. We were on floor 8 overlooking the pool and it was noisy. For some reason they have slatted glass windows, meaning you can always hear what's going on outside. We had a group on a nearby Lanai and they were up until the early hours being loud and we had noway of escaping the noise. Pool looked nice, but had lots of families down there so we didn't use it, but were only here for a night before a flight out.Parking is $25 which is pretty standard for the area, easy to find a spot and park yourself. The hotel is a short walk from all the Waikiki hubbub so if you want a short walk but slightly away from all the busy side of Waikiki its a good choice.

This Condo was just a very short distance to Waikiki and from the balcony, we overlooked Diamond Head, a fantastic view. The condo had everything we needed, it was in a nice looking building with very good parking facilities, and 24hr laundry availability.The furniture was in good condition and was very comfortable. The shower was nice and hot.Our host, Sam, was very helpful and good company. We had some nice chats.

The hotel is nice. I really like the view from the high floor - city view is incredible! Complimentary breakfast is given. Staff are friendly! The location is perfect - close to all good restaurants in waikiki (I really like the udon place) and shopping center galleria. The beach is walking distance just a few blocks!

We were recently in Hawaii for about 10 days (Dec 2017) and we stayed in the Aqua Skyline hotel cum resort. I only have all good things to say about this hotel and its front desk staff Ms. Suki. The hotel offers amazing views and a great kitchenette that came in very very handy for us. The Front desk and guest services were very accommodative of our requests and provided us with Utensils etc. to suit our needs. Ms. Suki at the Front Desk was extremely courteous, remarkably nice and friendly to the hotel guests, and the hotel management should be very proud of employing such excellent staff like Suki who made our first Hawaii trip very memorable. Ms. Suki is one of the reasons I would absolutely go back to this hotel again on my next trip to Hawaii/Honolulu. The proximity of this hotel to the Waikiki Beach is perfect for the price, and the parking at this hotel comes at a very nominal rate of $25 per day compared to exorbitantly high parking prices that prevails around this neighborhood. The rooms are clean and well maintained. We loved the balcony, especially at the higher floors. The hot tub is quite big and is very nice. The Pool area is at the sixth floor level and has some nice shades and cushions to enjoy a sun bath. The laundry (washer/dryer) is very nominally priced and there is a convenience store on premise. The parking lot is integrated into the hotel, though operated by a third party. It is a covered multi-level parking facility. We walked to Waikiki beach through the International Market Place Mall and it takes just about 5 to 7 minutes to get to the Waikiki beach from the hotel. The hotel room key card is sensitive, so remember to keep it away from other electronics or magnetic stripes such as credit cards, chargers etc. I would strongly recommend this hotel to any type of travelers such as individuals, couples and families. The Kitchennette comes with a Two-top electric range, electric Rice cooker, a microwave, refrigerator, with utensils such as frying pan, boiling pan, tea mugs, glass cups, bowls, spatulas, spoons, cutting board, knife, Can/Opener etc. The room has a window A/C, which may look smaller but was able to cool the room very chill – more than what we could ask for and comes with a AC remote so you don’t have to get up from the bed to adjust it. if you are lucky you may get free public road-side parking along the Canal by the side of the hotel - make sure you read the parking sign as there are certain days you need to remove your car at 7 am after an overnight parking. This hotel also houses private condominiums, so some of the rooms with a hard lock in some floors are privately owned. A very busy and safe place and we freely walked as a family at all times of the day and night at wee hours!

Great location and room had space for three adults. Good comfortable beds and very clean. Exhaust vent in bathroom needs to be vacuumed. We made use of the fridge and microwave and crockery but did not use the cook-top. Service staff were great at cleaning the room and providing fresh towels etc. Room was an upgrade on the 44 (PH) level and had magnificent views to the beach and Diamond Head. Reception staff were all friendly and helpful, especially Teri who checked us in and organised the upgrade.AC unit was old style through the wall and a little noisy but did its job of cooling well. Condensation drained into a bucket on the balcony/lanai and we needed to keep an eye on the amount of water and empty it a few times before it overflowed across the floor and would have cascaded down the building!Handy to have small convenience store on site and pool area and bbq facilities great. Laundry open air with plenty of machines but you do have to purchase a non-refundable card for $5 to then load value on for using washers and dryers.Appreciated complimentary drinks and nibbles on floor 45 on one night of our stay with views in all directions. Easy walk to shops, restaurants and Waikiki Beach. Bus stop nearby to catch public buses to Pearl Harbour etc.Shuttle bus to Ala Moana Shopping Centre was handy.

You know, a hotel with 740 rooms takes in a lot of cash in a resort like Waikiki Beach, Even if it's a condo type of operation there's still plenty of money for the management company to keep the property spic and span, but the downside of a condo operation is that nobody wants to spend that type of money, neither the management company nor the owners.It's not like the Hyatt or the Sheraton where they have entire departments looking after guest satisfaction.So what you get is this type of animal, where nobody really cares as long as they get their income from it. It's like living in a condo yourself ; if the condo management council wants to upgrade, they have to raise an assessment and nobody wants to pay.This is obviously what's happening with this place, it could be so much better if it was run as as a hotel but that's not going to happen.I enjoyed my stay but my comments below will flesh things out.Everything is dated from the 70's and the pool wouldn't be out of place in one of those minimum security prisons. The water was cold and I could have got more agitation out of the jacuzzi if I used a swizzle stick!Don't expect a Hawaiian type welcome when you check in, it's just a vertical motel, the staff aren't paid to put on any form of show and so they don't.They're very pleasant people but they're like Government employees, they just do what's necessary to make sure you get settled in.But for $150 a night at an all inclusive posh resort in Mexico or Spain you get ten times the value, plus a warm pool and nightly entertainment (and food).You can't put that down to low wages in those countries, as I'm sure the hotel staff here in Hawaii are at the bottom of the scale too. There's two other things that are off-putting about this place .The first being that the reception area has all of the atmosphere of a Greyhound Bus Terminal, it's dated , forlorn and the furniture could have come straight from the Thrift Store, just sitting on it makes you feel a bit icky.The fact that the cafe is closed adds to a general impression of neglect, you feel like making a bid for the kitchen equipmentThe second one is the imposition of the daily "amenities fee" something that the profiteers dreamed up in Vegas that has spread like a virus to Hawaii.Why should I pay an extra $20 a day for stuff that should be the bread and butter service of a resort hotel? It's imposed like a ransom fee at check in (cash only) and if you don't want to pay it, then sleep next to the hobos on the Waikiki beachfront !Include it in the overall price for goodness sake! ( they probably can't do it because of the condo nature of the ownership- each room has a separate wifi access code)Despite all of these shortcomings it's still not a bad place to stay, the housekeeping staff did a good job, the sentry/receptionists at the front desk were very nice, if a little lacking in tourism skills and I'll have happy memories of staying there.With a little bit of dynamism from Aqua's management strategy this could be a much better place, for very little outlay they could spruce up the reception and pool areas and they could get away with charging a little bit more , everybody could be happier , staff, management AND guests

Considering the price you pay this hotel was great. Nothing fancy but rooms were a decent size, room was clean and bed was comfortable. I had a decent balcony with nice views back to the mountains. Much quieter than an expensive beachfront place I stayed at.Two easily walked blocks to the beach. My brother and his fiancé were upgraded to a beach facing room and had the most amazing view. Looked out over the whole of Waikiki (well a lot of it). My only issue was my shower had a really low shower head. I at 5'9 only just fit under the shower head, my brother hopped in as a joke and it was hitting his chest. It was adequate for me though considering I was staying my myself.If you're looking for a room on a bit of a budget I would recommend this place.

We stayed 1 night here and for us it was a great affordable stop over in a great location. I would prefer to stay at a nicer hotel if I was staying for longer. It was reasonably clean but just didn't feel like a relaxing holiday hotel but you get what you pay for! It was noisy but not overly. Great location just a short walk to the main area.

Arrived at Island Colony in the evening and first thing we saw outside were a group of men that were drunk and it seemed they were homeless.Check in was fine. On way up to room, there was another drunk person in the elevator with us. Hallways were very dingy.Room as it was advertised and looked OK. Deadlock on door was broken- therefore not able to use it.The feeling we had at this point was this place was not safe and were afraid to go down to lobby alone. Not good feeling.As we slept I was bitten by bed bugs, on legs. Bites had to be medically treated!That was it - we were out of there by early morning.HORRIBLE BEGINNING TO A HOLIDAY.DON'T EVEN BOTHER. FAR FROM STRIP AND BEACH(I have travelled alot and never had a experience like this)We were even charged a 2 day penalty for leaving early and company has not even responded to my agent emails.KEEP AWAY

I generally opt for the penthouse or higher level apartments. The views are spectacular and the units are perfect for a holiday- including kitchen.They have security desk and it feels really safe.The main pluses for me are: on-site convenience store (sells everything you need) and the pool/spa and BBQ areas. There seems to be so much room that it doesnt feel overly populated.

People are helpful and professional. Within easy walking to main Waikiki attractions as well as beach. Easy to take any of the buses for shopping. There is no restaurant on the premises but it does not deter from the attractiveness of the place as many restaurants within easy walking distance.

Myself and three friends stayed here in 2016. We booked two rooms on higher floor and to the back of the hotel. We got exactly what we had asked for , but after the first night my friends who had a beautiful big corner room found it to be a little noisy because of road traffic. We mentioned this at the front desk the next day and it was no problem at all to move them to another room. All rooms and balconies were fairly large , modern and clean, as was the overall whole hotel. Great pool area with bbq's and a convenient little shop that sold everything ! Lobby area was huge with comfortable lounges and seating with a nice cafe'. Hotel security was another one of those extra little things , at night security were at a desk watching people entering and exiting and you had to use your room card to enter the foyer and then the lifts to your room. Location was fantastic and close to everything yet far enough away from the noise and action on "Kuhio". The best part about this hotel is the friendly and more than helpfull staff , nothing was ever a problem. An example of this was when one of my friends had trouble with her phone and was wanting to contact home as her father was in hospital having an operation. The girl at the front desk actually let her use her personal phone , rang the number and passed it to her so she could talk to her family. I was amazed by the girls concern and help ! I have been to Hawaii many times and stayed in alot of different hotels , Aqua Skyline ticks all the boxes and for the price it would be the best hotel by far that I have ever stayed in. I will be seeing you again Skyline , hopefully very soon !

Aqua Skyline is a short walk away from the centre of Waikiki. Rooms were reasonable, air conditioning was quite loud, pool was great, it was nice to have a convenience store for emergency purchases. The hotel staff let us check in early which was very nice after a long-haul flight and travelling with a toddler. What was also good was that they have a free DVD-rental system, so this definitely came in handy with our little one.

I previously stayed at this hotel a year ago and there is no denying that the views you receive when booking a panoramic ocean view studio are second to none. However, I had provided some constructive feedback regarding my stay. Not often does a hotel care enough to follow up on feedback, but surprisingly Aqua Skyline at Island Colony did. Their hotel manager Brian Kovaloff promptly contacted me in response to my feedback, addressed the issues and requested I try the hotel again. Brian then promptly put me in touch with Guest Services Manager Marlon Henobio. Management clearly care about the reputation of their hotel and the satisfaction of their guests. I am so glad I gave this hotel another chance because my stay was superb. We received superior customer service and great level of communication. We visit Hawaii every year and will certainly be returning to this hotel. I can't thank management enough for making this trip one to remember. We also absolutely love this hotel, not only because of the amazing views, but the ease of access to transport, tours and shopping. Thanks Aqua Skyline for making our holiday just that, a holiday! The Aqua chain of hotels is definitely for us.

I arrived for a 6 day/5 night stay and was very disappointed. I got sick during my flight from Florida and arrived to an undesirable hotel. I had a weird feeling before my trip and thought I should change my hotel, but decided against it because maybe I was overthinking. I should have followed my first instinct. The hotel was not up to my standards. I booked this hotel based off the pictures and the few good reviews, but those pictures must have been taken over 10 years ago. The first room had a full kitchenette which would have been fine, but everything looked unclean, and the a/c unit gave no directions for turning it on. The curtain was broken so I couldn't even close it all the way and the tub was Nasty. I called the front desk and was told that I could move me to another room. Once I got into the second room, the sheets were spotted and nasty. I got a call from the front desk asking was it okay, I told him no and explained the sheets and again a nasty tub. He sent housekeeping who said that it looked fine and they should have changed the sheets, but she would. She left and I called Delta to find another hotel, I would not touch anything but the chair at the desk and the phone (probably what made me worse). The housekeeper came back up and only wanted to change the top sheet until I asked was she going to change all of them, she said it was new, well I looked at her funny and then she pulled off all the sheets, there were crumbs, possibly bugs, and hair on the sheets. I was DISGUSTED. I knew I could not stay there one night, let alone 5. Needless to say, Delta found another hotel close by and I left. To think they also charge $18.95 a day as a resort fee. I advise anyone to stay somewhere else, do not book this hotel.

My fiancée and I stayed here for 6 nights and had an amazing stay. We had an ocean view kitchenette on the 34th floor. The view was out of this world and the room was very modern, clean and tidy! Staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The internet wasn't working at the start but the staff were quick to fix this issue and get it working for us. Only a short walk to the beach, I think it's in a great location with shops and restaurants all around. I would definitely stay here again. The only negatives I have is that the aircon is way too loud and is hard to sleep with it on and there was no kettle to make a tea or coffee. Besides that, we had a great time!!

Unfortunately this place just doesn't deliver. Room 805 should be condemned - how can they put anyone in there?????. After complaining of the smell of the rubbish shoot and dirty floors (white towel on a wet floor was black!) we were reluctantly moved to room 820. I was dry reaching every time we went to our room! Well 820 was better but only just / the bathroom sliding door was broken, bathtub was peeling!. The only great thing here is the pool of which we lived in because we couldn't stand being in our room. I will never stay here again!

This was a spur of the moment overnight stay to celebrate our 12 yr anniversary. They accommodated us splendidly even though last minute. We reached out to front desk and was assisted by Brian Sherman and had some requests before checking in. We were pleasantly surprised to see all of our requests already in our room even before checking in. Very nice amenities for our ohana and we enjoyed the overnight stay thoroughly. Courteous and quick service here. Mahalo!!!!!

This place is awesome..we come here every other month for 3 day weekendsThis place is in a great central location The rates are great The rooms are clean and in pristine condition The service amazing alwasy This is a perfect spot .....

The reason I chose this condo was because it had a kitchenette and two queen size beds. I was bringing my 18 & 22 year old children and anything less would not work. I am use to staying in two bedroom villas since I'm use to staying in timeshares. When you first walk into the reception area, you'll notice it outdoors but covered. It was very nice. Check in was easy. There was a problem because our second room for my sister and nephew was not next to ours. Because these are rented condos, you are not guaranteed rooms, only views. In other words, if you thought you were getting a two queens, city view with only two people....you may get a king with city view. That's what happened to my sister. But the next day, she was switched to a two queen bedroom. But, we still were not together. I was on 31st floor and she was on 37th. I will say, the view was excellent. We got the view of the mountains and the ocean in the distance. We were only two blocks back from the main street and smack dab in the middle of EVERYTHING. This is the best location for pick ups for most activities. No need to have a car. We used uber (which was reasonable) for everything we felt was not in walking distance. Although...most things are within walking distance. The pool was closed most of the time we were there but we didn't care. We jam packed our trip with activities that included the beach. We walked to the beach which took 10 minutes due to the lights. My fridge did not work the first night but it was replaced the next morning. The elevators were hot and the hallways to get to your room was a little sketch but, not enough to deter us. Again, not something I'm use to. The bathrooms were tiny. I'm 5' 8 1/2" and I barely fit under the shower. My other family members could not fit. It's made for a way shorter person. They do have laundry facilities on-site which is really nice. But aside from that, we really liked staying there and would stay again if the budget didn't allow us to stay elsewhere.

I stayed here for a great price! If I were to stay in Honolulu again I wouldn't dismiss this hotel. The lobby area is beautiful and airy with an amazing view. Easy access to be picked up/dropped off by UBER or taxi. Pros:Easy access to shopping, restaurants Convenient walk to beachView from my penthouse was AMAZING!Live person in lobby specializing in excursionsShort walk to the canalFriendly, helpful staffAlways felt safeGreat price Cons:Mixed use buildingNot ON the beachOlder building in need of updating Window unit AC (but cooled well)

I booked this hotel on 22 June because it had a reasonable pool only to find on arrival it had been closed since 16 June.Its still closed even though the web sites will not tell you.The air conditioning hardly works took several hours to cool the room. This is an old hotel and it shows. There were no glasses in the room which the staff disputed until they searched the room. This is an old hotel that should be avoided. I was overcharged and despite two requests for details and a formal complaint I have had no reply.

We stayed at this hotel for 20 + days and we really loved it / 2 adults and a 5 & 2 yrs old kids, we got a 1br suite on a high floor corner room with balcony facing pool/ diamond head and living room sliding window towards beach (open all doors the breeze is amazing). Nice room comfy bed n practical kitchenette. The staff is awesome, everyone is so friendly but the room service staff is the most friendly and helpful ever (Desiree and Mar are amazing!) Mar even brought over some chocolate covered macadamia for our little girl's bday..! That was so sweet!!The hotel is perfectly located only 2 blocks from Kalakaua Ave (Royal Hawaiian Center and Waikiki Beach). Not a bad walk for a family with kids. Great swimming pool and hot tub. Also, they do have a convenient mini-mart on site. Don't forget EVERY TUESDAY they have a roof top managers reception- nothing better than enjoying the most amazing views of Waikiki (40+ floors high) while sipping on a cocktail. Catered by the most attentive, servicing staff. Will definitely stay here again!!

This highrise codo-hotel is in the centre of waikiki on the alawai canalIt is one block to the local bus and two blocks to the beachThe pool area on the 6th floor is large with plenty of lounges, although currently closed for maintenance you can still enjoy the deck and hot tubElevators are reasonably efficient if you avoid dinner hourThere are very nice barbecues on the recreation deck and a laundryMost units are renovated but a few still remain with original furnishings etc.If you are booking with air bnb beware that many owners call the studio units one bedroom. Only the corner units are really one bedroom

I recently stayed here for four nights with my family after staying here a year ago. The suites are very spacious and comfortable, my parents had the master bedroom and my partner and I had the pull out sofa bed which was probably one of the most comfortable sofa beds I have ever slept on. The rooms were clean, the kitchenette was very handy to make coffee and eat breakfast in. The balcony offers an amazing view of downtown Waikiki, depending on which side you are on. The beach is about a ten minute walk and everything is fairly convenient to locate (shops, restaurants, etc) should you be without a car as the hotel is fairly central to downtown.Customer service was amazing and I have to give a shout out to Brian N, the concierge who was extremely helpful and attentive to our needs. I would definitely recommend this hotel and I look forward to staying here again next year,

Myself & my boyfriend stayed here for 5 nights and were really happy with our stay. All members of staff were very helpful & informative. We managed to get a room on the 40th floor and the view was spectacular of the city, river and sea - it beat the Top of Waikiki bar! It had a kitchenette which was also helpful as there is a supermarket on the 6th floor if you want to buy food. The location was good as it wasnt right on the beach like some of the more expensive hotels but only a 5-10 min walk, still next to all the shops etc. The only down side's were that the bed wasnt comfortable at all & the air con was ridiculously loud.

Decided to book this place for our honeymoon. The room was reasonably nice. Cleaning was not that great. Location wasn't that bad. Close to our favorite udon restaurant and maybe a 10-15 minute walk to Waikiki. Probably will stay here again. The elevator system can be better. You have to get in one to get into the lobby and get into another one to get your room floor.

Love this place. Very convenient (location wise) and the staff is very friendly. Price is just right and on certain days you'll get a really good deal. One downside is parking but it's common around Waikiki area to be paying $25 per day for parking. Other than the parking, Skyline Hotel is always a great stay. Teri and Brian was very helpful and always willing to help. Mahalo Skyline TEAM!

The staff is great, friendly and accommodating. I have stayed there 3 times so far this year and look forward to staying there again. Beds were good, view on the pool side is awesome and the rooms were clean. Parking was $25 a day, not bad for Wakiki. Only 2 blocks to the ocean. Close to numerous restaurants ranging from dives to top end.

This hotel is a bit older than the photos on website might have believe. But overall its quite good for the money. Tip: book city view room:The rooms are small but comfortable, but the best thing is the location. Only a short walk to the heart of the city, restaurants,bus stops, and most importantly the beach.I know some will say this hotel is outdated but i think its good value for money, in a quite part of town and everything is within walking distance.For a couple of dollars you can use the laundry facility on floor 6, washers and dryers are available. Pool, gym, sauna, BBQ area, are all on this floor.Overall a place worth considering.

I took my teenage children (16 & 18 yrs) for their first holiday to Waikiki. I have been to Waikiki several times and found that many of the hotels are fairly average (due to their age) for the price you pay, unless you stay at a 4-5 star at hotel with a very high price tag. I was looking for a reasonably priced hotel so we could save our money for shopping! The Aqua Skyline at Island Colony had everything I was looking for. It is located on Seaside Ave, only a few minutes walk to Kalakaua Ave (main street) and close to the Beachwalk, Victoria's Secret, Sephora, Macy's, Footlocker and lots of other great shops. It was easy walking distance to The Cheesecake Factory and California Pizza Kitchen (2 of my favourite places to eat with teenagers). It was also a short walk to Bills Sydney to get my great 'Aussie' coffee each morning. There is also a pick-up point for many of the day tours just around the corner in front of IHOP, and easy access to the The Bus (local bus network).We stayed in a Studio Kitchenette room with 2 queen beds. This was great it you want to have toast/cereal for breakfast. Mc Donald's is also just around the corner if you want to grab a quick breakfast. The room was just like the pictures on the website. The only issues were the air conditioner was quite noisy and the shower head was quite low. Not a real problem though as you got used to it, and the other benefits outweighed these issues.The hotel has a great pool/spa area with a convenience shop on this level. It is open till late and prices are the same as the local ABC stores (including alcohol) which is really convenient.The rate also includes DVDnow. You select a DVD or PS3 game from the self-serve machine at Reception and play it in your room, which was great.There is also an ice-water dispenser at Reception which is great to grab a drink when you walk in from the beach. Don't worry about bringing your beach towel because the hotel provides these for you, clean daily.Every week they have a complimentary 'Welcome Cocktail' on the rooftop which I thought was a very nice gesture, and also provides a great photo opportunity.They also have a regular complimentary shuttle to Ala Moana shopping Centre which leaves from a sister Aqua hotel around the corner.The staff were friendly and helpful. Arriving from Sydney on a flight at 6am, Reception was happy to store our luggage. He even arranged a shuttle to Waikele Outlets so we could fill in our time before check-in, which isn't until 3pm.Overall, we had a great stay and would definitely stay here again!

I have stayed in many Aqua brand hotels and I was honestly pretty disappointed with this one. It wasn't terrible but it wasn't really great either. There is plenty of construction going on in front which was a little inconvenient. The parking garage is convenient but also $25 a day so make sure to add that on to your budget. I am guessing, the higher up you go, the nicer the rooms are. We stayed on the 11th floor which surprisingly isn't that high. We were right next to the trash chute so the hallway always kind of smelled of garbage. The room was fine but falling apart a little bit. The view is pretty decent (mostly a city view) and it's nice to have a large balcony. The best part of the hotel though is the location. It is right in the middle of Waikiki and easy walking access to all the beaches/shops/restaurants. If it weren't for the location, I probably would not go back here.

Expensive family trip to Hawaii with 2 kids and we were a little disappointed with the hotel, to be honest.We were promised wine & chocolates in the room as it was my 'big' birthday, but they never arrived. (Very minor, but don't promise if you can't deliver!)There was a lot of building renovation going on in the front entrance, which was very noisy and started early in a morning, you couldn't hear a thing when walking through the lobby! This was a let down as there was a small cafe in the lobby but I couldn't see them doing much business because of the noise. We were on the 31st floor, not good if you suffer from vertigo!!! But the views were amazing.There was a small shop on the 6th floor which had loads of essentials. We didn't use the pool, but it looked nice and clean, this was also on floor 6 along with a small fitness centre.We did use the laundry, which was a total rob! It costs $5 to buy a swipe card, then you have to top it up with a minimum of $10 to be able to do any washing or drying! We didn't realise this until we had already bought the card but hey-ho, you live and learn. It made for a very expensive wash and dry.The room was quite pokey with old fashioned dark green carpet which was a bit threadbare and dark olive green walls and a bath room which was no more than 5ftx7ft with a shower which was so small we had to bend down to use it (me and husband are both 6ft+) not brilliant for a family of 4 really. There was a tiny sink and fridge in the 'kitchen' which was no more than a worktop really, but it was handy for keeping the water bottles in.The A/C was very noisy so we had to switch it off at night and leave the door onto the balcony wide open instead.The location was it's saving grace as it was only a 5 minute walk from Waikiki beach and the shops. Lots and lots of very expensive shops to walk around and the beach was amazing, but we wouldn't go to this hotel again unless it had a serious makeover and upgrade.A bit disappointing considering we spent so much.

This hotel is old but currently being revamped. We were very happy as it had all that we needed, views were fantastic with a good sized balcony & comfy bed. Was great being able to cook, especially breakfast each morning. Only problem was noisy aircon but it worked well. The staff were great. Was handy having a convenience store in the hotel. Would definitely stay here again, location was great, within walking distance to the beach, shops & bus stops.

We have stayed here for the last week and the best thing about it is the views seeing it is the highest building in Waikiki, so we have been told and it is very well situated. Only a few minutes walk to the main shopping area and a couple of minutes more to the beach . It is also right next to the Canal , nice walk along there to the harbour area.On level six there is a good pool area with plenty of lounges also a hot spa, I wish there was a bit more shade up there, also there are barbecues and tables and chairs and a laundry all on that same rooftop level, the tower from there goes up about 45 floors .Nearly forgot there is a little convenience store there as well.The place is very secure as you need your fob key to gain access to the elevators.In the foyer there is a little cafe called Jaggers which is very handy and also just inside the entry there is a very nice Gentleman called Ken who runs a travel / tour business, he is very good and very helpful .Our room was only small with a kitchenette , small bathroom, small lounge area, clean and comfortable, AC, good wifi and a great balcony with outdoor furniture, all that we really needend after all your not in Honolulu to spend much time in your room.This place is a combination of hotel and privately owned apartments , we were in one of the owned apartments so dealt with the owner direct.In conclusion a good spot to stay but if you want posh this is not for you .

This hotel is not worth the money they charge. We reserved a panoramic view with was nice but noisy. The king bed was comfortable but the two pull out beds were not.The room needed a lot of upgrading it was old and tired (nothing like the stock photos on their site)There were four people in my party and only three forks in the kitchen. Two nights in a row there was a party in the room next to us until 3am. I called security -they couldn't get the people in the room to answer the door. The elevators were very slow. One day there wasn't any electricity or water for 6 hours. There is a very high resort fee per person per day ! this is not a resort- they have a pool and jacuzzi that is all. The internet was not very good. I would NOT recommend staying here,

The staff were very froiendly and helpful. The room was okay, exept for the cockroaches. the buidling is having some work donre on the lobby area and the pool area so that was a bit inconvenient. it was fine for us for our 4 night stay in EWaikiki. We are not a 5-star hotel type of family so this placve does the job. the location is good and easy to access.

Arrived late at night but we were greeted with a smile,room was great with a wonderful view of diamond head and Waikiki beach. Room was clean,comfortable,having a mini mart at the hotel was great. Would stay there again

We booked 4 nights via airbnb. The room size is good with larger balcony facing west. The location is a little bit far from the beach, but right beside the river which is beautiful and much quiet than hotels close to the beach. The parking along the river is free for certain time, which worked for us since we rented car. The pool was under maintenance when the time we were there. So, no comments for the pool. Other than that, everything was fine.

Here's the good...Loved the view from our large, private balcony on the 32nd floor - Diamond Head and the Beach (through the buiildings). Front desk staff were helpful and friendly. The room is quite adequate - we had a king bed, kitchenette, etc. pretty standard. We loved the large fridge, microwave, toaster dishes, etc. - everything you would need to have breakfast - or any other meal - in your room. The pool area on the 6th floor was larger than I expected and there were BBQs you could use to cook food. A convenience store was located on this same floor.The hotel is right off the canal so if you like to walk, jog or ride a bike, you couldn't ask for a better location.About a 12 minute walk to Waikiki beach..We could see the International Marketplace from our room.The bus stop was a block away - just a five minute walk.The OK - The bathroom was very small. You had to close the door to get into the shower. The safe was almost on the floor in the kitchenette area. The closet area was very small.Things to note - there is construction going on during the day in the lobby area so it is very noisy, but it does not continue into the evening. Also, you can hear a lot of traffic noise if your room is up high. And last, the air conditioner is rather noisy.Would I stay there again? Yes, for the price, it's great!

My cheer group and I stayed at the aqua skyline at Island colony at the beginning of the month. We were so surprised at how wonderful everything was there. The rooms were nice and spacious. The rooms was also very clean and well decorated. They also had a great swimming pool that was very nice and clean . All the girls really enjoyed the pool . They offer free DVD rentals for everyone that stayed there. Also free shuttle service around Waikiki and Alamoana shopping center. We were so satisfied with our stay and plan to stay there again in the future. It was very accommodating with four rooms that we needed to get for our girls for cheer competition that weekend. Great service. Thank you Brian Kovaloff for all your help with making sure we book the right amount of rooms, staying in our budget and having a very good time.

When we checked in we were charged for the 3 night stay and a $50 security deposit. After a week we have not been refunded our security deposit and despite numerous emails and messages on their website we have still to receive acknowledgement of our complaint let alone the $50 deposit.

The staff was outstanding and seemed to care if you had concerns. The rooms were what you would want in a room. Clean, neat. Close to the beach (3blocks) and shopping . Highly recommended if you don't want to stay on the beach. Only flaw was the grout around the bathtub was falling out. We would definitely stay there again

Ask for a room on a high floor for great views of Waikiki and Diamond Head. Hotel very clean and organized. Rooms also have a large balcony which was very nice. Staff were just amazing and a pleasure to talk to. They have 24 hour security at the door who aren't the most friendly people, but just ignore them and go about your business. Pool area was rather bland. Felt like a business hotel roof top pool area. You will pay a daily resort fee that I didn't feel you got much of a benefit from it. I would have thought that the fitness center would be included in the daily feel, but no, you have to pay for that also. They do have a large parking garage and daily rate is $25. For the area that is about the best you will find and wont have to cross your fingers there is a spot available. All in all I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel and will return again.

Love this Hotel we stayed on the 34th floor with a Ocean View Hotel it was Clean Quiet also the 6th floor has a hot tub and pool with Grills and inside your room you have a hot plate stove refrigerator plates spoons forks every thing u need even have a PlayStation 3 the beach is 2 blocks always nice shopping Mall!!! Excellent Location!!!! Great Hotel !!!

We stayed here 5 nights and found the room to be satisfactory. It was clean and close to shopping, restaurants, and plenty of public beaches. The only negative was the cost of parking the car and ammenity fees. $25 per night for parking plus a charge of 18 dollars per night for amenities that we did not realize until our arrival. The building is very secure. Poor view from our room.

We are fortunate enough to visit every few years and stay here. The amenities have been updated and the security is great, but, BY FAR, what we love most about Island Colony is the location! It's just a couple of blocks from Waikiki Beach and right in the heart of Waikiki itself. The staff is always helpful and friendly.

This was the last hotel that we stayed at on our family trip of 6 weeks. There were 4 adults, 2 teenagers and 1 pre-teen so we booked 2 rooms for 9 nights in a Studio Panoramic Ocean View room. We were on the 36th floor and the view was great. We faced Diamond Head and also easily viewed the beach and the waterway on the other side. The balcony was a good size. Unfortunately the coffee shop in the foyer was rarely open but the food market on the 5th floor was excellent. The bathroom was very small. You couldn't put the bathmat on the floor and open the door at the same time! The towels were of a good quality but the size was not what we had been used to in our other hotels. The rooms were very hot and the air conditioner was way too noisy. Ceiling fans would have been a better option because you could not say that the rooms were air conditioned when the air con was unusable. Bedding was comfortable and clean. Our major problem was that when the booking was made I stressed that we would be paying cash for both rooms. When we checked in, again I stressed that we would be paying cash. We were told that it would not be a problem but by the next day, upon checking our credit cards, we noticed that we had been charged on our cards. I pointed it out to the staff and he said that they would reverse the entry if we paid cash then which we did. The problem is that with the credit card conversion and fees we are out of pocket $114au for each room! The hotel sent us a survey when we arrived home asking about our stay and I pointed out the difference and the manager wrote back and said his staff had been made aware of the problem so that it didn't happen again but didn't help us in any way. We would not stay here again and our other family members who were considering this hotel have now changed their minds. If they had wanted us to pay cash up front on check-in they should have said so, not charged our cards the next day. Definitely not a happy ending to our holiday.

I spent 2 nights at this hotel and my room was on the 39th floor... The view was magnificent, my room was nice and clean and the staff there were all very nice, Parking was only $25 per day, which I thought was pretty reasonable, considering most places charge a lot more. The coffee shop downstairs was great for morning coffee too. I'll be back for sure.

Booked a one bed panoramic view suite for 2 nights level 41 Pros: much cheaper and more spacious then more central Waikiki accommodation, awesome view, kitchenette and convenience store in the building, playstation and games plus wifi, Laundry facilities. Updated kitchen and bathroom. Friendly staff.Cons: Have to walk to the tourist areas through some rather rundown looking streets, air con is too noisy to use at night. The only living room furniture was a single arm chair which converted to a single bed. We had to request a fold away cot as we had booked for 4 guests. Cot was very uncomfortable and saggy. Not enough furniture for 4 people to sit. Given vague directions to where the shuttle bus pick up was for the mall, so it didn't stop for us. Make sure you get exact directions on where to stand.Due to aircon situation would not stay here again, but otherwise was ok.

Stayed two nights on business. Staff were friendly. Room was small. Only window was balcony door. Too noisy at night to leave it open but stuffy with it closed. Air conditioner was way too noisy to leave on. Bed was very comfortable with good pillows. Room was clean. Good access to all Waikiki has to offer.

Most units are rented out by private individuals.The people we dealt with were easy to phone,answer questions and forward credit card information to.The pool and area was great with bbq's to use(free gas) good sun.No hidden fees ,no damage deposit taken up front unless you had done damage. The kitchen was terribly small you could not prep anything.We used part of the dresser with a towel on top for preparing anything..Small bar sink and hot plate were there but the best feature was the big size fridge.It's called a studio but more like a hotel room with hot plate,sink,fridge,in the entry way.The balcony was huge with great patio furniture which made eating out there wonderful.The unit was dated but clean and morning sun was an issue it needed blackout drapes.The Ac worked well.For the money it was good, close to the bus,not too far from the beach and food pantry.I would have booked over Christmas but the prices were inflated and I chose elsewhere.Security was great!

Upon arrival, there was no one at the check-in desk and we had to wait a few minutes for someone to arrive. Going to your room, you need to swipe your room card for access to the elevators which I find odd - just make the swiping card part of the elevator itself. There are far too many elevators and you have to run back and forth just to see which one lights up.The corridors are old, shabby, dirty, and dark. The lights in the corridor flicker which is very annoying.The room door is also old, dirty, and broken. The bathroom is cramped and not well-lit. The shower head is more like 'water from the ceiling' as it has low pressure and cannot be moved around.We were provided pans and bowls to use for our own cooking. Unfortunately we did not use them as they smelt and looked absolutely disgusting. We could also smell the disgusting smell of some other rooms cooking.The hotel is located relatively farther away from the beaches of Waikiki. The surrounding streets are old and smell badly too.You are given water in the lobby but the water is taken away at night. Why? You are also given a tea machine in the lobby but you can't use it until 2pm. Why? If you ask them to fill up water for you, they ask for your room number. Would you not give water to a thirsty person just because they didn't stay at your hotel? I think we're better than that.Some good things in our otherwise bad stay:- two cookies were in our room, welcoming us as we entered it.- we had a balcony- the elevators were quick- security presence made the hotel feel safer

convenient placei used to live here about 10 years ago. the laundromat operation had been changed and it seems complicated for me. however, i felt like home and relaxed during my stay. i wish it can accept credit card instead of prepaid card.

Having to scramble last minute for a Hotel, I went into full panic mode as it was for Christmas. My faves were booked and I didn't want to spend a fortune on 2 rooms for 2 nights. I also knew it would be good to have a kitchenette and possibly a grill as the men going love to cook. Plus, we didn't want to be at the mercy of Waikiki restaurants if we wanted a snack.I Yelped all the Aqua's as I heard they are family friendly and reasonable. Some were ultra cheap and apparently for that reason. So when I came upon the Skylight, the reviews were good, the price reasonable (although all the service fees did add up) and yes they had a kitchen and grill. Perfect.Check-in was easy. There is a security area that I initially thought we check-in there, but alas, it's through another set of sliding doors. That was a tiny bit confusing. I rang the bell and was attended to promptly. One of the rooms was ready early so we checked in. I ended up extending a day and although the room I was in had owners coming in, there was another room available for me and even higher up. The room was wonderful and just as expected from Yelp pictures. The lanai's are much bigger than typical hotels. I was told out of the 400+ rooms, only 90 are rented out as the rest are owned. This would explain the pool area having a spacious amount of room with lots of tables for what I would assume are visitors/owners having parties. There were about 6 grills. The only downfall is that if it rained, there was no coverage. There are canopy lounge chairs but again, if it rained, you'd get wet. There is a small work out area (we didn't utilize) and small convenience store. No restaurant although there is a coffee cart next to the check in area. However, they are open only for a short time in the morning. There are free movie rentals from a box similar to Redbox also located where you check-in. Parking is steep with it being $25/day. You must inform the desk as they will charge you $30 without the parking slip. And the parking is not affiliated with the hotel. You pay the parking directly to the parking attendant. All the staff are extremely accommodating and relaxed. Not one single complaint. I would consider this hotel again if not wanting to stay on the main strip.

We were greeted by very friendly, helpful staff. On arrival we were given a complimentary upgrade from studio to 1 bedroom suite . Room was very clean, comfortable and well equipped. All facilities in the hotel were well maintained and clean. Would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone looking for great accommodation. Located close to all amenities and waikiki beach.

Our family decided to celebrated my daughter's 14th birthday with a weekend staycation with a few of her best friends in Waikiki at the Aqua Skyline at Island Colony. We were greeted by the most friendliest hotel staff upon check-in. The front desk representative, Brian, was very professional and immediately asked how he could offer any assistance with restaurants and activity suggestions during our stay. Check-in was quick and effortless. Went up to our rooms and was amazed by the postcard view of Diamond Head from the 38th floor. The room was very clean, nice and modern with the 2 queen beds, kitchenette and large balcony. We enjoyed lounging and spending a lot of time at the pool and jacuzzi on the 6th floor with the girls. The hotel is centrally located in Waikiki and a short walk away from the BRAND NEW International Market Place and Waikiki Beach. The staff at Aqua Skyline at Island Colony made a special occasion very memorable. Can't wait to plan our next family stay-cation at the Aqua Skyline at Island Colony.

This is my second time staying at the Skyline. Haven't actually given a review but from my experiences this place is worth giving a review. Aqua Skyline is a nice place to stay, we got upgraded for free to a higher room and the view was nice. If you ever stay on a Tuesday they have a managers reception on the roof top and they're serving free maitais or as they call it Skytai, we were able to view the whole Waikiki and that was amazing. Our overall stay was very nice and comfortable. Aaron at the front desk was nice enough to remind us about the managers reception and also give us suggestions on where to eat. Definitely will be coming back again.

Stayed here for two nights prior to leaving on a cruise. Building has a secured entrance and security guard 24/7. Older building with renovated room had small kitchenette with fridge, sink dishes and microwave. Had a beautiful pool up on 6th floor. Very private and sunny. Excellent location close to great shopping, restaurants, water and sightseeing.

For the price in Waikiki it's ok value and pretty central so just a short stroll to everything. Has a mini mart and was quite surprised to find everything the same price as all ABC stores. Only problem is that with all the huge meals you end up taking leftovers back but the rooms only have a bar fridge.

Nothing grand and nothing awful about the room. Standard hotel room with small kitchenette. Comfortable beds (2 beds and sofa bed). Room large enough for 2 adults, 1 teen and 1 child. Small bathroom with an odd door. The AC unit in room #1210 was loud. We could not have it on during the night. We opted to have the sliding door opened slightly for fresh air and a breeze. Would of liked to have a screen door. Beach/pool towels available at the front desk. The pool is heated by the sun and gets a large amount of shade in the afternoon. Nice large sun area and a good size pool. Did not have a chance to try food at the cafe as it was closed due to a death in the family. We were only in Honolulu for the historic sites at Pearl Harbor so knowing we weren't spending much time in the room it was fine for us. We received a coupon for a discount in the parking garage without asking at check-in. Front desk staff is exceptionally friendly, informative and accommodating! While the room lacked any wow factor the front desk definitely made up for it!

We stayed 16 nights in October, on 10th floor with outlook to pool and river from balcony.Very happy with room service. didn't need it every day. Two Queen beds, cooking facility, compact bathroom but suited us. Central to all, we were out all day everyday and found the location convenient to local bus stop, shops, beach, church etc. Convenience shop on 6th floor, bbq facilities, laundry facilities and pool. We swam everyday in the pool, spa was good too. We enjoyed the variety of walks in all directions. Shuttle service available to shopping centre. Tourist information in foyer. We booked a north shore bus trip on the 2nd day and thoroughly enjoyed the day. Coming from Australia in gippsland, Victoria, we had a great stay for our first real holiday in 43 years. Encouraging our 5 adult children and partners to come over. Thankyou Island Colony and Paula

The Aqua Skyline is in a good location and easy walk from to any Waikiki attractions. High up you'll feel and hear the wind all day and night, especially from the glass louvered windows on the balcony. Air-conditioning unit is also pretty old and very loud. The building itself has an odd damp smell about it which can be unpleasant, possibly due to many rooms actually being residences. Theres a shop, gym and pool area on level 6 which all looked decent enough. Overall though it served is purpose and the small kitchenette is handy for breakfasts.

We stayed in a 1 bedroom apartment with 2 adults and 2 children. This apartment is fully equipped with a kitchen. It has washer and dryers onsite for a small cost. Beach only a short walk away. Abc stores close by. Great for a family stay for the price. Some noise of the trash shoot but not too bad. 28th floor, views of ocean, river and mountains.

We recently stayed at the Aqua Skyline at Island Colony Hotel in Waikiki. We used Air BNB for our months stay and booked two rooms, one on the 18 th floor and the other on the 14 th floor.Views from both rooms were very different, one over the Ali Wai canal and the other over the hotel pool area and city, both enjoyable and relaxing.Loved the pool area, large pool, nice and deep, plenty of sun loungers and several day beds which you need to book through the security team which is on the lobby level as you exit the lifts.The pool area also has a large jacuzzi and adjacent to this area is a bank of Webber barbecues, which also need to be booked through the security desk. Enjoyed shopping at the local supermarkets for bbq meat and salad items, and found cooking in the evening a really enjoyable experience.The hotel is couple of blocks back from Kalakaua Avenue, but is within a easy 25 minute walk to Ala Moana Mall, the walk to the main strip of Kalakaua Avenue is about five minutes, so not a chore at all.Very peaceful looking out over the canal, always some water activity going on especially early morning, evenings and weekends, lots of outrigger canoes etc.The daily room tariff reflects the somewhat dated decor of the hotel complex, but we did not mind this at all, our rooms were clean, comfortable with a kitchen, good sized lanai, main area indoors consisting of a queen size bed and couch which also doubles as a extra bed, bathroom perfect for our needs.There is a shop on the 6 th floor as you exit the lifts, recycling bins here for glass, plastic and aluminium, and a good sized laundry. The hotel gym and sauna is also located on this floor nearby.Rubbish shute at the end of each corridor is a easy way to get rid of rubbish from the room, each floor has this facility.For the price of the rooms that we had for our month, hotel is great, extra dollars to spend of clothing and the like, if you want to spend $600.00 a night, don't come here, far less than that by far, a comfortable and clean hotel with all amenities that we had hoped for.We would not hesitate to return, mahalo Olivier.

The hotel is near the canal and walking distance to main parts of Waikiki (it's quite touristy here).The hotel is outdated. We got the "panaromic view" but it looks different from the room photos and it wasn't any different than a room with a balcony.We saw cockroaches on the floor when we first entered our room.You have to pay $5 to use the gym. There's no water bottles in the room. Cheap shampoo and conditioner. The PlayStation and wire connections to TV was difficult to hookup in order to watch their DVDs. You could feel the bedsprings in the mattress. There's so many hotels here - this place doesn't deserve the high ratings. Luckily, we only stayed here for one night. Will not stay here again.

Our room was clean and the beds were comfortable with a little kitchenette for your cooking pleasure. There was a deck outside the sliding doors and a pretty good view. Very acceptable place to park yourself for a bit. Close to reasonable places to eat and to hop on a bus to take you pretty much everywhere. Not fancy but security is tight.

This is a lousy place to stay. 1)No hot water in kitchen2)Towel rack in bathroom falling off3)Room door has to be push/pulled to latch4)Dirty stained carpet throughout 5)Rain blows through under the windows6)Lots of Black Hail covering the bathroom floor7)A/C was plugged, I cleaned it8)No instruction for TV/Cable box, older person will have difficulty getting it to workConvenient store on 6th floor has lots of stuff.Laundry on 6 floor.Small coffee bar on main floor has nice coffee.

Stayed here for 10 days with my daughter was happy with our room it was very comfortable we had a studio kitchenette room 3818 fitted 2 double beds with ease,bathroom not a bad size too, and the view from our balcony was pretty awesome. Love the location it is about a 2 minute stroll to Kuhio Rd where you can catch a bus for $2.50 pretty much anywhere and if you keep walking another 5 minutes up Seaside Ave you will reach Kalakaua Rd where you can shop to you drop, after shopping you can go chill in the pool or relax in the Hot Tub. The staff were awesome always smiling and very accommodating from the front desk to the Hotels Mr fix it. I am very happy to recommend Aqua Skyline Island Colony..... Mahalo nui

Great place to stay within walking distance to Waikiki beach. BBQ and pool area was fantastic. Beds were very comfortable, handy to have small fridge and cook top in room. Only negative feedback was the extremely noisy air conditioning unit and over zealous security guards who wouldn't allow glassware on outdoor tables located near BBQ's. Maybe some signage advising would be good. Overall very happy with the accomodation and would stay here again.

My husband n I stayed here for 3 days and really enjoyed our stay. The view was gorgeous! The room was spacious. I like to thank Brian Sherman for all his help in making our stay there comfortable. So much aloha with the service. Defiantly would recommend and stay there again. Thank u for a wonderful mini vacation!

When we arrived we were lucky to be upgraded to a corner unit on the 41st floor with panoramic views, separate bedroom and lounge and kitchen, as this is our third time at the Aqua Skyline so we knew that we were close to the beach, shops and bars but not too close to the noise. I can't really think of anything negative to say, I think you get value for money with a perfect location,that's safe and secure with helpful staff.

I've stayed at Aqua Skyline before and the staff is always accommodating and fun. This is the go to spot for when we need a night out and don't wanna drive home. The room was clean and beds comfy. Can't beat the pool and jaccuzi. Will be back once again. Me and I think his name is Steve are awesome!!

We stayed for 7 nights and thought that this place was pretty good as it had everything we needed including a little kitchen which was great as it meant we didn't have to go out for every meal and the balcony had a nice view to enjoy our meals on. The bed was massive and comfortable as well. My only reservations about the room was that the air conditioner was quite loud. We also over heard some people talking in the lift that some one had done a poo in the jacuzzi so they had to close it and drain it! Yuck thank goodness we didn't use it!

We have stayed several times now..we love the location..it's in the middle of everything..great clean rooms..great views...and perfect priced...will continue to stay here I love it...This is the spot to be

We stayed here for five nights in September. Free upgrade to a panoramic city view room was nice. Room was a little dated but considering this, it was in great shape! One nice change would be having an additional a/c unit...the bedroom one didn't do anything for the sitting room/kitchenette area. Hotel was very clean and so quiet! We felt like we were the only ones on the floor. Affordable because not on the beach but still within very easy walking distance to Waikiki. Excellent staff were very helpful with guiding us in the right direction for stores, activities, and bus stops. All in all, we would stay again if wanting to be close to the beach minus the beachfront prices.

Booked through Air BnB, unfortunately lack of communication with host meant check in and check out wasn't great so no fault of the actual Hotel itself. Security was good and concierge was really friendly. Facilities well maintained and our room was ok for us. Air con noisy though and a lot of street noise too but I guess you get that staying in the middle of a busy city. All in all an ok stay bearing in mind that the hotel has a mix of private rentals and long term residents who live here. Glad we had no fire alarms in the middle of the night!

On our second night here we woke up at 4am to a fire alarm and an emergency announcement telling us to leave the building using stairs. We stayed on the 15th floor so it took a while to get down (but others had it about 30 stories worse than us). Once in front of the building the hotel staff told us that it was a false alarm and we should go back to our rooms. It took a while for all guests to use elevators to go back up to their rooms. Later I noticed that fire alarm handles in the hallways were taped up, which seems unsafe. I do not know how this lax safety standard can stand for a high rise hotel in the Waikiki area. Otherwise the hotel was 'average' in terms of its quality (small not-too-polished rooms, but nice balconies, good pool, nice location). Given that we were not exactly paying little (nearly $200 per night), I would not have stayed there if I would know how it will be. Overall, Honolulu is one big giant disappointment. Fake, expensive, and touristy Waikiki surrounded by poor, run down neighborhoods. Save your money and go somewhere else for vacation. This place ain't worth it.

First the Good News: Great location, conveniently located a few blocks from Waikiki Beach and walking distance to clubs and shopping. I was on the 39th floor in a Kitchenette studio lodging with a wonderful view of the Ala Moana Golf course to my left, Diamond Head straight ahead and Waikiki Beach to the my right! The guest pool and BBQ on the 6th floor was great! Also, the internet was decent (look for user name and passcode under the router in the room). The Free Shuttle to the Ala Moana Shopping Center leaves every 30 minutes and from there I took the City Bus 20 (you can also take the City Bus 19 as well) to the Honolulu International Airport for $2.50; good deal! Now the Bad News: This is a hotel, a residential condo and a rental. I was renting a very dated lodging...since the Aqua Skyline at Island Colony was built in 1977, I can safely say that my accommodations were not touched since then! My particular room, #3915 had stained bedding and towels, broken fixtures, an air conditioning unit that barely functioned, doors missing off the cabinets and an overwhelming Pine Sol smell hit you as you opened the door to the room. To make matters worse, although there is no smoking in the common areas, guests or residents smoked on the balcony/lanai, so if you have breathing issues (I have asthma) opening the windows (which whose latches were broken as well) was out of the question.Now here's the truth; I got a deal for this room, but I did note that the studio apartment next to mine was modern, clean and looked very inviting when the housekeeping staff were there to refresh it...so here's my advice BEWARE! Different owners who rent out these accommodations have different standards. If you get a "deal" it is probably because it is a much lower quality lodging in the s sharing the same building...

We stayed here one night because of a reservation mix up at our other hotel and wish we stayed the whole time here. It's just a few blocks back from the beach but far enough away to avoid all the noise. The pool area was great, had a sauna and large Jacuzzi. We like that there was a convenience store on the premises for snacks and medicine. Our room had an adequate kitchenette with toaster, microwave, stove, sink and a good sized refr. The balconies were deep with a dining table. we had an island view that was lovely at night. Only complaint was the AC unit was a window type and a bit loud.

Great sized studio room with a comfortable king size bed. Room was clean, comfortable and quiet. Our room was on the 43rd floor with great views to Waikiki Beach and the hills. Kitchen area had hot plates, microwave and fridge. We enjoyed being able to self cater - cooked our own breakfast and dinners. A nice change after eating out during most of our two month holiday in the USA. 5 to 10 minute walk to Waikiki Beach for my husband. I loved the pool area at the hotel. Hotel also close to restaurants and shops. Staff very friendly and helpful. Enjoyed the managers complimentary cocktail hour on Tuesday evening.

Aqua Skyline's selling point is location: you are in Waikiki, close to the action, but on a side street so it is quieter. The rooms had balconies,and ours overlooked the Ala Wai Canal, with a great view of the mountains. We got a studio with a kitchenette. The room was small relative to other studios we've used in the past, although the balcony did offer more living space (great for eating breakfast). I found the kitchen/bathroom set up a bit strange. The kitchenette had a stovetop, a small fridge, and a microwave, but the sink was in the bathroom (where the toilet was as well, which I thought was unhygienic). The rooms have been recently renovated but the hallways and carpeting are dated. Laundry, a convenience store, the pool, and sauna are all on the sixth floor. Laundry was expensive because you have to buy a card (on top of the cost of running the machine). Parking was discounted compared to regular Waikiki prices. All in all I was slightly underwhelmed with this hotel, although the location can't be beat.
