Acton, Massachusetts, United States

review_body: The staff are very courteous and friendly. I really felt the "Aloha Spirit" from the minute I entered the Lobby. My family and I stayed at the 42nd floor and it had the best views. The rooms were clean and tidy. Great location too. You get a lot for your money!

Its always a great stay at The Island Colony. I like the location, not right in the hustle and bustle of always busy Waikiki but close enough to everything to be able to walk where one may want to go. Room was spacious and the view was amazing. Staff was always super helpful and friendly.

A friend of ours booked us into this hotel for a night as we were in town for the Ohana Cup. We got to the hotel late and our view the next morning was breathtaking that we extended our stay for one more night. We couldn't have asked for a better place to stay. Highly recommended this place to my friends as its a walking distance to Waikiki Beach,the shopping center along Waikiki strip and as well as the night spots for those who would love to explore and experience the night life in Oahu.As for me I am definitely booking here on my next visit.

Years ago the Island colony was recommended to us after staying at numerous hotels. The Island colony soon became our favorite. The location, room size, glassed in lanai and STELLAR staff made it our one and only. Everything is fresh and clean and the staff takes care of us better than any hotel we have experienced. The Managers roof top cocktail hour gives the best views and experiences on the island. Meeting new people and seeing old friends is such a pleasure. The pool deck and laundry services are great. It has easily become our second home. We look forward to our return on the day of departure.

We were fortunate to get a room above the 22nd floor, which has an INCREDIBLE 180 degree VIEW of the Waikiki Skyline! We had a Diamond Head view from mountain to ocean, just impressive. Just as impressive was the service of the staff. We needed extra towels, maid service was quick to respond; rooms very clean as well as public spaces. Our check-in was seamless and quick, we even extended a day with ease. The staff truly knows their product and services, and provides that service with superior quality. Booking with them directly rather than a VRBO within the building truly provided us the service we needed during our stay. A special thanks to the staff of Aqua Skyline Waikiki. We will definitely be staying here on our next visit.

Staff and management was very polite and accommodating. They made sure my stay was very comfortable. Rooms are very will kept and clean, easy parking, good security, and a great location in Waikiki! Definitely would come back!

The Island Colony was awesome with beauty all around. It was so convenient!! Right in the heart of it all. The staff was friendly and helpful...Always a smile for their guests, easy to converse with and very knowledgeable with the surrounding locations and places to visit. When they say 'Aloha' you can tell they mean it. The accommodations were great....Clean and comfortable...slept like a baby, and with a kitchenette I could cook and save.

The room with kitchenette is way too small, ( extremely small bathroom and low shower head) had to ask too many times for the right amount of towels, air conditioner has a bucket that water runs into on the balcony and had to dump it daily and it leaked onto balcony and it was slippery, had to pay $5 for a laundry card just to do laundry and then u have to put more money on it to do laundry, have to pay $5 per person to use the fitness room upfront. It has good security but u have to have your room card on u all the time to get on the elevators, in pool area etc (pain in the butt). Doors to closet didn't slide very well, shutter style windows so your cool air goes through the cracks, had a huge gap under our entrance door and we could feel our cool air going right out. No computer room available to guests to print flight tickets. Be careful buying tours from the hotel desk, they lie to make the sale! Paid way too much to stay here for the quality which was poor! On a good note the staff at the check in desk was nice and most of the cleaning ladies.

As our flights arrived at 7am it was a pity we couldn't leave our luggage at the colony but at the office that was about 10 mins away. We are grateful they allowed us to leave our luggage there however it was a hassle having to be back at the office by 5pm. It has the essentials, very small kitchen area but provides what you need. Pool & hot tub, very nice, clean and inviting area, the laundromat, it would be nice if there was a change machine provided too rather than asking the shop to change notes. Also as nice as front desk were it was a little confusing to them and us, check out days and also they only activated keys for one day, however kept saying we were there till 29th when in fact we checked out on the 28th. Not if confusion there and time consuming having to activate keys. All in all views were breath taking, room was adequate for our stay and nice and close to everything.

29th trip to Waikiki Honolulu and still Paradise. The Island Colony is wonderfully situated to all and the view from here over the canal is amazing,plus the buses.Admittedly the old Waikiki is virtuly gone but one can still find signs to explore especialy on The Bus which is just so good if you have the time, you can fill in any day just on the bus, the #14 Malalani Hgts is a must the view is great on the steep narrow roads, this bus leaves around 15 past the hour takes you near the Kahala Hilton Hotel a nice walk in to see the Dolphins have a swim and lunch close to the beach, on the top floor of the Hotel the view is great I do this every year, back on the bus to the Kahala Mall not big but a nice visit, the easiest way to plan this trip is just ring The Bus they are very good at explaining all. The Interntional Market place is no more but the new building will be lovely to wonder around if out of most peoples range. Outrigger West is now a Hilton and quite nice, it is still magic to walk along Kalakaua on the balmy nights,down by Queens Beach there is an eating place outdoors that have very good Fish and Chips plus other food also there on Tuesday Thursday & Sunday nights you can listen to the locals play and sing, real Hawaiian feeling. I personally can't believe how safe it is to walk out on the main drag at night when alone, I have done this solo for most of my time here and enjoy every moment just cruising. Also walk along the beach at night, go through the hotels just to look see the beach ones are lovely. Lots of people complain about what is happening, just forget that and look beyond,walk on from the Police Station along the promenade and enjoy the thrill of being in Waikiki, the days at the beach are simply gorgeous.Lots of nice places to eat so enjoy. Always feel free to ask ,always someone ready to tell you all.

review_body: One of the tallest buildings in Waikiki and centrally located so you are walking distance from everything WaikikiVery secure building and easy in and out parkingAll amenities worked and have the use of a full kitchen and fridge made it a nice stayWill definitely stay again

My family and I stayed at Aqua Skyline for two nights and loved it! Brian was so helpful and efficient at making my reservations. He also made checking in and checking out a breeze. The atmosphere was very relaxing and we loved the amenities. I was shocked to find out that renting movies and games were free! The last time we stayed at a hotel, I had to pay for movies. If you're looking for a relaxing vacation or staycation away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, this is the place. We had a great time and felt very safe with security walking around and making sure everyone was safe. Thank you Brian and everyone at Aqua Skyline! We will definitely be back!

I booked this hotel room after numerous searches over many days. The room looked quite modern and new as it has been updated, unfortunately the make over was on the cheap side. The bed was lumpy and not comfortable. The wifi was impossible to connect to, not sure if it was just so very slow. The bathroom was designed for disabled guests, which is great if you are disabled but we are not so, the hand held shower was too low so it had to be held by hand during the whole time in the shower, and there was no where to place our usual bathroom cosmetics apart from on top of the toilet, not ideal. But the main problem was the noise - The air-conditioner is ancient, and when turned on it sounds like a truck driving through the room, so to allow some cool air the only choice was to open the sliding door to the balcony & the problem with that is that being on the 38th floor you hear all the noise of the city rising up, there seems to be a lot of police and ambulances around at night! Apart from all that the room was a good size and the balcony was quite large, and the kitchen was adequate for our needs. I would also like to add that the staff were wonderful and welcoming.

The room we stayed in only had AC in the bedroom. This made it extremely difficult for the living room/kitchen cool off during the day since there's a hallway connecting the two. We tried to have a fan "push" the air into the living room to no avail. The pool is a decent size but quickly got crowded since this condo has both visitors and residents. It also had so much chlorine, I could smell it from the lounge chairs. I appreciated the security on site as well as the secured elevators. However, the security guards were very grouchy/unfriendly. We tried to ask one a question and he looked up at us, then picked up the phone to make a call! Wowzers...nevermind then. lolParking is $30/day. Which is the standard price in Waikiki. But if you can find parking along the Ala Wai, take it. There's also a laundry room and small store on lvl 6. Very convenient!

We have stayed in Waikiki a few times now and found this hotel suited us best. Fully self contained with BBQ area and Swimming Pool & Laundry. Fantastic location. One block from the main drag. One block from the Galleria and just around the corner for the trolley buses. Everything was in walking distance. Supermarket just around the corner. We had fantastic views of the beach. Helpful staff. Would definitely stay here again

We found Roger's 1 bedroom apartment, available on HomeAway, to be a perfect space for a family of 4 to base themselves for a Waikiki holiday. The apartment is spacious, modern & has all the facilities needed for the family to function upon checking in. The kids sleep on comfy beds converted in the lounge room, so parents can adjourn to the bedrooms balcony- a relaxing space overlooking the canal and northern end of Waikiki. Island Colony has the usual excellent facilities of a resort like Pool, Spa, Gym & Laundry - but also has an excellent convenience store open late & a great coffee shop in the foyer. Enterprise Rental Cars is also downstairs and gives discounts to guests. Great location, with views of the ominous mountains & canal. 2 block walk to grocery store (Food Pantry), Bus stops 1 block walk, Waikiki beach 3 blocks, downtown shops/restaurants 2 blocks.

Very comfortable and clean enviroment. Staff was friendly and helpful. Liked that there was a convienence store in the building. Overall great experience Me and my girlfriend enjoyed our stay and would stay here again!

We stayed on the 39th floor in a condo we booked on Air Bnb. The accommodations were wonderful and the view was spectacular! Walking distance to Waikki beach and restaurants. We didn't use any of the amenities but there are plenty offered.

Stayed here for a week in mid March. The location is quite good, close to public transportation and walkable distance to shops in Waikiki. The room we had was on the upper level and the view is amazing. The room is of reasonable size with the two double beds but the bathroom is on the small side. The shower head is quite low and I had to stoop during shower. There is a small kitchenette and a small fridge in the room. Rooms are fairly noise-free apart from the old air conditioner. The toiletries and towels were replaced daily, though rooms are not cleaned daily. Wifi is fair. The staff at the reception were friendly and helpful. There is a pool and a small shop on the 6th floor as well as self service laundry facilities. Overall, a pleasant stay.

This location has everything you need to enjoy your Hawaiian vacation. The only drawback was the roaches and cleaning standards. To the mgt - actively use Hoy Hoy trap a roach to become a four star destination!

Lailani,trenidad,mar, your crew stuff in this hotel very kind very helful always keep high standard. And did great job my room always clean. This hotel close for every thing main strip anything that you want todo waikiki to restaurent, if love hiking outdoor swim. In the ocean anything that you want.

Caroline at the tour desk, at the Island Colony, was fantastic, she helped us with all our tours.... Was warm & friendly, & couldn't do enough for us, I would go back to her in a flash... Thanks to her, she made our holiday memorable & fun, & when it was time to leave, she helped out when our transfers were stuffed up, even though it had nothing to do with her company, she was a life saver....

The room was amazingly spacious, modern, conveniently located in Waikiki across the street from the Ala Wai Canal; parking along the Ala Wai was convenient (depending on the time of day), if not, hotel parking at an affordable fee; the spacious deck was a treat; the staff was professional, friendly and courteous. The bed was extremely comfortable with a flat screen TV.This hotel is my go-to while on Oahu on my next visit. I highly recommended it!

I had the privilege of staying at Aqua Skyline Island Colony for a week not by choice, but because My other accommodations got fouled up. I must say it was one of the best places that I have ever stayed at. I am a firm believer, that everything happens for a reason. Everyone there from the front desk staff to the housekeepers all went out of there way to make sure myself and my families stay was a memorable one. the adults in our party sure enjoyed the managers reception and the view from there made for some great pictures. You all rock at Aqua Skyline! This hotel is the true meaning of Aloha.

We had three rooms for the weekend for my daughters birthday. It was a good weekend, got a lot of time to spend with my family. Enjoyed the pool and the bbq grills the most! The staff of the hotel was very kind, they always provided good customer service. Aaron who works at the front desk answered many of our calls everytime we had a question or needed anything. Housekeeping provided us with great service as well and Mar or Maria brought most of the things we needed or asked for. Location of the hotel is good because its away from all the crowd and all the busy street, very calm and relaxed place. Overall our stay was memorable and we will definitely come back again.

This place is great. The location is convenient and close to a lot of restaurants and shops. The hotel itself is nice and the room is very comfortable. Aaron at the front desk was very helpful and kind. I have nothing to complain about this place, price is great, location is great, amenities is great, and staff is great.

I wanted to thank the entire front desk staff (Kovy, Marlon, Brian, Teri, Aaron, & Leilani) for there Aloha, knowledge, & professionalism. Check in/out always a breeze. Rooms are adequate & clean with spectacular mountain or ocean views. Recommended to all.

They say this is the tallest building in Waikiki and the view from our room was amazing. The room was very clean and spacious. Bed was very comfortable and did not have a problem with anything in the room. Pool is big and next time we will use the grill to BBQ. Location is convenient enough, the walk to the beach is not that far. Maids that cleans our room were awesome, room was cleaned well everyday. Front desk staff were also great, Aaron check us in quick and was very welcoming. If you decide to stay here, ask for the highest floor as long as you're not afraid of the height.

Needed a quiet weekend to get away from it all. Chose to make it a weekend staycation in Waikiki. Love the convenience and great accommodations. It's close to my favorite restaurant, Doraku Waikiki. Had a few friends come and enjoy the day by the pool. Can't wait for my next weekend getaway. Thank you to all the staff at Aqua Skyline at Island Colony for always being to professional and helpful.

Where do I begin? checked in later than we anticipated because of our dinner plans but it didn't take long at all. We were given the keys to our room and a card to rent a dvd to watch during our stay. ( love that about aqua hotels ). Our room was on the 43rd floor, which I thought was way too high, but when I saw the evening view, it was so worth it. We had brought leftovers from our dinner out and was able to put it in the fridge when we got to the room. housekeeping came by shortly after with champagne, chocolate and a birthday card for me. how nice is that? Thank you. Awesome room with King size bed, and a big chair that converts to a single bed. Everything was so nice and seemed recently updated. kitchenette and bathroom....by the way, loved the rain shower, I don't have that at home. Hotel was really nice and convenient, near everything in Waikiki. The next morning we walked to Duke's for breakfast, and then came back and relaxed, watched our movie and checked out the 6th floor. The next time we will stay longer to take advantage of the pool and the barbecue. Thanks for helping make my 40th birthday a memorable one. Shout out to Brian and Leilani :)

I stayed last year for my anniversary. Nice rooms and great location!! Call them direct as they offer best rates! They also have newly renovated rooms with amazing view of the Diamond head and ocean view! Amazing service from Brian S, Steve and Kovy!! Can't wait to be back!

So this was a cheaper accommodation option in Honolulu where it can be really pricey. We stayed for a week and felt it was just what we needed. Big bed, small kitchette and a balcony with table and chairs. Not the most modern of places but it was clean and functional. We didn't really use the pool area but it looked good and the convenience store onsite was good, as was the cafe downstairs in the foyer. We really enjoyed the location as it was pretty central and there was also a free shuttle to Ala Moana shopping centre. One downside was that it was pretty stormy while we were there and the balcony doors rattled all night a couple of nights so sleep was a bit poor....

Front desk was very nice and helpful. Gave me maps and explained how to get places and suggested places to eat close by. Nice room with great amenities for a traveling family. Kids loved the pool and hot tub. Laundry services on site for very reasonable prices! Even a store on premises and a BBQ area. Our next trip to Oahu we will be staying here again!

The island colony in central waikiki is well located about half way between Ala Moana shopping centre and the zoo. This puts you central for all waikiki dining and shopping.the local bus is one block away on Kuhio ave. and will take you anywhere on the island by a transfer at the ala Moana centre. The beach is technically two blocks away but in order to access you must go another block to a beach access walkway.Waikiki is very noisy with traffic and constant construction in one spot or another, often in many locations. To find a little quiet take a bus heading in the diamond head direction and get off at kapiolani park where you can relax under a banyan tree or sit on a quieter beach. You can see many fish by walking out on the pier just before the aquariumThe rooms at the island colony vary a great deal depending on if you have one which has been renovated or not. There are some one bedroom units with full kitchen and separate bedroom. These are good if you would like to cook.The pool area is great with plenty of lounges, a large pool and hot tub. But as with most hotel hot tubs the water is not very hot. Separate of the pool area is a large BBQ area with new gas bbqs that you can use after requesting at the security desk.Laundry is on this same floor so convenient to use while you sit at the poolThe lanais ( balconies) in all rooms are large offer great views.

Booked a 1-Bedroom Suite and a Studio Kitchenette for a birthday party I was hosting. One of the hotel managers (Kovy) was kind enough to get rooms right next to each other, which made sleeping and going between rooms extremely convenient. Also, he sent up champagne and chocolates to help kick off a fantastic weekend with my close friends!The room layout is very nice and bigger than expected... I easily fit my 7 guests between the two rooms and we all enjoyed the party very much. This hotel is truly a hidden gem in Waikiki. Checked in with Leinani (?), who was very accommodating, kind, and efficient. The guestroom corridors are a bit dated, but the rooms are clean and updated enough. Loved the full size fridge in the 1-Bedroom suites! Internet a bit slow, but usable. Will definitely be booking here for future stays!

I book this hotel without knowing what to expect since this is my first time coming to Hawaii. My hotel view is amazing. From the right to left, I see Waikiki beach, the mountain, the canal and the golf course. With the view like this, I don't need to go anyway. I can just sit on the balcony the whole time. This hotel is centrally located. Practically walking distance to any places. One block away is cracking kitchen, Starbucks, bus stops to diamond head, pearl harbour etc. this hotel is part residents and part hotels. This hotel,is a bit dated though

The view was spectacular on higher floors! Internet speed was slower than dial up. Not even worth connecting. Location was fabulous and central to grocery shopping, dinning out, and scrolling. Local farmers' market was great place to get local foods. Great experience overall.

Room was clean and service was allright. What do you need more? We had the city view room and got an upgrade to a one bedroom suite. Loved it. The room was freshly upgraded. Nothing fancy but still more than I expected for the roommate we had payed. The first night our room wasn't ready so we stayed in a regular room. This was not bad at all either. Ofcourse the next room was even more perfect. The location is allright. Just a short walk to the beach. I havent used the facillities, but my husband did and it was just great. You have to pay 5 dollars administration fee when you like to use the gym, but it's wordt it. Service was perfect, kind and helpful receptionists. Especially the lady. Don't know her name:(

Been to this hotel twice through a private owner. Located on the 43rd floor it has one of the best views of diamond head from waikiki. The building has some of the fastest elevators I've ever been on which I found impressive. They have 4 elevators to service the many residents and tourists, and usually you won't spend more then 1 min waiting for an elevator unlike some other hotels I've been to. I hate waiting for elevators. There is a pool, and hot tub located on the 6th floor. As well as a convenience store, bbq's and picnic tables, and coin operated laundry facilities(you can also use a credit card). I would avoid the convenience store unless there is something you actually need or can't get it from somewhere else. As you will end up paying more for the convenience. This is a non smoking building but there is a smoking area located just out front. Left of the entrance if your looking at the building from outside. They also provide a free honolulu star newspaper to everyone, which you can grab from the stack on the front desk. I can't really comment on the rooms since my rental was through a private owner but ours was about the size of a bachelor pad and had a nice sized balcony(big enough to accommodate 8 people comfortably) overlooking the east side with a perfect view of diamond head. I'd say once you get past the 38th floor you start getting an unobstructed view. This is a great place to stay and every year I come, I book this hotel. It's only a couple blocks away from waikiki beach. Conveniently located close to bus stops, shopping centers, restaurants and bars, and a food pantry grocery store. I would recommend going to Don Quijote's and Walmart for groceries though(about 20-25m walk).

This hotel is perfectly located in Waikiki. A couple of blocks from the beach, near bus stops that will take you all over, a laundry room with many machines at a fair price, a very comfortable room, a small kitchenette, a small store to buy basics, BUT the room does not get cleaned. The maid makes the bed and straightens the bathroom towels. That's it. My husband and I are very neat people. We cleaned the stove and sink every time we used it. But we didn't have the equipment to vacuum the crumbs or wash the floors. When walking barefoot, I could feel the sand that we brought in from the beach the day before, still on the floor near the bathroom. One evening I saw a cockroach walking along the counter top. The next morning I went to the reception desk to complain. The man asked me what specifically I want done in the room. I replied that I don't require anything special, I just want the maid to do what maids usually do. Then, at that moment, to prove my point, a roach walked across the reception desk!! Apparently this hotel has a problem. It's a shame because this hotel is wonderful in all other respects but this is a terrible flaw!!

New York City, New York

review_body: We landed in Honolulu late evening and on arrival to the Hotel were asked to pay our taxes for our stay. I found that quite annoying as we just arrived and wanted to just put our feet up due to our long flight from the UK.In future I believe the Hotel should upload pictures of the exterior as this is not on the website. The pictures on-line are day and night difference from reality. The rooms looked dated and needed refurbishment from the modern rooms advertised on-line.A little pointer, there are permanent residents living in the Hotel.Positive Points:- Staff are friendly- Tour guide situated within the Hotel- Location is perfect, short distance walk to the beach/shops

OK It's not the Four Seasons but it is clean and comfortable in a great location with amazing views. I only stayed for one night but enjoyed my visit. The front desk staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful. The room is well appointed. Had I stayed longer than one night, I would have been perfectly comfortable there. The room has a microwave, coffee pot, kitchen sink and a hot plate with pots and pans and dishes/cutlery. All of this came at a very reasonable price.The only deterrent is their hallways are old and dank but you only spend a few minutes in those. The rooms have new carpeting and a nice bed and its very clean. This place has a great housekeeping staff. Can't beat that.

Wonderful experience staying at the Aqua Skyline. The front desk staff were super helpful and friendly. They definitely exemplified the 'Aloha Spirit'. I loved the amenities offered by the hotel. They have an on-site convenience store, coin-operated laundry, small fitness gym, pool, jacuzzi, and sauna. There is also a bbq area on the pool deck for your use as well. Our room also had a little studio kitchenette. I think ALL rooms have the kitchenette, again, a nice convenience that you can't even find in some of the other bigger resorts. The location of the hotel is perfect as well. It's right in the middle of Waikiki so it is within walking distance of the beach and directly up the street from the Royal Hawaiian Hotel. It is also located about 2 blocks away from Marukame Restaurant (highly recommended restaurant)!All-in-all, a very pleasant experience. Thank you again to the amazing Aqua Skyline Staff, more specifically Leilani, Brian (front desk), Brian (security), and Terri. Your warm hospitality and excellent customer service has definitely sealed my decision to return again in the near future for another staycation. Mahalo!

My mom and I booked a four night stay in September. We arrived in the evening and found out we were upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite. We had a great view from the balcony off the bedroom and could see downtown Waikiki and the canal that runs behind the hotel. I loved the Mango hair and body products that were left in the bathroom daily. It would have been nice to have a hook or some place to hang some clothes in the bathroom. If it's a couple sharing, might not be required.We found the location great as the two tours we booked had pick up locations within a block or so of the Aqua Skyline at Island Colony. Starbucks is a short walk as is many little shops to pick up some gifts.We used the DVD rental a few times and saw some movies in the evening (included in the resort fee). On Tuesday we went up to the rooftop for the managers reception. It was a nice snack or appetizer in the evening (Salsa and chips, crackers and cheese and drinks). Staff was friendly and helpful.Used the internet a few times without any problems, it's included with the resort fee. I would stay again.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Brian was great. Room was very clean and housekeeping was very efficient. Have stayed there many times and will definitely do so again. View of Ala Wai canal Cowan. Enjoyed watching outrigger canoes going down canal.

It was a last minute trip to come to Hawaii and my last experience with Holiday Inn resort was not pleasant. I decided I didn't want to spend that much money for 2 nights only. Went online and found decent review and price for this hotel and decided to book it. I was not expecting anything fancy or nice as I knew it was not on the main strip of Waikiki. The hotel has an interesting layout, including the bathroom has its own window inside the room. The bathroom is very cramped and small. Overall, it was easy to get in and out of the hotel in terms of getting to places I needed to go. However, I seems to be a pretty far walk if you are trying to go there on vacation to see the beach of walk down Waikiki.

So from the 17-22, I was going to be in Honolulu visiting my boyfriend, and I wanted to try another place after previously staying at the Aqua Bamboo Waikiki. Once my flight came in I took a cab to the hotel, and I loved the lobby! It was open to outside, and my room was ready two hours early, so they let me check in right away which was perfect. I got to my room and it was so clean and bright, and spacious for what I was expecting! It was a lot better than the Aqua Bamboo rooms, which were small and very dark. The rooms kind of aura just gave so much natural light and the brightness just made you always feel happy! And the lanai was huuuuuge! The Aqua Bamboo lanai was small but there was two of them, Aqua Skyline only had one but it definitely made up for in size. I had breakfast out there every day! And the view was crazy beautiful. If you look to the right you see the canal and mountains, and to the left was the ocean. I can't praise it enough for the views. The parking was also a lot more easier to get into than the Aqua Bamboo's parking lot! This one was a lot bigger and had a lot more room to it. It was better too because you paid for parking after you left the parking lot, so say you only parked there for half the day, you don't have to pay the full 25$ parking for the day, my boyfriend only ended up paying like 7-12$ most of the time! I really really liked the hotel, the people that worked there were very kind and got me a taxi right away when I needed one. The housekeeping lady was very very sweet too. It was very welcoming and definitely the best time I've ever had in Oahu. It's literally an 8 min walk to Waikiki beach too, it's a couple blocks away and it's a really nice walk there. I kind of liked the short walk too instead of being right right there, it was nice to see Waikiki! The only tiny downside I would say about the hotel is that the elevators take forever to get up! Because there's so many floors and so many stops that people make on the way up and down, you could end up waiting for the elevator for over five min. Not that big of a deal though! And it was forever away from Schofield, not that that's the hotel's fault lol, just a bummer to me. For the price of the hotel, I think it is way under priced and definitely beyond worth your money. And not to mention it saves you a few bucks compared to the Aqua Bamboo, and it is a lot nicer in my opinion! I don't think this hotel deserves any bad reviews! Loved my stay! If I come again I'll definitely stay here :)

I want to start off by saying that out of the 10 staff i dealth with the 5 day length of our stay, 9 was really happy to help us, the type of people that seems like they love their job. I booked a 2 queen bed, on the high floor with panoramic ocean view i was told 36 floor and up. Paid for it in full before flying to HI. Checked in, our room is "having a plumbing issue" really did not believe it for a second, the front desk was very nice, has this wide smile on her face, offered me 2 options, they are basically upgrading us to a bigger room, but without the ocean view, we took it, as it is too late at night to argue, and it looks like we do not have any other options. Went to that room, unpacked, the phone rang. we have to move out of that room on our last night, apparently they double book it. I remained calm, it was still the same lady that help me at check in, offered me 2 days worth of (resort) fees which is $30, i said i want 2 days of parking ($50) for me to pack and unpack again, we have 4 luggage, i have 2 small children under the age of 6, i was a tired mother who works full time lol. Anyway, the night before we were to move to the other room, i started packing, packed everything. My huband got a trolly to move our stuff. The phone rang, it was the front desk saying we can now stay in that room. I thought my eyes where going to pop out of my head LOL i was not happy. I took the phone and said that i need to vent, i mentioned that i spent the last 2 hours packing, now for nothing since we are not moving anymore. The front desk apologize, i said i want to keep my $50 refund, they said they will give us $60. Although i would have preffered not to get the $60 refund and to just have the room we originally booked. We think that their booking system is not very effective. Not sure if i will be back. Theres all sorts of arrangement in this hotel, some people owns a suit, some rents, some parts are hotel, try to figure booking all that, good luck. Other Issues we had:You can hear the vehicles on the road, we were on the 14th floor. The bathrooms are really small. About 7ft x 7ft.Only 1 mirror available if you need to put on make up or do your hair.The hallways need a major face lift. Kind of creepy.Getting out of the parking is crazy, they do manual check in check out at the parking. No machines. Took us 10 minutes to get out. Insane.Shuttle is not reliable. They come when they come. No real schedule. The pool cleanliness is Very questionable.

Stayed here a couple times. Most recently for my birthday and I must say we'll be coming back for as long as they'll keep taking us! Great hotel with great staff and a breath taking panoramic view of the mountains and ocean! Convinent store located with in the hotel and also great location in Waikiki! Five stars all the way!

Stayed her for a Birthday party in a one bedroom suite with an ocean view. The Suite was big and roomy with a full kitchen and huge lanai. The staff always seemed happy to help and even gave us a bottle of wine since we were celebrating a birthday. Will be back next year. Mahalo Aqua Skyline!

Decided to try someplace new this stay and I am glad I did! I am not one to drive on Oahu so needless to say the location is great for just putting on a pair of shoes and walking around Waikiki. Very nice staff, nice spacious and clean room. Enjoyed all of my four nights at the property. Definitely looking forward to my next say.

I staid here with a friend in a studio apt on the 12th floor. The location is really good and within walking distance of anything you want to do in Waikiki. The room itself had a bad odor when we first entered -- it was as if someone with bad body odor had staid in the room before us. We kept the sliding door open to air the room out. The studio had a twin bed, full size bed and futon, along with a table, but there was still enough room to maneuver. Also, the kitchen was very minimal -- two burners (no oven) and a very small sink, mini fridge and microwave. Our bathroom was of medium size and I have no complaints about it as per other TA reviews. The room faced the front of the building and overlooked the canal, so really no view to speak of. However, I enjoyed sitting on the patio each morning to take in the warm air. Being in Waikiki, I didn't intend to spend much time in my room, so it was acceptable. I'm very glad that we didn't rent a car for this portion of our trip, as you can get around by foot or bus quite easily. Pros: On-site convenience store that sells beer and alcohol, as well as medicine; liked the pool and hot tub; Enterprise rental car is at street level if you need a car for a day; close to many bus routes; and overall good location to explore Waikiki. Cons: Our room was small -- if you're more than two people, get a room with an actual bedroom; outdated furnishings -- looks nothing like photos by management; bad odor in room; only provided one roll of toilet paper.

Location is pretty good and has good city views!Our room was far too small for 4 people and there wasn't enough kitchen cutlery to cater for the four of us. There was also no bottle opener for beers or wine so we had to ask for one from reception, when we made the request the lady was rude and unhelpful and had a serious manner.Our first morning we get woken up to an electrician wanting to play around with the cable. The second night we got woken up by an alarm that went on and on at 3am.I was on the phone is the hall talking as i wanted to get out of the small room and the security guard says that i can't talk on the phone in the hall and escorted me back to my room (I guess this shows there is good security).

At 3:30AM, the fire alarm went off after security accidentally tripped it. No apology, no refund. Wow.In case that's not enough to compel you to try any other 'hotel', aqua isn't a real hotel at all. This is a dingy apartment building for poor locals that rents a few rooms on various floors as a pseudo-hotel. I'm surrounded by old, fat smokers. Plus... there's noise through the walls and tons of construction noise from outside, endless police sirens, and car alarms. Also expect to spend an hour per day in the elevator, as you can't take one elevator from the garage to your room. Avoid!

We had a room on the 42nd floor & the view was amazing! The hotel location was within walking distance to the main street & beach. Our room was clean & comfortable. Having a small kitchenette came in handy for making toast for breakfast before heading out for the day as well as having a fridge. The only negative about the room was the bathroom. It was the smallest bathroom I've ever had, way too small!

The hotel was a short walk to Waikiki beach and 2 blocks from the all of the Waikiki shops so the location was great. Parking was was reasonable for Waikiki area at $25. We had a 1 bedroom w/full kitchen. We didn't really cook but it was great to be able to cut fresh pineapple and stock a full size fridge. The lanai had a nice table and chairs that was great for sipping morning coffee. We had a decent view of the golf course and distant mountains, but not the beach or Diamondhead.All of the hotel staff was super friendly and helpful. The room had a blu-ray player, and they offered free rentals at the front desk. They also checked out beach towels which was great because washing and drying towels is such a pain on a beach vacation.The only reason I'm not giving 5/5 is because there was no air conditioning in part of the hotel room. There was a window unit in the bedroom so we slept well, but there was only a ceiling fan and a floor fan in the living room/kitchen area. That is the main reason we didn't cook, it was already pretty warm and we didn't want it getting any hotter in the common area.

Note: I usually stay at the Marriot Waikiki Beach or other top of the line hotels but they were not available due to a convention. So I am trying to review this in context of the level of accommodations.Overall the location is good, the room was clean, and the internet was fast. Check-in was a bit confusing since there is a hotel and an apartment building. I was given a room on the apartment building after initially being told they had no record of my reservation and to go to the other side.This is not bad if you are on a budget and do not need or like the amenities at an upscale hotel. The gym is not bad with elliptical and weight machines. There is not a real restaurant on site but a small cafe that is open during the day. The hotel is within walking distance of most of Waikiki beach.

review_body: Rented a suite with friends over Halloween weekend (10/31/15). Pleasantly surprised at the furnishings and accommodations of our 1-Bedroom Suite. The space and layout was better than expected. Everything was clean, and lots of open space for getting ready and comfortably accommodating 5 adults. Bathroom was clean, with plenty of towels. Staff was friendly and efficient. Hotel Manager Kovy Kovaloff was very hospitable and accommodating to our needs.Ample on-site parking (although the parking lot and elevators are kind of tricky!). Didn't have a chance to make it to the pool, but we could see from our room that there was a nice pool deck with lots of chairs and shaded areas. Great views from the room. Free Wi-fi. Simply put, this hotel is a hidden gem in the heart of Waikiki! Will definitely be returning here!

A beautiful place to stay with so many amenities like a convince store, pool, laundromat and BBQ area. The customer service were helpful and friendly. They always had a smile and always there when you needed them. The housekeeping staff were lovely and did a great job even when I left mess in the room. The room was amazing and we were upgraded from a studio room with a kitchenette to a one bedroom with a full kitchen. The toiletries smelt absolutely beautiful. The kitchen had almost everything that you have at home. I would easily come back here as myself and my children absolutely loved. My baby boy absolutely loved all the attention he got from everyone too.

This hotel/condo is in a perfect location if you're not looking to be on the beachfront. It also doesn't have the price of a beachfront hotel. The room we were given was on the 24th floor, so we had ocean glimpses. The room itself, was spacious enough with very comfortable beds. Yes, the air conditioning was a little loud but we got used to it. The bathroom was very small and my husband bumped his head on the rain head a couple of times but, again, we got used to it. The wifi worked a treat and once hubby got the tv going we were happy with the channels. We had a small issue with the safe but this was fixed promptly. Overall a great hotel/condo in a central location.

Nicelys locatedFurnitures and carpets need refreshmentNice staffClose to hsort distance to restos, boutiques and main attraction.Rental counmter next to lobby, and another one (Enterprise) in the parking outside.Little cafe for a quick breakfast

Beautiful view. The hotel was very comfortable and it was great to be able to have a kitchen and a separate living room. Almost like being at home! The convenience store at the hotel was a great help.

I stayed at the Aqua Island colony and was checked into the 37th floor. This hotel looks to be one of the tallest in Waikiki so the views from this floor were amazing! We were able to see Diamond Head and had an amazing ocean view. Let me tell you the highlights from my stay:-Reasonable pricing -recently renovated rooms-friendly staff-close to shopping and a few blocks from the beach-managers SkyTai. They serve cocktails and snacks on the roof!

Reasonable pricing, clean rooms, friendly staff.The pool was the best part!! Even more awesome there was a grocer on one of the floors!It was easy to plan your day trips as they catered down on the ground floor (reception area) to book things such as parasailing, walks, snorkels which made it a whole lot easier rather than trying to go out and find it yourself!

Jessie Uy in housekeeping found my clothing and photo of my only son and mailed them back to me. Brian at front desk patient and helpful and the concierge as well. great location for walking. luved it

I have stayed at Aqua Skyline over a handful of times now. The hotel is centrally located to shopping centers, restaurants and a less than 15 minutes of walk to the Waikiki Beach. The view on the higher level rooms are spectacular. Brian Kovi Kovaloff and Monalisa Tupia are part of the reasons why I choose Aqua Skyline. Mahalo for your kind hospitality. Tips: Request a room on an even numbered room for an amazing firework shows happening every Friday.

Our stay here was awesome. It was noted in an email that during our stay Aug14-21 it would be my birthday to my surprise they had a bottle of wine and a box of Chocolate cover macadamia nuts waiting for me in the room.. The views were magnificent with a partial ocean view room on the 34 floor with views of Diamond head as well as city lights at night. The staff was very pleasant, helpful and greeted you with an Aloha and smile every time you saw them. The elevators were fast, never having to wait even with the 44 floors this hotel has. There was no noise from guest or housekeeping. I would certainly stay here again !!

We did a late check in and the front desk staff was very friendly, quick and professional. My initial observation of the lobby and the hotel as a whole was very clean and very nice. After check-in we walked into our room and accommodations were very modern, clean on trendy. Our room on the 33rd floor had an amazing view of Waikiki and Diamond Head. The hotel is centrally located in Waikiki and was in walking distance to the restaurant where we had dinner reservations and the bars where we met up with friends to celebrate. I would strongly recommend this hotel to Hawai'i locals and mainland visitors looking for a great hotel at a great value.

A mixed bag with this place, so make sure you weigh up your priorities first. But would I stay here again - short answer, no.The good - Location wise, it's not too bad. While a 10 to 12 min walk from Waikiki beach itself, the's pretty centrally located on the Waikiki strip. It always seemed to be the same 10 to 12 min walk to either end of Waikiki (as in it took the same time to walk to Hilton Village end from this hotel as it did to walk to the Moana Surfrider end). Straight down the road (Seaside Ave) is the Royal Hawaiian Mall along with all the shops you'd want to visit like H&M, Sephora and the DFS Duty Free mall. The room itself was nice enough for this price range, actually surprisingly well appointed. Bed was comfy, bathroom was reasonable (apart from shower, see below) and cable TV with reasonable selection of channels. They also have included movie rentals and a small selection of PS3 games should the rain be unrelenting (if you paid the hospitality fee which was included when I booked anyway). Parking is, in my research, on the cheaper end for Waikiki hotels ($25/day when you get a slip from reception upon check in). Although, strangely, the sign outside the parking lot said $30/day with the slip, so I'm guessing the $25/day could be increasing in the near future - just make sure you check if this is an important part of your planning. Parking is unlimited entry and exit - a big plus AND I never had a problem finding a space - it seems to have enough capacity for now. The view was also very nice from the 34th floor. Their pool and pool deck area is nice with BBQs and tables. There's a minimart open from 8am to midnight which is handy - they sell cup ramen, snacks, drinks (including alcoholic drinks), basic household items, sanitary products and basic first aid stuff along with sunscreen. Other residents there seem friendly and respectful. Free wifi in room - although it didn't work, I couldn't be bothered calling reception as I just plugged in my travel router to their router and it worked. Internet was fast enough for me! Room rates were very reasonable and competitive - but read the bad points before deciding!The bad - Noise. We had to sleep with earplugs. Street noise even on the 34th floor was unbearable especially on Friday and Saturday - emergency services and stupidly loud motorbikes. Why - the room has glass louvers that don't seal closed. Also the air conditioner seems to be a cheap box window type. How loud is the air con unit alone? 67db, not at the unit, but at the bed! 71db at the unit itself. 67db is the same noise level as having someone talking to you according to OSHA. If you can't sleep with someone talking to you all night long - then good luck. Housekeeping was inconsistent in giving us the amenities, some days no shampoo or shower gel, other days no lotion or hair conditioner. Seriously?? I even left the empty tubes out so you'd get the hint! Ants - not many, but there was a minor trail that never went away even after their attempts at cleaning. Yes, they didn't directly bother me too much, but it is an indicator of quality overall. Shower was tiny and very low. I'm 5'7" and I just fit under it. Hope to tilt the shower head to accommodate a taller person, nope, sorry no luck. It's a water saving rain shower. Tilting it does nothing.Overall, I'd stay elsewhere even if it did cost more. Accommodation was okay. Staff were nice though and they do supply beach towels and (heavy) beach chairs. Noise level and housekeeping consistency was a big let down. There's lots of improvement to be made and might I add, I think a small amount of investment would improve the quality of this place significantly.

Awesome customer service, very friendly workers, very clean, awesome management. its pretty cheap and affordable and close to a lot of food places and close to the waikiki strip and the beach. Everything is in walking distance. Nice and clean swimming pool with jaccuzi. Will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Stayed here for 8 nights with my family and we were all satisfied with the hotel. This is actually not a hotel, it a condo building with a few rooms being managed as a hotel, but it still has all the amenities of a typical hotel.Just a heads up for people planning on booking this hotel. There is a resort fee of $15 USD per night that has to be paid up front when checking into the hotel. They also charge for parking which is $25 which can be paid daily or you can pay for the total cost upfront, the first time you exit the parkade. We booked a room with 2 queen beds and kitchenette. When booking, we requested a room on a high floor, which we got (22nd floor). The rooms were clean, and recently renovated. The kitchen was stocked with cookware (a pot and pan) and plates, bowls, utensil and mugs. The room also had it's own wireless router but the speed were erratic (sometimes 11 mbps download, other times 0.4 mbps download). There were times where the internet was so slow, I had to use data on my phone. A PS3 was available in room, where you can use it to play DVDs or games which you can rent from the machine on in the lobby. I did not rent anything because the movies and games available were not that great (same games/movies you would find in the $4.99 bin at Walmart). I brought my own Chromecast so I could stream Youtube and Netflix to the TV.We liked the fact that this hotel had a large lanai with 2 chairs and table. Our biggest gripe about the hotel is that there is a motion sensor and a door sensor for the air conditioner. The door sensor is placed on the lanai sliding door and if the door is kept ajar, then the air conditioner would shut off. This is understandable, but the motion sensor would shut off the air conditioner if it did not sense any motion in a given period of time. On the first night, we did not know about this and family woke up, drenched in sweat to find the air conditioner has switched off some time ago. The nights afterward, we had to wave our arms and legs periodically to trigger the motion sensor and keep the air conditioner on. Also the shower head in the bathroom is not designed for tall people. I am 6ft and my head hit the shower head so I had to slouch in order to shower.Other than that, I would recommend this hotel since it is so close to the beach (5 min walk) and to Kalakaua Avenue, the staff are nice and helpful, the hotel is reasonably clean.

Stayed three days on business and this was the only place that had last minute rooms. It is a not very nice residential building rather than a hotel, so don't expect any hotel amenities. The pluses are that it is a great location and the rooms have been modernized to some extent. The downside is it is a condo building and a third-rate one at that with lots of loud people, kids running around, etc. There are paper notices all over saying things like don't drop your empty beer bottles over the railing to the pool deck below...

I visited Hawaii to celebrate my 40th birthday and my anniversary. Oahu was the first stop on a two island trip. We looked at other reviews on Trip advisor and decided to book a one bedroom suite through the hotel. When we first walked into our room it was very hot in the living room. We looked around for an AC but didnt see one. We looked around and we were shocked to find that there was only 1 air conditioner unit in the bedroom. The bedroom is to the back of the room seperated by a long hallway and it would take about 2 hours to cool down. We called down to the front desk and they told us that none of their one bedroom suites have air conditioners in the living room but we can give you a fan. A FAN?!! Any customer booking a one bedroom suite at any hotel would expect an A.C at minimum in each room or better yet central air. The unit in the bedroom is a plug in unit that also required someone from maintenance to come and empty water from a bucket on the balcony everyday! (See attached pics).The hotel says it's remodeled and that is true but don't be fooled into thinking that you are getting something better if you book a one bedroom suite. Another thing to mention is that the air conditioner automatically cuts off if you open the door on the balcony or if you leave the room. Everytime you come back to your room from being out in the hot sun all day you come back to a scorching hot room that takes 2 hours minimum to cool down.It was just me and my husband but if you were a family of 4 and you had to stay in a hot living room for close to a week that would be one horrible trip! There were some pros-the room was clean,housekeeping was very friendly, and the staff I did speak to at the front desk was friendly. Overall, this hotel needs to be more clear about what they are offering when you upgrade to a one bedroom suite. Don't boast that the rooms are newly remodeled but not mention that there isnt any air conditioning in both rooms of a 1 bedroom suite. This is my first review on but I felt compelled to let others know about this issue so they wouldn't be suckered into the mess we're in right now. Thank God we're on our way to stay at the Westin in Maui otherwise this trip would have been a bust!

mhobgood
New York City, New York

review_body: Dropped my young adult kids here for a one-night adventure after my disastrous attempt to book them at the horrible Kuhio Banyan (see review The Worst). They had a ball. Beautiful pool, free dvd rentals, kitchenette, balcony, nicely appointed room, block from Waikiki beach. Very reasonable rates. We will be recommending the Aqua Skyline to all who come to visit!

Beds are comfy. Not huge rooms but enough room. The bathroom though was really small, really small. Clean and close to all restaurants and shops. 2 streets away. Wifi is slow . Pool was good. Stayed on the 37th floor and even though I was ok with it, the elevator can take some time getting down and up depending on how busy it is. Residential property as well. Staff were lovely. For the price it's ok since you are close to everything. Walking distance. 2 double beds in a room and a few bags though can get a little hectic. Good size balcony and view was good. Little shop on the 6th floor that closes at midnight was handy. And self laundry facilities was great on the 6th floor also.

I recently stayed at the Island Colony Hotel with some family members who were visiting from the mainland. We had outstanding service and a hospitable welcome to a newly renovated 1 bedroom suite. A friend and employee of the hotel, Mona Lisa, was able to help us point us in the right direction, showing the aloha spirit to us during our stay. Needless to say, I loved the beautiful renovations and the accommodations. The workers are very friendly and helpful. I try to stay at the Island Colony whenever I am in the Waikiki area. I stayed there last month and I will be staying there again this week. Sincerely,Stephanie A.

This is an excellent property! It is conveniently located two blocks from the beach. The entire staff, from management to front desk, housekeeping, maintenance and security is fantastic!! Rooms are very clean and well appointed. Great facilities as well and a great value in the often over-priced Waikiki market. I am a business traveler and stay here every month and will continue to stay here at my "ohana" in Waikiki! Mahalo!!

While the hotel rooms aren't as new as the more expensive hotels, the rooms are clean and nice and not as expensive as the other hotels. We've stayed here three times now and each time was enjoyable. The pool is big and lots of room to lounge. There's a Starbucks just at the end of the block and the hotel is close enough to everything that it's just a couple blocks from everything good. I will keep using this hotel since it was clean, everything works, no bugs, everyone was friendly, easy to get in and out of and I have no negative points.
user_name:
Dave H
Marysville, Washington, United States

review_body: This hotel has great facilities. It has a pool, spa, big BBQ areas (6 BBQ's), Gym, a shop, ice machine, lots of washing machines and dryers a small cafe. It was really good value for money. The rooms were basic but clean and comfortable. Definitely value for money for people not wanting to spend too much but who still want great accommodation. It's only a short stroll to the heart of Waikiki, there's a great breakfast place just around the corner of the block and a McDonald's (which apparently is extremely important to 18 year olds) around the other corner.

An excellent stay for 3 months. Friendly, helpful staff that are very efficient and available at all times. Rooms are clean and services are great. The lobby and cafe are very nice. The managers happy hour is a fun place to meet people and see breath taking views of the city.

We spent a couple of nights here while on Oahu to wrap a few trucks. Check in was pretty straightforward with the usual extortion fee plus the give you a whopping more than genonous 10 bucks a nite off the 35 dollar parking fee. Wow. Then go to your room your treated to a regular international Bazar of cooking smells in the hallways. As well as the trash shoot door was just outside our door which added a particular roset of its own. Room ac. Set to 69 and kept the room at well maybe 75. The location is very good. The pool area looked nice. Did not use any of the services so cannot comment. Property is joint hotel / condo so it has a different vibe than a "resort" not a true hotel. Not a true condo. Purgatory is more like it.

The location of this huge block is good, very close to the Ala Wai Canal and within walking distance from both the beach & shopping areas. The spacious studios are well appointed with everything a tired tourist needs after a day discovering Hawaii's treasures. The small shop stocks essentials, the laundry has lots of large washing machines & dryers, coin or credit card operated, a pool, deck & barbeque area.The only downside is the noise which reverberates and ricochets off all the other tall buildings.

The hotel is located app. 500 meters from the beach, however, it is only 3 min. walk from the main shopping street. It is worth to notice the building is a mix of hotel rooms and apartments on all floors. As I stayed at the 36th floor, the view of the city was obviously great. However, there is still quite a lot of noise from the surrounding streets.

We stayed here for ten days, This hotel its awesome, The room is very clean and very spacious. The people at the front desk and very friendly and they always willing to help with anything. This hotel location is excellent , we were able to pretty much walk everywhere. We definitely be back and here is where we will stay for sure. We love it.

We have just returned from 10 days holiday in Hawaii, staying at this Hotel. We had a very nice renovated room on the 28th floor with an amazing view of the city and being so high also had a nice view of the ocean which was great. The room was comfortable with a king size bed a small couch, writing table and a large balcony, which was great as there were 4 of us, our friends were next door so we could all sit outside together and enjoy the sunsets. The pool was great and a good size along with the spa. Shop also on level 6 was very handy. All staff were very nice and friendly especially the lovely ladies who cleaned our room. (fresh sheets every 3rd day). The only thing I would say is the bathroom was very small and the shower head was very low. I am sure if you were tall you would hit your head on it. Also it was handy having cooking area not that we used it, but you had do the dishes in the bathroom sink. All and all a great place handy to town area and would stay at this hotel again

The hotel is great but there are several hidden charges. When I arrived the hotel, the staff told me that there would be a $15/day for wifi, DVD rental, safety box (extra charge by credit card), room cleaning etc. When I asked whether these are optional and she said it's mandatory. Furthermore, there is a $25/day charge for parking. Otherwise, I have to look for a parking space in a very busy area. The post on hotwire or priceline showed free wifi and parking icon but actually it is not! The hotel manager should be more honesty to public. Except that, the hotel location and service were good. The room is clean. There is refrigerator and microwave for use.

I stayed here the last two nights , I love it here my room was just renovated so that had to do a lot with it , I was also upgraded to a one bed room suite ( I'm lucky) .. everything was perfect chexk out so simple

This hotel has a mix of condos and hotel rooms. Our room was a condo that was not very well appointed. The bathroom was very small, but the lanai was very big! The bed was not comfortable for 2 normal size people. Bedding was not provided for the futon. Pillows were stained, so there was no way to know if they had been washed! The coin laundry was broken while we were there and the maids were using the few washers and dryers that worked. All this being said, it is a great location, bbq area and pool. Keep in mind you are in the city and it was very noisy!!! Our room had no GFI circuits, and numerous safety violations.

Great place to stay... Is very close to all points of interest, you don't need a car, everything is really close to you, just a few minutes walk to get to kalakahua av.. Being on Hawaii is all you need... Great service, very friendly,

Fortin de las Flores, Mexico

review_body: The place is a few blocks from the main Waikiki drag. We were booked this hotel through a Hawaii vacation package. We wish we would have upgraded to something a little bit more up to date. You don't really get the hotel feel. The rooms are clean but not really anything special. If you like the price, it is a fine stay within walking distance of shopping and restaurants. You aren't in the room except to sleep so it did the job.

We were very happy with our room here. We rented a room with a panoramic ocean view and kitchenette. The refrigerator was bigger than a mini fridge and smaller than a regular fridge. Our room was on the 32nd floor. It had a nice size balcony, too. It's unfortunate that there are buildings that have been built between the Aqua Skyline and the ocean, but you can still see the ocean. This is a great location, within walking distance to the beach, shopping, restaurants, and pick-up spots for tours. I thought we got a great room for a great price.

Additional $25.00 discount parking as guest plus $15.00 resort fee. And if you like use their gym you pay a $5.00 fee to security. Kids need to be 13 years old to lift with adult supervision. My son is 15. So to make matters worse we got kicked out of the gym very rudely I might say by security because me their dad was not in proper gym attire (in slippahs). Lady security was very nice but local braddah need to learn some class. There's a better way to talk to guest sir go dump that ego uniform trip. And for this reason or person alone, I'll be taking my business elsewhere in the future. Last time I'm staying here. Good riddance. Also ladies BEWARE, security can watch you from those two way mirrors installed around the gym without knowing their there watching.

Was not sure what to expect from this budget hotel, but if you want to do Waikiki on a budget and still have a nice stay this is the place for you. With friendly service, a decent location and a simple walk to the wonders of Waikiki I can honestly recommend this hotel. It has decent, fresh and clean rooms with amazing lanais, a kitchenette and a nice bathroom. The garbage chute outside our door worried me a bit, but once the door is closed there was no problem, although I would suggest some kind of air freshening system in the halls. The pool area is huge and very, very nice. There are grills and cabanas available free of charge, and a hot tub as well. This hotel also boasts a large laundry area and a small cafe and a convenience store. Parking, as anywhere in the city, is pricey, but at $25, it's not too bad, plus you have in and out privileges. All in all a nice place to stay.

Staff was very pleasant and helpful! Check in was a breeze! Marlon was very helpful! The room was clean and very spacious, everything was is very good working order and parking is always available. Looking forward to the next time I need to stay in Waikiki.
