Pearl City, United States

review_body: Our family of four (daughters 12 & 17) had been in Honolulu just 6mths earlier and had stayed at the Hyatt Place. This time we opted for a hotel that was more for a family and a little closer to the main avenue. Aqua Skyline fit this exactly. Most of the hotel is occupied by permanent residents, mostly students. We were in one of the rooms facing the pool and a side view out to the mountains. Even though the building is the tallest in Waikiki, we found (after actually checking them out), unless you are in the top rooms facing Diamond Head, you won't get a great view. Only the top floor offers that as so many buildings block the view of the floors below so we preferred to stay on our 8th floor room, overlooking the pool area. The room was perfect for us with a small kitchenette so we could have breakfast in the room without having to be up and ready by a certain time - it was a holiday so a couple of days to sleep late was good. There was a HUGE balcony. We sat out there most mornings and had breakfast. Used it to sit out and have dinner on a few nights too after using the hotel's bbq facilities. The pool, hot tub and sundeck were all great and we used them several times. Generally just a handful of people around and sometimes we had it all to ourselves. The hotel was VERY conveniently located. Just a few minutes walk from Kalakaua Ave so we were close to everything we needed. Absolute perfect location. The hotel's front desk staff were so friendly and accomodating. 100% service whenever we asked for anything. We used the concierge desk to organise car rental on two occasions and that also worked well. Numerous lifts so you never had to wait long. Most of the hotel had recently had a makeover and our room was spotlessly clean, fresh and modern. Beds were oh so comfy with great linen and pillows. We really couldn't have asked for more, but they provided it anyway - free hotel shuttle all over Waikiki!! That saved us SO much money. We didn't have to use the trolley at all. If we weren't walking somewhere, we had the use of the free shuttle. Last pick up was around 9.30pm. Great for going back & forth to Ala Moana, down to the beach at HHV and my husband even used it to get to the trail for the Diamond Head hike. It pretty much did a circuit and had different pick up locations. There was no pick up at Skyline so we just walked to the corner and waited at Aqua Wave. It really was a bonus. We would definitely stay here again on our next visit. The ONLY downside was that I neede the AC to beon during the night, but it was quite noisy and disturbed the kids. I think it was probably an older unit and did give out quite some noise even when we put it on low. Kept switching it on and off during the night as temp changed. Otherwise, couldn't recommend this hotel more.

Had a great time! We booked a room for a stay-cation and we had a great time. Great friendly staff and perfect location in Waikiki for fun, shopping, and dinning! Would definitely stay again and would recommended you do as well!

Mahalo to Leilani and all the staff for making my stay pleasant. Great location with the beach, shopping, & dining within walking distance. Rooms were clean & comfortable. I would recommend to others & return in the near future.

The entire staff at Aqua Skylibe at Island Colony was extremely friendly and helpful my entire stay, especially Leilani who helped me with a quick check-in. The room was very nice and the view was amazing. The hotel is centrally located in Waikiki and close to restaurants, bars and the beach. I can't wait to go back again.

The staff here are friendly and eager to please. No issues here. This was my second and last stay at this property. Check in was smooth and we reserved two rooms with an airline package. Room standards differ between rooms as these are rental pool accomodations. Had Booked two rooms with an airline package as we travelled as a family b Staff here are pleasant and eager to please. Check in was smooth and timely. Room one was acceptable but worn despite us being told it had been "renovated". Room two was far from acceptable- dirty with foot prints on the walls and doors, small cramped bathroom with long black hairs on the tub walls, dust on baseboards that was permanent and just plain in need of a major cleaning. Linens did not look clean and were stained even though the beds were properly and recently made. Upon our insisting and after some confusion and delay the front desk moved us the next day. This second room was a nice clean updated room but after two nights of all of us waking with sore throats which disappeared after we left the room, I checked the AC and saw it was filled with black mold. This is something to consider for those who have allergies. The Island Colony from what I was told has 150 privately owned rooms in a rental pool, the remaining 700 or so rooms are owner occupied homes. This lends itself to a very different feel compared to a sole hotel vacation property. General freshness/cleanliness and room quality needs attention - and not by air fresheners. Housekeeping services are minimal but adequate. We had to notify the front desk to remove garbage in the hallway from a owner occupied room however this was promptly delt with. It is a 15 minute walk to the beach so something to consider for those wanting closer to the beach. In general this is a dated property, probably quite swanky when built in 1979. A thorough clean and some refurbishing to bring it up to today's current vacation standards would improve the appeal. The staff already represent the hotel favourably. Having a regulated standard for the rooms they rent and advertise as being renovated would be beneficial for those vacationing here to prevent any surprises. The photos advertised do not depict most of the rooms accurately which is why the reviews could vary.

We booked this room last minute through their specials page and got a great rate for such a late booking. Check in was super quick and all the staff were very friendly any time we encountered them. We ended up on the top floor room 4407 (YMMV). The hotel is located at Island Colony which is a condo unit so there are hotel guests as well as residents in the building. There didn't seem to be any issue with the mix and it was quiet and the place was clean. Our room consisted of two beds, large flat screen tv, desk area, small kitchenette with basic utensils and settings for 4 and the bath. There was also a large balcony with a table and two chairs for eating since there wasn't a place to eat in the room. The breeze and views (and no bugs) made the balcony a perfect place to eat lunch when we were in the room and to eat dinner. The beds were very comfortable and the air conditioning worked great. Even though you are up so high, you can still occasionally hear the noises from below (sirens), but it wasn't too noisy and with the a/c on, you couldn't hear anything from outside. The place looked like it had been recently remodeled and the finishings had been upgraded. The bath was kind of odd though with a frosted window into the room for light. It wasn't a problem except for in the middle of the night if someone got up to use the restroom and turned the light on in the bathroom, it flooded the room with light as well. Also there is a bulkhead in the shower that prevents the rain shower head from being positioned at an appropriate height. I am 5'9" and had to turn it sideways to be able to stand under it. Someone didn't do the math. We had 2 minor issues in the room and we called the front desk and maintenance came up right away to assist. Both times they were friendly, quick and attempted to rectify the issue. The hotel was supposed to have wi fi , but it was almost non existent. I don't know if it was a router issue or the wifi service itself, but we could not get anything to connect with any type of speed so we used our 4G instead the entire time. The hotel was advised with a follow up questionnaire and they advised it will be addressed. The pool and hot tub deck was huge and there seemed to be enough room for everyone that was using it while we were there. You can get pool/beach towels at the front desk so there is no need to take the room towels with you. The hotel also has a gym, sauna, and laundry facilities available. Parking was $25 a day in the garage and you need to let the front desk know so you get the discounted rate. The neighborhood is great being a couple blocks from Waikiki, but not in the tourist path and there is a grocery store about 3 blocks away to get essentials for the room and lots of restaurants and take away places close by. There is also a walking path along the canal side that is great for walking or jogging. Overall I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again and with a couple of tweaks this place could be a 5 instead of a 4.

Aqua Skyline at Island Colony was a nice place. It wasn't the highest class place but it was nice. It's on the canal side of the island and the views of the mountain were good. It was a close walk to some restaurants and market. The walk to the beach was comfortable. The beds were good. The hotel is a little older but the balcony was a nice touch. There is a daily charge for parking but we were glad to have rented a car. The open air cafe was good and they were accommodating and made me a sandwich not on the menu. We would stay here again.

We were transferred here because of a problem at the Ewa Hotel where we had booked. It was supposed to be an Upgrade but was anything but. When we arrived, reception was unattended, and we had to wait around for several minutes until someone turned up to check us in. The room we were shown to was disgraceful. The lining on the curtains were shredded, and the bed was broken across the middle, and had loose springs. We didn't discover all his until we had partially unpacked and, as we were too tired to move, decided to just put up with the room as it was only for one night.

It is a condo/timeshare located in the heart of Waikiki. Squeaky clean, good views, kitchenette with all necessary equipment to cook home. Wonderful views. Very inexpensive - I've paid around a hundred per night with all fees and taxes included.

It saddens me to have to write this review of my recent stay at the Aqua Hotel. Based on the many good reviews and the cost it seemed like this hotel would be a great find for cost and location. My experience was with the hotel was terrible and if I could provide a lower rating I would. Upon arriving to my room I found that it was not cleaned very well at all. I had to call down to the front desk and request that cleaning supplies be brought to my room so I could wipe down the furniture and vacuum the floor. The maid service had obviously walked through the room, straightened out the bed and fluffed the pillows leaving dust, dirt and mess behind for the guest to deal with. I had really been looking forward to my escape to the sun so I put this behind me and got myself unpacked. It was very warm so I turned on the Air Conditioner when I arrived in the room and while unpacking was having a hard time breathing. I am allergic to dust and was astonished to find the filter on the in-window air conditioner had not been cleaned for a very long time based on the amount of dust and dirt that was on it. I was surprised any air could get through at all. Again I notified the front desk and washed the filter and replaced it in the unit. At this point I was getting frustrated and was surprised by the fact that the front desk staff and manager on duty did not seem to care about the fact that these things were going on. Another bump in the road was that the Wi-Fi in the room was not working. After calling they did send someone up to fix it and it did stay on and work for the rest of the stay. So dirty room, dirty filter on the AC unit that was crazy in the amount of crap on it and the Wi-Fi was not working all within 30 minutes of getting into my room. This room was definitely not customer ready as it should have been. The next day as of 1pm my room had still not been cleaned. I got ready to head out and locked my computer and iPad up in the safe. I later realized I left a white gold and black coral ring that I had gotten on a previous trip on the table in my room. Unfortunately when I returned the ring was no longer there. I spoke with the front desk and again and did not even get an apology. I took it on myself to call the police and they came to get a report. When the police were there we realized the door did not fully engage in locking when I left the room unless it had help and was either all the way open and slammed closed or was yanked from outside as I was leaving even though it looked secure. I spoke to the hotel manager who was surprised that any of this had taken place as his staff did not share any of it. This is shocking since I would think a theft of a guest would be something to be communicated and also followed up on. Again the manager fell short of an apology or trying to make any of this right just as he staff had done. I was contacted by Jessica Lani Rich of the Visitor Aloha Society of Hawaii and found them to be very supportive. They too were surprised by the lack of response from the hotel and followed up by calling them directly. I received a gift bag from the Visitor Aloha Society of Hawaii with a card which apologized for my experience and wanted to make sure I should return to the island. I was very touched that a group not connected with the hotel in any way took action to help me and try to make things right when the hotel could not even apologize for the events they were directly responsible for or the fact I was robbed in their hotel from my room when I was not there. I would definitely suggest avoiding this hotel.

So many good points and so very few bad points. My room was a good size with two queen beds, a small desk, a comfy chair, a large flat screen, and a medium size balcony with a table and two chairs that could easily fit two more chairs. There was the standard iron, ironing board and functioning room safe. The room had its own wifi router. The micro kitchenette was the most well appointed one I have ever had in a hotel room. It had the standard small fridge, and coffee maker but it also had a two burner electric stove top, toaster and full dish set for four people. The bathroom had been recently renovated and had new fixtures including a rainfall shower head, The staff was super friendly and helpful at all times. I forgot my watch and I arranged a fedex pickup to ship it to friends at another resort to bring it back for me. There is full laundry facilities on the 6th floor, as well as the tuck shop, pool and hot tub and I think sauna which I never used. If I have to list the bad points they seem relatively inconsequential. The hotel is a dual use hotel and condo bldg so occasional there are cooking odours in the hallway. My room happened to be beside the garbage chute so I occasionally heard garbage come down. The tub was a small four foot one so essentially this is really just a shower stall unless you have small children. The view from the room is unimpressive. Too far from the beach and mostly looking at other buildings but I was on a lower floor. The air conditioner is an old school window unit built into the wall and drains to a bucket on the balcony. The hotel is not on the beach but it is only a 10 minute walk away as is the shopping for those so inclined. Actually unless you like really crowded beaches rent a car and go to the north shore beaches. They are gorgeous and far less busy. All in all I was very impressed. It's not a 5 star resort but it gave me everything I needed including friendly staff for an inexpensive price.

Seaside (City View) rooms - substantial noise; the rooms facing east (Diamond Head) are a lot quieter. Air conditioning is very noisy. We were fortunate that the following day, that we could change rooms.Rooms with king beds have a tiny bar fridge, while a room with two queen beds has a large fridge with a real freezer.The term kitchenettes should be used loosely at this accommodation. As for dining in-room, not going to happen, you have to eat on the balcony, that is quite large, with only two chairs and decently sized table.Note: this is a mixed use building that is also owner occupied, therefore people are permitted to smoke in their own units.And if you are unfortunate as we were, the neighbor next door was a heavy smoker, so if you left your balcony door open, then you got a good whiff of the smoke. And not the ordinary tobacco either. Should mention that we are all non-smokers, and some have allergies to tobacco and the funny tobacco as well .The difference between owner occupied units and that of those that are being rented out as a resort hotel, is that the owner occupied units have standard residential key lock on the doors, and the rental units have the electronic pass key locks.Internet, shuttle service, newspaper, etc., are not really complimentary, nor are the other services that they offer as complimentary. Those so called complimentary services are all covered by the additional $15+/night U.S. resort fee that they charge, that is payable on arrival.Another issue is that the front desk is manned by only one individual per shift, so it appears. Therefore when registering in the evenings, there can be a rather long wait time.As for the staff from the front desk, house keeping, maintenance, and shuttle drivers, they are very nice and friendly, and will do the best to assist even when short staffed.In other words, give these people a break, especially when there are numerous guests waiting for assistance.As for the management of this hotel, well, they will not even reply to e-mails directly addressed to them, nor will a representative from the Aqua chain respond to e-mails.High-speed internet is available as part of the mandatory resort fee, though unpredictable, from fast to snail pace.Bed linen changed every 3 days, and towels may be changed on a daily basis. Housekeeping will come around daily and freshen up the room. Housekeeping will not do the dishes, and the only dishwasher is your hands.There is a gym available onsite on the 6th floor, only for guests and residents, that will incur an additional one time fee of $5 U.S. in order to use the facility. The hotel is located on the canal, and is approximately a 10min walk to the beach. BBQ's and utensils are available for use on the terrace (6th floor), one large outdoor swimming pool and outdoor hot tub. Also on the 6th floor there is a small convenience store that is reasonably priced, when compared to those at street level in Waikiki.Local phone calls are complimentary.Limited choice of DVD rentals are available free of charge.Additional charge for parking and laundry facilities.Included is a shuttle service (capacity 13 guests) from the Aqua Hotel chain to Ala Moana Mall and return, whose schedule can be anywhere from every 30 minutes to over 2 hours or more for pickup. Officially the schedule is that when only one shuttle is in service - expect a wait time of 1 hour, if two shuttles are in service, the the wait time can be 30-45 minutes. From personal experience we have experienced a rather unreliable service, with unacceptable wait times regardless of the number of shuttles in service. The shuttle service can be overwhelmed on a daily basis as there are only two vehicles in service. And don't get upset with the drivers, if they are late, or indicate that the shuttle is full, that results in many a guest to be passed up on. It is beyond the control of the drivers, it is up to VIP Trans and Aqua Hotel chain management to increase shuttle capacity. VIP Trans is operating this shuttle service, and based on the reviews on tripadvisor to date regarding VIP Trans, the quality of the shuttle service is self-explanatory.There is a Weekly Manager's party (17:00 - 18:00) - no managers here (?), if so they did not identify themselves.Nachos, with cheese and crackers, spiked punch, rooftop view is quite impressive. Unfortunately they do not keep the roof top open so that you can view the sunsets. This weekly Managers Party is open to all guests and residents of this establishment.By the way if you have a late flight and require the use of a complimentary suite/room to change and freshen up - not here.Would we recommend this establishment: NoWould we return to this establishment: No, there are many hotels in the area within the same price range (including resort fee) that do not charge a resort fee, with the same or better services.

Nothing special but very convenient with walking distance to Waikiki and downtown Honolulu, and quite easy to get to the highway as well. But totally overpriced, and in need of a refurbish. It's hard to call it clean. However our room was spacious, and with a fantastic view - we were in the penthouse!

Got this hotel on Hotwire, but then it appeared they had similar price on their website. The quality and size of the room was very good, you would think you are in 4 star hotel. Big TV on the wall (40 inch or more) with extensive programming, big size balcony, kitchenette with some dishes and glasses. Very fast internet, was able to load 5 GB movie easily (in about one hour), which is rare for hotels. Negatives: loud window style AC, small restroom, a little long walk to the beach (still under 10 min.). Very good experience overall.

The hotel has been fully updated and renovated. You will not find a nicer hotel in Waikiki....seriously, if you want the bells and whistles and tinsel..well go and pay another $100.00 per night, but if you and quiet, security and excellent accommodation than the Skyline is your best option. Here are some highlights:- 24 hour self serve laundry- 24 hour patrol security- Excellent Staff......... Steve at the front desk has over 30 years of dedicated service, he is a huge asset to the hotel! - Wonderful large hot tub that is actually "hot".-Great pool- Secluded and spacious deck area with lots of lounge chairs- Several gas bar b ques- Top notch fitness room- store on sight that has everything you need- great coffee shop and light lunch shop in lobby......... person who runs it is a gem- complimentary newspapers daily-on site tour provider-shuttle service available free of charge to Ala Moana shopping centre and return-free beach towel usage-free beach chair-the lanias are the largest of any hotel in Waikiki -Every Tuesday evening the hotel hosts a social with free drinks, food and entertainment and this is on the rooftop of the hotel.........what a treat and what a breath-taking view!on and on and on.......We loved our stay, Moana, you are a terrific manager and we WILL BE BACK!

On a business trip but nearby everything in DT Honolulu for work or play. Good but expensive parking on site this hotel is well staffed with friendly helpful Hawaiians! Mahalo!! Very very helpful and knowledgeable staff I was fortunate enough to be upgraded to a suite with unbelievable views and amenities! Highly recommend this hotel if you like urban setting with your paradise vacation or business trip! Aloha!!

This is the second time i have stayed here in the last three months. The Aqua Skyline is a really good buy. Nothing fancy but Clean - Quiet - and a very friendly front desk. Rooms were clean and the staff truly know the Spirit of Aloha (i maintain a residence on the North Shore of Oahu and have lived in Hawaii since 1982). Though there is nothing fancy about the property it is worth the price. i will admit that the one bedroom suites are far superior to the studios but both serve the purpose. A brand new amentity is the DVD rental kiosk at the front desk where you can "rent" DVD's, including New Releases for free. Kinda cool. Location is good with easy walking to most everything in Waikiki. Really good base of operations....

I should first warn you that I love Waikiki. Mountains, beach, city and world class shopping all in one spot! Our room was on the 36th floor, with a view toward the mountains. The hotel is 2 blocks off the main drag and is quiet. The room was spacious and clean with a well appointed kitchenette. There is a small grocery store on the 6th floor, but if you really want a variety, hit any of the nearby ABC stores or Food Pantry. There is a coffee shop (Jagger's) in the open air lobby but it was closed the entire weekend. When we left Tuesday, it was the first time I'd seen it open. We called the hotel directly and got a much lower rate that posted on any travel site. Many of the rooms are actually condos , so the feel is more community, less transient. The concierge service was great- new beach towel and chairs for ocean visits and great suggestions for restaurants off the beaten path. I had points to stay free at another hotel, but this was worth it. They have a shuttle to take you to nearby attractions as well.

The staff at the hotel was very accommodating, friendly and professional. I would recommend this hotel to all my family and friends. The hotel was clean and modern. The parking was a bit complicated. Great hotel to stay at

I loved the room, so clean and everyone at the front desk was very helpful. My room was remodeled with a kitchenette which saved lots of money and the hotel is in a perfect location! They also offer beach towels! Great hotel and staff!! I would stay again!

Stayed here for 4 nights in Feb 2015. We booked a deluxe ocean view studio and when we checked in, we were "upgraded" for free to a 1 bedroom. Our room was on the 28th floor and the living room faced the ocean, but with so many other buildings in the way that you could only see little peeks between buildings. The bedroom with lanai faced diamond head (but again, only peeks of it between buildings) and we could see the canal well from the lanai. Wifi only worked in living room, not bedroom or lanai, which was a bummer. The room was clean and relatively newly updated but somehow felt dirty, which I suspect was due to the mediocre workmanship of the remodel (ripples in the carpet from it not being stretched correctly, floor tile unevenly laid and grout not sealed so it was brown in higher used paths instead of the original cream color found in outlying areas, dings in wall that were not patched before paint, etc). It felt a lot like my first apartment in college. Front desk was great and very helpful and responsive with issues, maid service was very thorough each day and security at elevators was helpful in locating the closest grocery store (Food Pantry on Kuhio, 2-3 blocks away). The building is mostly condos, many of which seem to be rented out as well, and there are a diversity of languages being spoken on the elevators. The parking garage is tight and the garage attendants were rather confusing about how the in/out privileges worked (it seemed to change with each shift). Parking is $25/day.We slept with windows open and it was very noisy, but I suspect that would be the case pretty much anywhere in Waikiki - buses, trash trucks, drunk people hollering on the streets, etc. It definitely sounded like we were in a large city. Waikiki wouldn't be my first choice of places to stay in Hawaii if we weren't here for business - all the locals kept telling us to stay on the island of Kauai or the north shore of Oahu, both of which are much lusher. Waikiki is mostly concrete and buildings and throngs of people on a small beach and lots of stores.

If you don't want noise, you like being just enough of the beaten track to relax but not be too far away from the action, this is the hotel for you. Good air con, very comfortable beds. We love the staff and if you are lucky you get an amazing view. We also used the desk in the lobby to hire a car. Better price than on line! The staff are very very helpful , particularly the Genetal Manager (though I can't remember his name)My second stay in 4 months. Good value!

PJ at the front desk was extremely helpful both in suggestions to eat, drink and party! They fixed our Air conditioning immediately after we told them it wasnt working, decent facilities, including a nice pool, although walking distance from the beach the hot tub was useful.

I am a Oahu resident that needed to spend the night in Waikiki for a work function but decided to enjoy a stay for the entire weekend at Aqua Skyline at Island Colony. Everyone from the front desk staff, housekeeping and maintenance were very friendly, helpful and embody the spirit of ALOHA. The hotel is centrally located in Waikiki, a short walk to the beach, shopping and great restaurants. The accommodations were safe, very clean, modern and stylish. I highly recommend this hotel to family's visiting or even other kamaina's looking for quick getaway here on Oahu.

We have now stayed here twice, both over Christmas and New Year's, and I always recommend this hotel when friends come to town. I'll start off by noting that if you are wanting a vacation resort right on the beach, this is not that place. However, if you want a comfortable place to sleep, with great views and a nice pool area, along with good service, then this is a very good option. When our friends come to Honolulu, they are usually not looking to stay inside a resort their entire time---they will often go to other islands for that. In Honolulu, they want to take advantage of the beaches, the restaurants, the museums, the historical sites, and the shopping...while having a nice hotel to return to for a good night's sleep. If that's on your agenda, too, then you'll like this hotel. First, both times we've stayed here, the rooms were very convenient, with a small kitchenette, coffeemaker, and coffee that was replenished daily. The kitchenette had a fridge, electric burners, and a microwave, so if you feel like cooking, you can do so. Secondly, the lanai (balcony) was spacious, allowing five adults to comfortably sit outside and watch the New Year's fireworks. Thirdly, the location really can't be beat. A higher floor room will have views of both the ocean and the Ala Wai canal, along with the Honolulu skyline and beautiful mountains. In this hotel, you are right along the Ala Wai, which is a lovely place to go for a morning or evening jog. You are three short blocks from Waikiki beach. You are a five minute walk (or less) to downtown Waikiki's wonderful restaurants. You are only two miles from Ala Moana shopping center. And finally, the hotel itself is nice. The room was comfortable and quite spacious for Waikiki. (The bathrooms are very small, but they are serviceable, and the showers have good water pressure.) The convenience store on the sixth floor has a wide assortment of things you might need for your stay. The pool area has been renovated, and it is really a nice pool, with a large hot tub and lots of lounge chairs in which you can relax. Even over Christmas, there were enough lounge chairs for everyone. The sauna is small, but it is clean and works very well. The gym is also small, but again, very serviceable, with enough cardio and weight machines to allow you to get a complete workout. If you need laundry services, there is a laundry area on the sixth floor, and the machines there take credit cards, so you don't even need to find quarters to do laundry. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I've now stayed here twice, and I would gladly do so again.

I only stayed for a short while, due to a 24 hour layover, however the guys at the front desk were really helpful and welcoming. I had trouble learning how to use the keys so they kindly, and patiently, had to show me several times. I was not familiar with the area so they gave me directions to nearby restaurants.  I enjoyed my room; the view to the sixth floor was amazing! I took my children swimming and was able to enjoy breakfast with them on the patio. On the day of checkout I was supposed to vacate the room at 11 AM but they kindly gave me an extension because of last minute flight changes. They also assisted me in bringing my bags down to the front desk and held them till the car service arrived. They were a great help! I wished we were able to stay longer but at least I know where to go when in Hawaii :)

My buddy and I stayed here over new years and this is a nice property for families, friends and couples. It's only 3 blocks to the beach and very convenient to most everything that Waikiki has to offer. This is an older, but updated and well-maintained property. Most properties we saw in Waikiki have some age so this is to be expected.NOTE: If you want an even better family with smaller kiddies experience then stay as close to the Hilton Lagoon area as possible. The lagoon is a good, safe area for younger kiddies. Pros:Convenient LocationWell-managed and maintained for older propertyGreat Pool and Hot TubLARGE pool deck with 4 barbecue grills NICE Lanai outdoor sitting area/deck Small store on 6th floor for snacks, water and liquorProperty is part-condo and part-hotel which makes for a less touristy mix of peopleParking garage is convenient with elevators in the hotel for the garageFree beach/pool towels (as long as you return them)Upper floors have a pretty nice viewFREE Wi-Fi with really good connectivityCons:Bathroom was really small (your unit might be different)Shower head was literally 5 ft feet high (your unit might be different, but ASK)Waikiki is generally a bit noisy in some areasParking garage is costly but it's rare to find a property that doesn't charge for this

review_body: We were on the 34th floor and had a great view of the ocean, the park and Honolulu. Lots of interesting places and restaurants within walking distance. We almost rented a car but wouldn't need one. The price was very reasonable. The people were friendly and helpful. The room was neat and clean. We learned that about 75% to 80% of the "hotel" is rented out as condominiums. That's not a bad thing. It was a little hard to find as we were looking for "Aqua Skyline" and the name on the side of the building was "Island Colony". Who knew? On the last day there was a problem with the drain in the bathroom but they sent up a plumber immediately and transferred us to another room.

THANK YOU to AMOSA AND PJ at the front desk.They were FRIENDLY AND SUPER HELPFUL.We had a last minute stay, too many of us at the house, so we had to find a hotel and quick.Majority of the hotels were all booked up and over priced(Due to the holiday season).SKYLINE AQUA pulled through,SERVICE WAS GREAT and MUCH APPRECIATED. We will return.This AQUA is better than THE WAVE and ALOHA.IT MIGHT BE TRICKY TO FIND BUT ITS WORTH IT.THANK U AGAIN,OHANA NUÑEZ

We returned to Hawaii after far too many years away, for our second honeymoon. This hotel is a mix of rooms, condos, and live in apartments. There are some permanent residents. It is a very tall building and we had a room up high on the 37th floor with an astounding view of Diamond Head, the canal, and the ocean. We loved waking up to the sun beaming in through the sliding doors in the early morning, however they do have black out curtains if you want to sleep in. The room had a small kitchen area with small fridge, 2 burner glass top stove, and microwave with some attractive cabinets and granite counters, which is well equipped with dishes, pans cutlery etc. The sink was located inside the washroom though, so you were brushing your teeth in the same sink you did your dishes. It was awesome though to have a place to cook an occasional light meal to save money from going out every night. And to be able to have our fruit and toast and kona coffee on our lanai gazing at Diamond Head in the glorious sun was a dream come true. We could even watch the surfers and whales! The hotel is located about 3 blocks from Kalakaua ave. and all the fancy stores for shopping, delicious restaurants like Dukes and of course iconic Waikiki Beach. The hotel also has a very nice swimming pool on the 6th floor with washrooms and change rooms and showers. There are screened areas also to lay or sit in if the sun is too hot. There are lots of loungers for sunbathing. There is also a very well stocked store on this level with all sorts of items, both food and pharmacy and souveniers and their prices are very reasonable. The beds are very very comfortable, the room is very modern in design with some nice decorating touches. The trouble we had with our wifi at first was taken care of immediately. The area seems to be undergoing a refurbishment, and while there is still the occasional sketchy shop on the way to Kalakaua, we always felt very safe walking whether day or night. There is a little bar The Seaside Grill, one block down that does not look great from the outside, but the drinks are very good, the staff was awesome, and the garlic shrimp lunch plates we had were amazing!! we got the to go a couple of times to have back at the pool. The cleaning staff was really good, did a great job. We hope to be able to go back again in the near future and will stay here when we do.

From all the hotels ive been at on this island? I got to say, Aqua Skyline is the best! Room was nice, beds comfortable, Pool was great! Service was awesome! If someone was to ask me about going to a hotel? I would right away say AQUA SKYLINE AT ISLAND COLONY!

I recently stayed in the Island Colony hotel, and had a very great experience! Very clean and newly renovated rooms. Well kept and up to date. Friendly workers and a really good rate! My girlfriend and I had a really wonderful time and would definitely want to come back and stay there again!

review_body: We stayed in a mountain view room. The view was looking out at the ala wai canal. I think any area of the hotel had something nice to look at. Front desk staff was very efficient and accommodating . The room was perfect for our needs. We would definatly stay again.

I recently just stayed at the aqua skyline at island colony and the service was very great every one was very friendly and helpful. All though it was for a weekend the view that we had at the panoramic view of the mountains and it was just speechless me and my significant other never had a relaxing staycation in a long time I would recommend this hotel to others and give them a 5 star not just for the view but the workers there were very excellent in what they do and they always had a smile on there faces.

review_body: My wife and I chose this hotel because we were able to save money and still have a nice place to stay that is right in Waikiki. We were here in November and were completely happy with our stay. There are no restaurants in the hotel and I think there are a lot of privately owned condos in the building so it's more like a nice condo with maid service! We had a suite with a full kitchen so we stocked the fridge. There is a store in the building that has a little of everything. There is a Starbucks right at the end of the block. The pool was nice with plenty of seating area. Overall we were very satisfied with this hotel and will book here the next time we come!

review_body: Clean and convenient location.Room and service was excellent, entire staff was very friendly and helpful. Easily the best view in waikiki.The price was good especially since it's near Waikiki beach. I enjoyed ny stay here.Definitely recommend it to anyone.

We really enjoyed our stay here at Skyline in Honolulu. It was the perfect distance from the beach, restaurants, and shops. It was also close enough to Diamond head that we were able to walk. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room looked exactly as pictured on the website when we booked and it was very clean upon arrival. The view was amazing. Could see a bit of the ocean, but the mountain looked so beautiful. You could also see the river from our balcony. We came for our Honeymoon and when we checked in there was a bottle of wine and a box of chocolate covered macadamia nuts waiting for us. It was a nice little surprise. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay here if we came back to Honolulu.

This was not my first visit to the Aqua Skyline, and it certainly won't be the last! I enjoy the simple sophistication the hotel offers, along with the strong sense of the "Aloha Spirit" from the staff!

We booked the Panoramic City View w/ a king bedReasons why we booked this hotel:- it has a quiet location, not on the main strip of hotels/shops- still walking distance from the beach, >10minThings to keep in mind:- $5 to use the exercise room- the shower head was good for our height (5'3 and 5'7) but would be too low for taller peopleDisliked:- weird smell on our floor (26) but not sure if it's present on the other floors- we weren't informed about the trolley that the Aqua resorts provided until we were reminded by another hotel guest. We had to wait 30+ for the trolley to Ala Moana Centre. We didn't mind but if you are in a rush, it would be better to take "theBus" instead (the city's bus line.) The trolley was a Mercedes bus with A/C and TVs. Very friendly driver.Things we liked:- very friendly front desk and room service staff- beach towels available to use- very modern room with a kitchenette. Perfect for making quick breakfasts, storing beer etc.I am very pleased with this hotel!

We really enjoyed the 2 nights we stayed at Aqua Skyline! We got a great deal and were shocked when we walked into our room and saw the amazing view we had of the Waikiki skyline. The balcony was huge and the room was very modern, which was perfect! The check-in process was fairly easy, but was a bit confusing as the main entrance to the hotel was inside, but the check-in area was outside. We weren't sure if this was the normal setup or if it was because we arrived late at night. However, this was just a small thing that did not have an impact on our stay and overall experience. We were within walking distance to the main shopping areas and restaurants so it was convenient. The staff were also very friendly and helpful. It was a great beginning point for our week long vacation in Hawaii!

review_body: The rooms are just as pictured on the web site. The newish furnishings are modern and tasteful. The kitchenette was more than I expected. It's a perfect offering for a vacation stay. The mini fridge, microwave, cooktop and cooking accessories are a money-saver: being able to make breakfast in the room as well as take-away picnic lunches is a bonus while in Hawaii. I didn't realize there was a mini-mart on the 6th floor until I arrived, which was also a big help. There are also PLENTY of restaurants within 2 blocks and of course the incredible shopping scene on Kalakaua Avene. We walked to dinner every night and the walk to the beach was easy. The hotel even offers beach chairs and towels for free daily use. Starbucks within 2 blocks. The garage parking is tight - a smaller car is better, but never a problem parking and the daily fee was within standard for Waikiki hotels.

I have stayed in a lot of Hotels and am very picking about cleanliness. This was very good for such a large hotel!. It is also an apt. complex for non-hotel guests. but the security was very good. the hallway and lobby area are very bland. but inside the rooms, the décor and views are great. It is just a 3 block walk to Waikiki beach. and the price is amazing for what you get!! Pool, kitchen, friendly service and close to all the shopping and beaches in Waikiki. The king size beds are very comfortable and so are the pillows.

We stayed 3 days. The room was lovely and the views to Diamond Head and over the canal were great. The rooms have been updated and are great the rest of the hotel is a little tired looking. We had everything we needed and the pool was lovely. It was an easy walk to shops, restaurants and the beach. The shuttle provided to the Ala Moana Shopping Center was a great help, as we didn't have a car. We were able to use it to get around by getting on and off at other Aqua hotels. The drivers are friendly and helpful. We had booked a king bed but were told when we arrived none were available. Not sure why they would take a booking for it and then not honor that.

arrived at Waikiki for our first point of stay in Hawaii. Was told we'd just be charged 50 for bond payment as we had paid for all 5 nights in advance. The next day checked my bank and I had 600USD charged to my account. Went down to talk to them and apparently they didn't receive payment from Orbit the site we booked thru so instead of calling them first, charged my card for the totAL amount. They called and sorted it out and said they took the hold of my money. It is now day 9 and still haven't gotten my money back, extremely annoying! The rooms are a lot worse than they look in the photos and you have to pay $5 to use the gym. Would Def not recommend this hotel, any other hotel would be better than this one!

I enjoyed staying at relaxing at the Aqua Skyline. Service is on point and the staff is super friendly. Especially the manager on duty while we stayed there. His name is Brian Kovaloff, he made sure our stay was stress free and if we needed anything for the rooms his staff was more than helpful to get it. I highly recommended staying at the Aqua Skyline. Our next staycation will be there for sure!!

although we planned on staying only one night, we wished we could have stayed longer... we were in the best location possible to catch the Halloween madness, just a short walk to Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center...our view from 42 floors up was AMAZING!!!! The customer service was unbeatable...I will definitely stay there again !!!

review_body: We stayed at the Aqua Skyline at Island Colony in Honolulu for a week, and had a great stay. The rooms were updated and made for a comfortable stay, and not to mention, the price for the room was very reasonable for how nice they were. The hotel is located just a few blocks from downtown Honolulu, which made it very convenient to walk to shopping, dinner and Waikiki Beach. The staff was friendly, and really topped off a great trip! I would definitely stay here again.

Travelled there on September 8th-17th from NZ with my family. 28th floor, Awesome. The rooms are spacious and very clean & the wifi in every room is awesome.. it's a nice quiet hotel as well. They have air-con in there.. trust me, you'll have it on all the time!! You get more than you bargain for when you stay at Island Colony. They have a "Mix N Mingle" every Tuesday afternoon on the top of the building (Alcoholic beverages), And the views are beautiful!!. I definitely suggest that you stay in this hotel if you're ever in Waikiki.it's also 2 blocks away from all the shopping outlets. and a hop skip and a jump too the beach!!But if you don't want to go too the beach, the pool there is just as good!!

Lovely accommodations in the heart of Waikiki. Rooms are newly renovated and includes a kitchenette. Large lanai with exceptional views. Staff was very friendly. I will definitely be staying here again.

Great room beautiful view friendly staff and no place id rather stay then here with it being minutes of a walk to the main strip very easy to sccess and great parking close to clubs and shopping cntrs

review_body: Beautiful surprise when we arrived at the hotel, it was situated nicely in the stunning city of Waikiki, walking distance to most of the town's attractions. My family and I booked a room for 2 nights. We arrived very early, about 3 a.m. and requested for an early check-in, it was approved, and we also requested for a late check-out, it was also approved. The reception personnel were very helpful and accommodating. They were also very helpful in giving advice on what to do in the city. We enjoyed the little details of the design of the rooms, the cleanness and the friendly staff. The hotels pool was a stunning surprise because we spent a great amount of time enjoying the amenities. The room was truly a calm beautiful warm setting giving us the sense of being at home. Beautiful view of the city’s skyline from a large roomy balcony allowing my family of four to all enjoy the scenery together. The beds were very comfortable especially after a day of walking, we slept like babies. My overall thought is the hotel creates and Intimate welcoming, comforting mood that one should receive on a vacation.We are looking forward to future vacations with the Aqua Skyline Hotel. I highly recommend this hotel to anybody who's planning a trip to Waikiki - Hawaii for its excellent location, service, and friendly staff!

Independence, Missouri, United States

review_body: First I should say we were upgraded to a one bed suite, so this improved our rating in some respects. The accomodation was spacious with a kitchen dining area, plenty of closet space and a good sized bedroom and bathroom. It could easily accomodate 4 people with a sofa bed in the lounge area, even better for one! Plenty of towels in the bathroom and comp toiletries. The view from the bedroom was of the canal and there was a nice blacony with seats and table. Air conditioning was good, though in one of the apartments only the bedroom had an air conditioning unit. No blackout curtains, which might have been a problem if you wanted to sleep in the day. The kitchen area was well equipped with a large fridge. We didn't cook anything I loved the location. Slightly off the beaten track, but close enough to walk to the beach, shops, bars etc. parking here is a bargain for Hawaii at $25 a night. We always found a great space and the garage had very easy access. The building had good security and was very quiet. I liked this place so much I am booking for January. It is not 5 star, but it is clean, quiet, very comfortable and well equipped. I would be happy to recomend this place highly. We paid around $140 a night. That is really very inexpensive for this standard of accomodation in Hawaii. Nb, the entrance is not well sign posted. Also if you don't want to rent a car, I believe there is a hotel shuttle to and from the airport.

This is a great spot for those wanting comfort without the high cost. The hotel has been renovated. The rooms are a bit small but do have a kitchenette. The staff are amazing and very friendly. Although older this would be my pick of places to stay for those on an average budget. Don't bring a car though as parking is $30 a day .Its an easy walk to everything and buses are only 2minutes from the door.

I spent 3 nights at this well located, reasonably priced apartment hotel from 15 to 18 October 2014.I arrived late and was upgraded a room with a 360 degree view of Diamond Head, the canal and beach. The room was spacious, well maintained had a kitchenette including a stove and a compact bathroom with a bath. Staff were friendly and helpful. There are many restaurants close by. This hotel is not luxury but it will be my first choice for accommodation in Waikiki in the future.

Stayed for six nights and impressed by the room as it had everything that is needed for a short stay. Full kitchen with micro wave and fridge. Coffee maker was restocked every day and towels changed. Nice balcony overlooking the canal and mountains with chairs and table. Four lifts up to the floors and a small shop. Nice swim pool area with sun beds and private bed areas not overlooked to much, You need your door key to get into the pool area. Staff were helpful and there was a security man at the front desk. A few minutes walk from the bustle of the main streets and Waikiki beach. Great location as it is off the main strip.

After a lot of stress, flying halfway around the world, caring for a loved one, I was due a much needed escape.  I stayed in a one bedroom suite with a balcony overlooking the mountains and the Ala Wai canal and golf course. Watching the sunlight as it crawled across those majestic beauties I felt a sense if relaxation and magic. The view of Diamond Head reminded me how fortunate I was to be in Hawaii.  From the living room I could see the hustle and bustle of Waikiki as well as the shining blue waters of the Pacific.  There are a number of restaurants that will deliver to your room. I had a fully stocked kitchen - including dish soap and towels. I love to cook, so this was perfect for me.  The people that helped me at the hotel had some of the best customer service skills I've ever encountered, made even better by their sense of aloha - that is something that cannot be taught. From the front desk to the security guard, Brian Miller, they were helpful and informative and had a true sense of caring aloha.  I look forward to my next visit here. It will be my haven from the world!

Hi! We stayed here for 5 nights and njoyed the stay... Quite impressed by the amenities and total ambience... The staff is very courteous. The housekeeping is also very good Kept the room and bathroom very clean and tidy. Loved the location as it's very near to the beach and since we had a good oceanic view so it was lovely... Pretty good accommodation.

We had to find a hotel for one night because the day after we were leaving. Unfortunately there was a convention nearby and almost every hotel was sold out or too expensive. We chose this one because it was the least expensive. Our room was at the 41th floor and we had great views over Honolulu. Our room had a kingsize bed and was normally equipped, I guess almost every room has another interior (lots of people live in the building). The location was great, nearby the most important places. Wifi was complimentary but parking was $25 a day.Pool was warm and ok to refresh, but don't expect much more. The A/C makes a lot of noise, so take those ear plugs with you or you won't have a good night of sleep.There are a lot of elevators but they won't be there in a minute. Prepare to wait around 5 minutes or longer.Good for a short stay, but the price we paid wasn't worth the quality.

I enjoyed my stay here but I have to say that it is not my favorite Aqua property.I typically stay at the Aqua Pearl but with room rates sky high for this trip for some reason ($192 for a super basic room? Really? I've stayed there for as low as $110/night!), I decided to try something different. I took the chance to splurge a little for the supposed added value of Aqua Skyline's big rooms and kitchenettes.The hotel is not that close to the beach. I am a pretty fast walker and it took me 10 minutes to get to the beach. Not a problem for me as I'd rather stay near the canal and away from the craziness of the beach, but others expecting to be super close to the beach may want to look elsewhere.The room itself was beautiful, very modern with a perfect size shower/bath combo (I think designed for the Japanese tourist in mind, which was great because I am only 5'6"). The kitchenette was great with an induction cooktop, sink, fridge and microwave. Having the kitchen handy was helpful as I was able to cook breakfast and dinner some nights, saving $$$. A/C worked well. Perhaps my favorite feature of the room was the balcony facing Ala Wai canal and the mountains. It was great for watching sunsets!Negatives:- I'm not convinced the $15/day "resort fee" is worth it. I realize the property is bigger, with quite a few amenities, but I've seen several of these amenities offered at hotels without a resort fee.- Bed was just slightly uncomfortable.- The TV with digital cable had about one gazillion channels but the room did not have a channel guide. - I was traveling alone, so this didn't impact me per se... But as I live with someone who has a physical disability back at home, I couldn't help but notice that the bathroom did not have any accessibility features like an anti-slip mat or surface in the tub, grab bars on the shower walls etc. I've noticed this at other Aqua properties and will continue to point it out until it is fixed. Suggestion:-Aqua should establish a frequent stay program! I stay at Aqua hotels 7-14 nights a year. Obviously I love the chain but would love it more if there was some sort of frequent stay/incentive program.All in all I really like Aqua Skyline but probably won't stay there again due to the overall higher room cost and hospitality fee compared to Aqua Pearl or Aqua Aloha Surf (at normal room rates). For my needs, it's not quite worth it.

Stayed here for the weekend. We were really impressed by this hotel. Great staff, rooms, and location! Had a city view, but could also see the ocean. Friday night fireworks were amazing! This place definitely gets two thumbs up!!! :)

We booked a couple nights here at the last minute last week of August but manage to get a great deal. Hotel location is great; only 5 min walk to center of Waikiki and beach. We had a studio with two queen beds and a very well equipped kitchenette on the 19th floor. Room is on a smaller size but very nice and clean. Free and fast wifi. The staff was very friendly and helpful.The 6th floor is where the pool and jacuzzi are and it has half a dozen BBQ gas grilled and a large eating area with picnic tables. Very nice if you want to eat in some nights. There is also a laundry mat, a gym ($5 per stay for use of gym) and a little convenience store on the 6th floor, if you want to pick up some snacks and and last min things. We enjoyed the pool, jacuzzi and the gym a lot. There is an Xbox in the room but you need to pay like $5 a day for unlimited games and DVD movies. Overall it was a great stay. We would definitely stay here again if we come to Oahu, and we will recommend this hotel to family and friends. The only thing we were not too crazy about was to pay $25/day for parking and the parking spaces are narrow. They do add up if you stay longer.

Staff were very good, room was clean, well fitted out and everything worked. Air con was a bit noisy but not too bad. The gym was basic but sufficient, as was the pool area. Good price for the product and location

When we arrived in the room we were a bit disappointed at first as the pictures are way nicer than the actual room. We had a 1 bdrm suite on a very high floor. The room/hotel was very clean and spacious. The views are awesome from the room and you cannot find that at any other Waikkiki hotel without spending an arm and a leg per night. It was about a 5-7 minute walk to the main beach hotel drag. Overall, we loved our stay here, the kitchen came in handy and the maid service was great. Would stay again!

Facility was clean, beds were comfortable, friendly staff. In walking distance to everything. We had a microwave, coffee pot, mini fridge, stove top & toaster in the room, enough dishes and utensils for 4 people. There was even dish soap and towels which was nice.

My husband and I stayed here during the latter part of our honeymoon. This hotel is situated on seaside avenue which is really convenient to Waikiki and down town Honolulu. If you keep walking south (towards Waikiki), it's where all the action is. The beach was a nice 10 minute walk. It's also located near many other busy avenues with tonnes of shops and cute little restaurants. The staff were friendly; the hotel room itself was very clean and nicely renovated and new. I believe they are all equipped with a kitchenette so that helped us out a lot. We were able to cook breakfast all week instead of going out to eat. Our only downside was that we were located right beside the trash chute (we could have request to move but didn't want to go through the hassel and the rooms were all fully booked) and the smell of rubbish would occasionally be known. Other than that, the room was fantastic. We were facing the east side, so we could see the mountains and the Ala Wai canal and part of the Diamond Head Crater. The hotel hallways are in need of a face lift; parts of the hotel are pretty dated. Great that the rooms were renovated first. As a heads up for those of you who will be renting cars while in O'ahu - parking is NOT free. They charged us $25 a day for the first five days until the last two days, they upped the price to $30 a day for hotel guests. They had a coupon for hotel guests for the full 7 days for a reduced rate of $25 a day. So beware - parking is not cheap!On the 6th floor, the pool is located there,along with a convenience store if you wish to purchase some quick items. We never went to it as there were so many ABC stores along Seaside! There's also a place for you to do laundry - you can also purchase small packets of laundry detergent. Very convenient.Other than the parking, I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a relatively decent, convenient and cheap place to stay

Overall, rooms were very nice. Clean and large. No problems. The Hotel eating location was a bit cramped. Could not eat together. Tables too small for the 4 of us. Nicel locations to eat within walking distance. Boys (teenagers) loved the stores nearby. Had fun in the pool and weight room.

Location of hotel was fantastic with just a 5 min walk to the surfer statue on the beach front of Waikiki. Close to a supermarket, so we could easily buy groceries and bring them back to hotel, they also have a mini mart on the pool level. facilities were fantastic with a great pool and BBQ area, gym and many washing and drying machines. everyone was lovely and helpful especially the manager. the rooms were clean and had been newly renovated. although its not a 5 star hotel, I thought It was excellent. the views were fantastic although we were on the 47th floor, I think from memory. Had a gorgeous view of diamond head from our balcony. overall I really enjoyed the stay

I checked in a tad late at 9:45pm Sunday evening, and the Front desk gentleman was very personable. He also was knowledgable with the facilities and amenities this hotel had to offer! The one bedroom suite I stayed in has a modern decor along with a really comfy cozy bed. Perfect firm mattress! I felt refreshed when I woke up Monday morning! The kitchen came in handy when I decided to warm up some food in the microwave. The shower was a good size and the temperature set very quickly to my liking!
