Honolulu, Hawaii, United States

review_body: Arrived late on a Friday night. We were on the 39th floor so had awesome views of the city and ocean. Room was clean and pleasant and recently upgraded. Shower was very good although one morning we couldn't get it very hot - not that that mattered much as it was refreshing to have a tepid shower. Housekeeping generally good. We were here during Tropical Storm Iselle and the hotel was very good at keeping guests informed.The hotel pool was in need of a chemical clean - slightly slimy feel to the tiles and the water was a bit unclear. Consequently we only used it the once.Gym facilities were good with modern equipment and available for a one off $5 fee for the duration of the stay.A/C was extremely noisy to the extent that you needed to turn it off during the night which made for a very hot and humid sleep. We even slept the night of the storm with the doors to the balcony wide open! Was good getting a fresh breeze! They need to upgrade the A/C system.The shop on the 6th floor was good and had all necessities that you may have needed although one employee was more interested in the game on his phone than serving.The parking garage had a charge of $25 if you got a coupon from reception and $30 if you didn't. We weren't informed about the coupon until we had to pay. This is the first time I've had to pay to use a parking garage attached to a hotel. Maybe it's the norm in the USA?I would recommend Aqua Colony for those on a budget.

Wasn’t sure this place would work out for us after reading the reviews, but it ended up being a decent place to stay. Pay to upgrade your room, though. We were with a large group that had a total of four different rooms (different sizes, different views, etc) and we had the nicest room by far. The rooms are small, even the penthouse room (43rd floor) one of my family members had. Our room on the 19th floor was bigger than theirs (but their view was breathtaking). We had a 1-bedroom suite panoramic ocean room. My husband and I had the room with the lanai and our two preteen daughters slept on the hide-a-bed in the living room. Beds were very comfortable!! Even the hide-a-bed. The shower was very nice sized with a “rain shower” shower head that worked pretty good. We had a nice kitchenette with a full sized fridge, oven, microwave and sink (my brother’s room didn’t have a sink with their little kitchenette). It also had a nice granite island. Our room had built in a/c units in both the bedroom and the living room. Apparently most rooms do not come this way, so that was worth the upgrade right there. A majority of the rooms have an a/c unit through the balcony wall and there’s a bucket on the balcony that the water run off goes into. You have to call housekeeping to come and dispose of the water. A bit of a pain. Pool, hot tub and sunning area on the 6th floor were great! Probably the best part of the hotel! Though we spent time at the beach, the kids really enjoyed having the pool to swim in, too. We spent more time there than we thought we would. The laundry room on the 6th floor was convenient (and the washers and dryers actually worked well!). The BBQ area was nice for our large family dinners, but the hours to access it need to be extended (they kicked us out at 9pm). Having the little store on the 6th floor (hrs 7am-midnight) was very nice, as they had most everything you would be looking for, including alcohol, but it’s spendy, as you’d expect. There’s also a little coffee stand on the 1st floor that also serves sandwiches and snacks. Was expensive. The building itself was dated, but our room had clearly been updated in the recent years. It appeared as though they have been working to upgrade the rooms and were still in the midst of it. Hopefully they’ll be investing in updating some of their hallways, too. They were pretty worn down.The hotel has people that actually make it their home, hence the extra amenities like the laundry room and store. Was nice meeting different types of people who could also recommend places in the area.The front desk people were very friendly! So were most of the onsite staff. The security team, however, were extremely unfriendly to the point of rude. Just because you're security doesn't mean you necessarily have to be unpleasant. Unless you're dealing with people who are being unruly.The parking garage for the hotel was $25 a day to park in. Was a bummer, but basically a necessity if you rented a car, because there really wasn’t any free parking that we could find in the area. For people who are NOT staying in the hotel – they have to pay $35 a day to park in the garage! It was a rip off, but with no other options, what are you going to do?The surrounding area was busy, as you’d expect in Waikiki. Was easy to walk where you wanted to go whether it was the beach, one of their many varieties of restaurants or clubs. There were also places to shop, but they were all pretty expensive. I didn’t bother buying the cheap stuff, because we were going to visit Maui prior to going home and didn’t want to travel with all of our gifts until the end.Quick notes on restaurants: Went to Duke’s. WAY overpriced, but a beautiful view in of the ocean in the evening. You’re basically paying for that. If you can afford it, it’s nice. Marukame Udon is awesome food if you’re into Udon noodles! The line is long, but it actually goes faster than you’d think. Waited 25 minutes, but was worth it! Cafeteria style eating. Rainbow Drive-In is good local food, but is outside of Waikiki a little. You can walk there or it’s just a quick drive. Just past Rainbow Drive-In is an old bakery named Leonard’s Bakery. Get a box of Malasadas!! Again – There’s a line you’ll have to stand in, but once you take a bite out of the hot doughnut, you’ll forget about the line!Traffic on Oahu is horrid. If you need to travel anywhere on the highway system, give yourself double the estimated time! It’s a bummer to be stuck in your car creeping along at 25 mph on a highway while on vacation. We’ll probably stick to the other islands next time, but if you’re looking for a busy, crowded and fast past experience in Hawaii, Waikiki is the place for you!

Stayed at Island Colony June 21-26, 2014 and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. Lots of new things since my last visit and all are really great. The agent gave me a room which had a panoramic view of the city and ocean. The front desk was always so helpful at all times and really treated me as i was very special over my entire stay.A special shout-out to Steve.Lelani, and a gentleman whose' name I just cannot remember- much less pronounce:-). He assisted me with a very late checkin as my flight from Dallas was almost 5 hours late. However I was totally thankful for all of the time they spent with me during a somewhat eventful checkin- again, thanks to Lelani and the mystery male agent who worked with her during my checkin- still cna't remember hiss name:-)Rooms were very clean and maids do excellent work! One special suggestion for all who may visit the Island Colony in the future, please checkout Jagger's Cafe which is located next to the front desk and is owned by a gentleman named Jason- No! Not THAT Jason of Friday the 13th fame- this one is the nice Jason:-) The menu is quite appealing and prices are very good. Pay him a visit and you will surely be pleased!Have stayed here many times and as aforementioned, will visit again-it's my favorite place to stay when on Oahu. By the way, their reservation agents are also excellent- the res agent who help me saved me quite a bit of money on the cost of my great room. Ok! Go ahead now and make YOUR reservation:-) Aloha!

Booked this after reading multiple reviews of hotels in HNL. We arrived very late due to flight delays and I strongly suspect we'd been moved slowly down the floors as other people checked in ahead of us, c'est la vie. Our studio room on the 17th floor was clean and comfortable and had everything we needed for a short stay. The kitchenette was pretty tiny but had a microwave and stovetop. My tall boyfriend also complained about the chest height shower head and the water wasn't as warm as I would've expected in a hotel. The wifi got pretty slow in the evenings but early morning was good enough for a Skype call. Overall I think this is a good place to stay. Not beachfront but close enough and good transport links just up the street. I booked directly with the hotel and think I got a reasonable price.

Clean, modern room.Great location, walking distance to all the shopping and 2 blocks from the beach Very helpful and friendly staffWe stayed at a more expensive hotel on the beach for our last night and preferred this one

I had heard of this hotel having recently completed refurbishment late last year in 2013.I have stayed at a few Aqua properties in Waikiki before, and the rooms have always been clean and comfortable, with friendly staff ready to help.I was happy to see that when arriving at the hotel, that this one was just like the others.Sure, the hotel is not a 4 or 5 star luxury hotel, but if you are after clean and comfortable at an affordable price, than it is right up your alley.I booked the Studio Panoramic Ocean View room and it was great.The one thing that i really wanted after investigating the hotel on their website was the glorious view that they promised. They lived up to it. My view was absolutely breathtaking.i have been to Waikiki so many times, and have had the oppurtunity to stay in Ocean views before, but this was the best view i have ever had.The lanai was really big, with several chairs and a really nice big table, which i enjoyed breakfast on every morning and sometimes the occasional late beverage.The king bed was really comfortable with a really big tv. Free wifi with no limit was great, as i was constantly on my ipad in the late evening.The only negative thing i would say is that the bathroom is extremely small for a studio. I would definately stay here again and recommend to friends and family.

This hotel is well placed to accommodate every kind of traveler. Clean, safe, and well located. The beach is just a few short blocks away and the hotel provides free beach chairs and towels. The staff was beyond wonderful. The place has laundry facilities, a nice pool, a convenience store, and lots lots more on the 6th floor. This no smoking palace is quiet and easy to get to from the airport by the #19 city bus. The City zoo, Aquarium, and Diamond Head are all within walking distance. Don't want to walk??? There are lots of hop on hop off bus alternatives. You can cook in your room or stuff your face nearby. I would recommend this hotel to everyone and look forward to my next stay.

This hotel seems to be integrated within a residence building.Pros:- best WiFi signal in the room, as each room has its own private hotspot- you have to pay extra (one time $5 fee per stay) to use the gym- very good location, close to reasonably priced food places and not too far from the beach- nice view from high floor- very comfortable bedCons:- weird setting, with outdoor lobby / reception desk- WiFi did not work in the outdoor lobby- very small bathroom

I am a local traveler and visit Oahu frequently. I stay exclusively at Aqua Resorts because they have the friendliest, most sincere staff and all their properties fill their niche perfectly. I always have a nice, spacious, well-maintained room with excellent value. I will keep coming back to Aqua.

Lovely hotel/apartments. Freshly renovated, in a great, convenient location and good facilities including a pool, gym, laundry room, sauna, free wifi. Had a king bed in a standard room with a kitchenette and it had everything I needed.

Good value accommodation with all the amenities you will need including pool, spa, sauna, laundry, convenience store, 24hr security, car hire, sundries and snacks outlets. Located on the canal within walking distance of beach. Higher floors are the quietest with the best views of either ocean/city, canal and diamond head. Rooms available either through the resort direct or private owners through various booking agents. The privately booked accommodation varies in room fixture quality, the resort controlled rooms are decorated to a pretty pleasant standard. Bathrooms are tiny! but come with a shower/bath combo. Rooms feature a small kitchenette which come in handy, but no ovens just cook top and microwave. Plenty of cheap eats in the immediate area, as well as all Waikiki entertainments.

The best hotel stay I've had in a long time the staff are so friendly they make u feel like family not just another gust also the hotel is near some of the best bars/night clubs an restaurants they are all in walking distance

Overall, a pleasant stay. The room was sufficient for our needs, nothing fancy, but suitable for our purposes, which was to have a home base to operate out of while in Honolulu. My biggest complaint was the shower...at just over 6'3", the shower head was at jaw height!! The other complaint was the trash chute just outside our door on the 8th floor. It reeked in that area, but not noticeable in the room. The maids did a good job of cleaning. The young lady at the front desk, Leilani, was exceptionally friendly and helpful, and made us feel welcome when we arrived. Thanks also to Susan for helping us get to a luau for our 45th wedding anniversary.

The hotel is well located, has everything you need, even a little grocery shop. The walk to the beach takes less than 10 minutes.The room was renovated and really comfortable. The elevator is really fast, we stayed at 24th floor!The Hotel staff is very helpful and friendly!

Stayed for 2 nights. The view in our room was amazing! Newly renovated interior and exterior. This hotel has definitely converted to a MODERN- boutique type of hotel from the last time I stayed!! Thanks Brian and Monalisa for the good hospitality. We'll certainly be back again soon.

I stayed here with my husband to celebrate our 1 year anniversary. We initially stayed at The Marriott and weren't sure whether to follow through with staying here. After much deliberation we decided to stay at the Aqua Skyline and we are so happy we made the decision to.The advantages:- Friendly staff including front desk staff (namely the helpful and very friendly Amosa) as well as security- Security is really good. Only hotel patrons are able access in and out after a certain time with a swipe card- Complimentary wifi is fast and an absolute bonus- Rooms were spacious and very comfortable- Cleaning staff did an excellent job cleaning our room and we always left tips because of how great they were- Convenience of laundry on 6th floor- Location is quite central to Waikiki stripAlthough my stay was great there were some things that i was not quite happy with, but overall would recommend to anyone and when we come back we would return,Things that needed improvement would be:- Payment for parking (we didn't want to pay $25 every night ) for our 10 night stay so we drove around looking for free parking which took ages- Noise surrounding the hotel (ambulances, police and drunk people roaming the street)- The curtains in the room were sheer and so when the sun was up it shone through the room- Noises during the renovations woke us in the day (but we were prewarned about this prior)Other than that so good, would come back because the advantages far outweigh the negatives. Thank you for allowing us a great and wonderful stay and also Amosa should be commended for his outstanding customer service skills, his willingness to go above and beyond for my husband and I and for receiving us initially in such a wonderful way. He is great!!!!

I am not sure where most people come from but I'm from NYC and used to street noises, so the noise, if i had noticed any, wasnt that bad. The room was on the 42th Fl and the view was of Diamond Head and the Beach which was beautiful! The room itself was comfortable not small like most hotel reviews for Honolulu.I didnt use the pool but it was a pretty decent size and there are barbecue pits that people using."The only thing that was wrong was the bathtub which was not clean and the bathroom is small. If I go back I would stay again

We were supposed to stay 5 nights but switched to another hotel at the last minute. We did reserve a room for 1 night since our flight left at midnight and we needed a place to shower. This place is just OK. The hallways stink so badly of cigarette smoke :( The room itself was fine. This place has had a makeover but it is still like putting lipstick on a pig... The shower is TINY. My husband and I are both 5'8/5'9 and the shower head was 1/4 inch away from hitting the back of our head. The bed is on a platform, no box spring FYI. The room really was decent but I'm thankful we did not stay here the full 5 nights. The proximity to the center of Waikiki was also a negative for me (I love being able to walk out and be in the middle of it all). If you are looking for good value and an OK hotel, this is the one for you. I'd rather pay a bit more and stay somewhere a little nicer. I didn't really feel comfortable being here. Maybe it was the fact that part of this place is hotel and the other part are condos/owners/more random people? Just wanted to add that the front desk gal was very friendly and the lanais are a good size. :)

I was told upon arrival that my One Bedroom Suite Panoramic City was no longer available because of a water leak. So they relocated me to a One Bedroom Suite on the lower floors which turned out to be a bit noisy on some mornings from the street noise. The room looked like an old hotel that had upgraded. The hotel’s narrow hallways looked old and over-traffic, with cottage cheese ceilings (lead). The main noise was from the hallways. This hotel is not very soundproof so you will hear other room's doors opening and closing, along with passing conversation that's loud enough to wake you up. On windy days you will also hear the patio door shake. The in room wifi worked well, but was down for 1 day. Frig and microwave worked well. The front desk was very responsive, especially Amosa. The parking garage ($25/day) in the building is dusty, run-down, and lacked some lighting, so it felt a bit unsafe. The ceiling is very low. My minivan got very close to hitting the ceiling pipes.

I stayed here with a friend for a period of 10 days. On arrival it was neat and tidy. It is currently being renovated painted etc. The reception staff were very helpful. Our plan arrived in the early morning. Our room was not yet ready however they kept us informed and sent a request to housekeeping to have the room ready asap. Once allowed into our room we were pleasantly surprised. We had a fantastic view and the room was clean roomy enough for us and all our shopping. The beds were very comfortable, however my bed did not seem to get made properly for our whole ten day stay. They pulled up the linens but did not remake or tidy very well. The pool area was spacious and the spa and sauna were very clean. The apartments are central to everything and only a five minute walk to the beach. The air conditioner was quite noisy and the traffic was surprisingly loud considering we were on the 36th floor. There is a cocktail evening on the roof terrace. It is a must to go to that just to admire the view from all sides of the building. The only major negative I have of our entire stay is the state of the bathroom in the foyer area. It was disgraceful. The whole bathroom was filthy. As this was the first room I encountered on our stay I was very suspicious of what our room would be like. Luckily that was only one area I never went to again. They really need to get some bleach and scrubbing brushes into that room.

This was a last minute booking and i would recommend Island Colony to anyone. Very reasonably priced a short walk to the main strip and best of all fantastic customer service. We stayed 10 days in a kitchenette studio which suited us, two twin double beds clean bathroom and kitchenette cooktop for simple cooking. The kids also loved the pool and other facilities. Well done Island Colony!!

The rooms were clean. It seemed just a little dusty to me. We were pleased with service. We needed a service call for the tub and it was fixed soon. We were very happy with checkin. It was quick and our room was on the 34th floor, so the view was awesome. We could see the ocean and diamond head. Our room looked just like the pictures. We didnt have any problem with elevators. We had complimentary wifi. The bathroom is small but clean. The refrigerator and microwave were good for us, but I would never have tried to cook in there. It was way too small for all that. It was very easy to get to the beach from there. I guess the only thing I did like was the smell from the room next door. There are people that live there, so it smelled like their food all the time,rather than a fresh hotel hall way. However,we did not spend much time in the room. We also had no problem with our key either, as others have complained about.

The positives of this hotel was the service was excellent, friendly, kind and helpful. We booked a staycation at the Aqua Skyline because our friend told us the hotel was nice and newly renovated, which she was right about. We checked in on a Friday night and service was great and prompt. When we got to out room, the room was absolutely wonderful. We had a kitchen, good amount of living room and bathroom space and the bedroom was beautiful with stunning view of the city, along side the firework that was showing at the HIlton Hawaiian Village. Over all I would stay here again and even recommend family and friends to stay here. The service was great along with everything else. We were a very happy campers!!!!! :)

Worst stay I have had in years. Followed the good reviews and booked...boy was I mislead.Driving up it looked impressive. Do not be fooled. This is not a hotel and only books 100 out of the 1500 rolms for hotel guests.Pool is closed until after March. Ice machines are out of order. Renovations on all floors means primer paint, patch jobs on the walls, and paint scraping everywhere. Elevators have missing buttons for some floors. Door key worked once out of 10 tries. Shower head for people under six feet. Spring mattress without the box springs. Blue stains on the carpet. And...no WIFI.Other than that...it wss great.Felt likeva giant dorm. Dumpy and full of young kids paying rent. I will never stay at an Aqua property again.

The positives of this hotel is that it is a good location on the canal and only three blocks from Waikiki Beach. It is in the centre of the shopping district. My room was clean and newly painted. The shower was lovely with lots of pressure (32nd floor). The 'kitchen area' was tiny, and I mean tiny, but equipped with two pans, utensils, dishes etc. My lanai overlooked other rooftops, and on one side I had a good view of the canal and the other a reasonable view of the beach and ocean through the other hi-rises. The front desk staff were courteous and speedy. There was no enthusiasm for their job.The negatives as I found them are the bed was a mattress on a board (no box spring), but it was not uncomfortable. My room was not at all like their ads claim. Cooking facilities were a sink and two-burner hotplate side by side - it was optimistically 30" wide. No other counter-top or food preparation area. The electric coffee maker stands on the hot plate cooking surface! The bathroom had a stainless steel kitchen sink, not a bathroom wash basin, and was larger than the sink next to the cooking surface. Their housekeeping left a lot to be desired and I had to repeatedly ask for supplies (shampoo etc), I had a footprint on my bed-sheet and the room was not cleaned daily, but the linen and towels were. It is old and tired, and the brown plastic shelving with dusty ornaments for sale didn't help. The area for hanging garments was about 15" wide and incorporated the iron and ironing board. It has a very noisy location because of the proximity to the main road next to the canal.

From the pictures online, I thought this place would be amazing. I was surprised the it was only 2 stars, but that should have alerted me to what this place really was. I agree with another reviewer that the renovations looked like a brother in law did it. The renos felt like they were slapped together, and you could still get a sense of this being an older hotel. With a little more effort it could have been beautiful. The hallways are dingy and smelly. It just feels like there is no pride taken in the up keep of this place. The Aqua brand itself to me is not a trusted company. I stayed at another Aqua hotel for one night in Waikiki, and while the lobby was nicely updated and beautiful, the room was not. This is one time where the reviews on trip advisor let me down. I will never stay at an Aqua brand hotel, nor recommend one. The only plus side to this place was the impeccable customer service we received from the front desk staff.

This review is long overdue. I stayed in Waikiki in October and it was my first trip. Having had no guidance as to where to stay, I sought out TripAdvisor. Glad that I chose this hotel. All the staff (Front Desk & Houseekeeping) that we encountered during our stay was very kind, anticipated our needs, and always exceeded our expectations. The Front Desk representative acknowledged our special occasion and we were very appreciative of that. He even had a special amentity prepared for us. He made us feel like we were the only guests. Unfortunately the Front Desk representative moved from Aqua Skyline to their Lotus property, but what a great gain for them. The only downside was the elevators were a bit too slow during their peak times.The room offered the necessary accommodations. Small kitchen area, but was sufficient. Had to use the bathroom sink to clean up as that was the only sink in the room. The bathroom was just fine for us, but there were only 2 of us in the room. If we had a larger party, this may have been a bit small. The rest of the room was very spacious and the patio with table was an added plus. Great views!I would definitely stay here again.

Great experience all around with friendly front desk staff, clean rooms and nice facilities. The pool deck is really spacious and enjoyable. Great views from the rooms.....only negative is slow elevators, particularly during peak hours.

The Aqua Skyline hit it out of the ballpark with their service, hospitality, location, and area knowledge. We didn't want for anything while we stayed there! From questions answered prior to check-in, to the on-site convenience store, to the rooms, to the staff--we were delighted and impressed with our stay! If we stay in Oahu again, we will stay here!

We stayed here for two weeks. Room was clean and recently updated with a modern vs. tropical decor. Nice, wide lanai too on the 26th floor. The view was superb as this is the tallest hotel in Waikiki. The rooftop cocktail party on Tuesdays offers fantastic views. That's around 44 stories high! The service was very friendly from checkin to security. The hotel offers free wi-fi and free in-room safes, which were both important to us. Many hotels charge for use of the in-room safes but not this one. The only disappointment was the kitchenette area and the fact that the stainless steel bathroom sink is the only sink so we had to use it to wash dishes too. I would prefer a separate sink. So if I stayed here again I would probably spring for a full kitchen unit if it's affordable. There are also many Webber grills and picnic tables at the pool level, which would help with the cooking. Otherwise the kitchenette utensils and pots and pans were rather sparse--one frying pan and one medium pot. We had planned to do more cooking but the kitchenette was in the narrow entrance area so not much room to maneuver. Otherwise no complaints. Many units are privately owned but cannot be rented through the hotel. You would need to go to VRBO.com or Craig's list for those. The hotel itself is very nice and I'd stay here again. Nice pool too.

Excellent pool and BBQ area, hotel location very good, staff very friendly, any concerns were properly addressed from GM Brian Kovaloff who listened, and resolved with true concern for the guest as especially this was my second experience with the Aqua brand!The views were amazing from my 40th floor and would possibly like to try a 1 bedroom next time to review that for my travel friends!Loyalty is important to any business and is appreciated when that is recognized!

I was visiting local friends and stayed here on my last night of the trip. Check in was a little slow as there was only one operating kiosk/desk that is outside near the tour sign ups and the small cafe downstairs. It was little painful to watch her operate in an inefficient set up (walking back and forth to the back room for the printer), in the humidity, but she was still very professional and upbeat just the same. Your room key is also a fob to access specific doors and the elevator.It looks like they're still finishing renovations in some of the common areas, but I think once it's done it will be beautiful. Unfortunately, the almost done phase of the renos gave me a sense that the previous state of the hotel was a dump, and I should watch my back. I don't know how else to explain it, other than I made sure to lock ALL of the locks as soon as I got in the room. I ended up with a studio kitchenette, which is plenty of room for two people -- two queen beds, a small but efficient kitchenette and a small bathroom, with a closet including a safe. The room decor is very modern, very sleek. The bed to me, was very hard, and I didn't sleep for more than a few hours at a time. The balcony is huge with a table and tow chairs making it a great way to enjoy breakfast, or to be breakfast for those pesky mosquitoes. I didn't use the kitchenette, but did see that one pot and one pan was available, along side the tiniest bottle of dish soap I've ever seen. Glasses and mugs are also provided and stored in the kitchenette cabinets. The bathroom sink is also your kitchen sink, and for this room I had, it looked like somebody cooked something and tried to clean their dishes, and somehow ended up splattering food up on the ceiling. Why that wasn't cleaned is beyond me because that was the first thing I saw walking into the bathroom. The shower head is a rain shower head, which made me very happy, but if you're taller than 5'5" you probably won't like it as much as I did, because you'll have to squat... very low.The little stuff.... The soap and stuff came from Paya Organics, which is was really nice, except I had a used bottle of lotion in my room. This line is known for using papaya as their main ingredient, is eco friendly and organic based, and made in the USA. Safety first must be this chain's motto - there were four fire sprinklers in the studio. The decorations - candles and such - were pretty, but there is a reminder not to light the candles, and also if you are prone to stealing stuff from hotels, there is a charge list for you kleptos. I don't know the official name of the binder or book that is left in hotel rooms, but I can tell you Aqua does not skimp out on this little detail. It is a beautiful coffee table book, fully in color with a lot of great information in it, plus there are more magazines to provide you with things to do and see. Room service is based on a $8.95 fee, on top of the cost of your meals, operated by a third party. Or you can order super expensive pizza from Round Table, with a minimum of $20. The location is very close to restaurants, shops, crowds and more crowds at Waikiki beach, if that's what you're looking for. Sign ups for tours to local attractions is very convenient at the lobby area, next to the cafe. My view was of the "city" which really means I had people out on their balconies who could see me on my balcony, and I could creepily spy on people in the pool and jacuzzi area, located on the 6th floor. However, if I looked to the left, there was a nice small view of the Ala Wai canal.

Good location. Reasonable price. Nice balcony. Very comfortable room. Only con was the hallway was dingy and smelled (not the room). Cute little cafe at the base with great smoothies. Paid parking available.

Location is pleasing with the golf course and canal next to the hotel. It is the highest condo in Waikiki so high floors offer unhindered views. Our stay was in a corner, one bedroom, high floor apartment that included a living room, study, kitchen w/ island, and a breakfast area. The furnishing were comfortable, the apartment clean (and kept clean daily by a friendly staff). With views of Diamond Head, the ocean, the canal, and the golf course, we enjoyed our lanai for several hours each day. Security was visual and on duty 24-hours. The front desk attendants had enough local knowledge to same us time and money as we enjoyed the local attractions. We will be pleased to recommend this facility to our friends and look forward to another visit.Don & Kazue Kite, PGA retired

Excellent customer service and enjoyable experience. Our room was at 36th floor and the view from the balcony was great. It was city and ocean view. There was a kitchen in the room and we could cook breakfast.

We found this hotel amongst all the others in Honolulu. It was our 25th anniversary, and so we knew that the location that we stayed needed to be truly special. We experienced firsthand the friendly embrace of the Aqua ohana as Amosa--the most friendly, charismatic, front desk receptionist--checked us into our room. We were truly blown away by his hospitality and welcoming attitude. And speaking of rooms, we were kindly upgraded to what must have been the best suite in the building. Every morning, we were graced with a sunrise view from the bedroom balcony. At night, we enjoyed the sunset from the living room window as we sipped on coffee brewed in the suite's kitchen. The bed was incredibly comfortable, and the bathroom featured a modern waterfall showerhead.Now, as constructive feedback for the hotel, I must mention that the bathroom was slightly small in proportion to the rest of the suite. The elevators were somewhat hit-or-miss as far as wait times were concerned, but this comes with the territory of a 44-floor building. But these small gripes aside, I can't say enough about how magically perfect our 25th anniversary was, brought together by the Aqua Skyline and Amosa's hospitality (PROMOTE THIS MAN!)

While not beachfront, we found our view of the canal very nice. Easy walk to downtown Waikiki. We were there between Christmas and new year's day. Watched the fireworks show on the 31st and easily got back to the hotel.Had a king with a sofa bed for our 17 year old granddaughter. Very spacious patio and balcony with convenient mini kitchen. Many barbecues on the pool level with lots of tables. A nice break from the restaurants.Since we love sightseeing, the location was very central. We put almost 500 miles on ou r rental while there. This brings me to my only reason to rate as a 4. Parking is paid each day at $ 25 seperately to the attendants. Always could find a spot convenient to elevators.

We stayed at the Skyline from January 1-10 and loved it. Our original booking was at the Ilikai, but we had to change at the last minute because the private condo we rented had water problems in the shower. I phoned the company that owns the Ilikai to inquire about other units available, but with nothing available there, we got a studio unit on the 44th floor at the Skyline. I think this is great hotel, with all the amenities you might need for your stay. Laundry can be done on the 6th floor where they have a fitness centre, pool and hot tub. Also a convenience store with reasonable prices is right on the premises. Walking to the beach took us 10 minutes and we had two kids in tow. Loved all the shops around the place, you have almost everything at your doorstep, car rental, banks, restaurants and lots of shopping. Our fridge broke on the 5th day and after someone was sent up to investigate we were promptly given a brand new one that worked great. We had a beautiful view from the 44th floor and the staff was very friendly. The only complaint that we had that our unit was next to the trash shoot and that got a little stinky at times at the door, but once inside the room it was OK.

I stayed here from Jan 1-6 and I absolutely loved it! They upgraded everything and it looks amazing. I had a studio room with a kitchenette and it was perfect because all I did was cook the entire time I was there. I went for a walk almost everyday, the location made it even better. It is not really close to the beach but then again it's Waikiki. The staff were incredible, and responded nicely to any of my concerns. I had an amazing view, I wish I was higher but next time I go I will try and be higher. I highly recommend this hotel, its actually budget friendly especially for what you are getting in return. I'm really glad I selected this hotel and can't wait for another return!!

Our family stayed here in early November and were very pleased! Just a few blocks from the beach and shopping. The front desk staff was most accommodating, the room was great, especially the lanai, and we had no complaints. Good value for the money!

My wife and I had 9 wonderful nights during Christmas and New Years at this hotel.It was close proximity to shopping, beaches, golf course, and rental car locations. The rooms were recently renovated and were always kept cleaned by housekeeping staff.There is a spacious patio for outdoor dining or people watching. The kitchenette is perfect, as we all know, eating out everyday can get very expensive. Unfortunately, the pool was being renovated; however, we did enjoy the nice hot tub. On the 6th floor, this hotel also has coin laundry machines, sauna, 6 BBQ's, fitness room, and a convenience store (which was open on Christmas Day).We were very impressed with front desk personnel named Amosa. Whether we need beach towels for the hot tub or we needed our luggage stored away, Amosa was alway happy to serve us with a smile. He even refused my gratuity…. hmmm?? (this guy deserves a pay raise).The parking is operated by a separate management company. Expect to pay $25 per day for hotel guest (or $35 per day for non-guests). We look forward to booking this hotel again next year and swimming in the new pool.

We had a fantastic four night stay with our two daughters. We all liked this hotel and the staff was very friendly and helpful. We stayed in a room with kitchen at the penthouse with ocean view. The łfacilities are excellent and there is a Enterprise car rental office at the premises which is convenient.Wimal & Charmanie

Not sure how my husband actually liked the hotel but I was not impressed that they forced him to wait for a 3 PM check in when he was leaving at 8 PM or earlier for an 10:50 PM overseas flight. We booked the room for him as he would have had to sit in the airport from noon until 10 PM when boarding the flight and since he wasn't feeling well, we paid $183 on express deals for less than 5 hours. Maybe there was no option, but that seems very unlikely. Very disappointing that one person could not be fitted in somewhere.

For a great price, the reservation clerk at the front desk decided to double the awesomeness by giving us a great view of the city, Iolani High School, the Ala Wai Canal, the Ala Wai Golf Course, and the mountains. It was amazing. We had a King bed, the shower was a little too small but it was fine, there was a huge chair to sit on in the living room, and a lot of work space. There was also a large refrigerator, full kitchen with utensils, soap/scrubber, dry cloth's, and more. There was also coffee and condiments. Although we only stayed for one night, we wish that we could have stayed longer because the room darkening drapes allowed us to enjoy waking up later. Service was great!

I had a fantastic weekend stay. Front Desk and Security staff were very helpful and attended to any need or question I had. Rooms were quality and affordable. My only gripe was with housekeeping entering my room without sufficient notice. However, I had a great overall stay. I would definitely recommend and return.Merry Christmas!

Our stay at the Aqua Skyline was great! Check in was a breeze & the staff were all so nice and friendly. I want to that the GM Brian Kovaloff for making sure our stay was memorable. I mentioned that it was a special vacation for my partner and he made sure that all our accommodations were met to my specifications! The view from the penthouse is excellent, and I would recommend this hotel over the large resorts in Waikiki.-JC

Hotel was in a great location, the room was nice and staff were very friendly and helpful. Unfortunately the day I arrived they started construction on the pool which I wasn't informed about at the time of the booking. I was on the 15th floor and it was noisy from construction and the hall way smelt really bad. Also house keeping woke me up at 7:10am to clean my room even though this is before their start time. When I asked for her to come back later she came back at 7:30am. Also the morning I left the vending machine ate my money and concierge weren't able to assist me and informed me I would have to contact the building management for assistance who opened at 9am and it was 4:30am

everything was perfect for me and my family. location was good as it was in the center of all action. rooms were very clean. i want to thank Mona for helping us out during our stay. she was very helpful and friendly. i would definitely stay here again.

We are leaving tomorrow and are reflecting on our trip. Must say that the hotel was great.. clean and comfortable, updated, great location and view, and amazing customer service. There is towel service, a convenience store, and bbq's on their 6th floor terrace.. which all came in very handy. The building is very secure and I did not see any questionable characters during our stay.The balcony is a fair size with a fair sized table and chairs so we ate many meals there... some meals we cooked, and some were takeout (we really like the Cheesecake Factory for takeout.. generous portions and consistent).No regrets.. I would definitely stay here again.

I stayed there for the second time with my husband from December 12-December 15 because we had an excellent experience the first time around. The first night was just horrible. When we first check in, our room was just dirty! There was hair everywhere! In the tub, on the bedsheets, on the sofabed, on the bathroom floor! There was a lot of dirt on the kitchen floor & to make it worse, the frame of the bed was really dusty like it hasnt been cleaned months! For one who has asthma like myself, this is unacceptable. Another issue that came up was that our TV was not working! The maid/maintenance person sent to our room could not even figure out how to fix it! She had to call a co-worker who was not working that night who lived right next to the building to come take a look at it. They put us on the 15th floor which was having renovations done with the moldings. The sight was not pretty. We asked to be moved but they said they had nothing available until the next day but it only had a shower & no tub! What a waste of a night! The next day, they moved us up to the 38th floor. It was ok but it was an ADA room so there was no closet & no separation between the toilet, & shower. They also had us check out of our current room & wait in the lobby for a couple of hours to switch our room...another wasted day. The next day after coming from a long day out, we come to a messy room because the maid never came to clean & do our bed. We had to call front desk to have them come clean. At checkout, there was no one at the front desk. We had to ring the bell several times until a lady came out. She was not friendly at all. We were just glad to check out. We did complain to the hotel manager Brian, but he did not even offer anything to us for our inconveniences. We will never come back to Aqua Skyline at Island Colony!

We like the location. A bit noisy on the balcony because of traffic, but hey it's Waikiki. The hotel/condo building staff were extremely nice and nothing but good things to say in that regard.We knew the hotel pool would be closed and we weren't there to swim in a pool anyway, so it didn't bother us.Great to have laundry facilities and a small store on the 6th floor opened until midnight.Pro's. It was cheap and had everything we needed. Car rental place on the premises and a cafe.Con's. Noisy old air-conditioning units in the suite. House cleaning lady was nice, but inconsistent. One day no towels for the kitchen, next day patio table not cleaned and not once was our bathroom sink's soap dish cleaned. Minor stuff to me, but might drive someone crazy.Also we had to buy wine glasses, a normal sized frying pan and a corkscrew all of which we left for the next guest. This things should be standard with a kitchen.The hotel seems to be going through a transition. You see a lot of normal everyday travellers, but also some sketchy folks coming and going. Harmless enough, but might disturb some folks.Wi-fi is only available in some suites, depends on the owner of your suite. They should make it mandatory for all owners to have wi-fi for all guest. We had wi-fi and it worked very well.The reno's…well…to fit in a kitchenette it was obvious they took space from the bathroom, however for the price it was great having a kitchenette for some meals.Also to be honest it looks like someone's brother-in-law did them. Carpet was bunching a bit in our room, tap too big for small kitchen sink etc. That said it did the job.If you aren't wanting to spend much and expect much, then this place will work.We enjoyed it…to a degree.

I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Aqua Skyline and would definitely stay here again. The location was centrally located in Waikiki and is a close walk to lots of shops, restaurants and bars. The beach is also a relatively short walk from the hotel. The public bus stops along Kuhio Avenue are nearby as well and I rode one over to Diamond Head for a hike up to the summit.My room had been recently renovated and was tastefully decorated. The bed and pillows are very comfortable and I slept well. The flat screen TV was surprisingly large for a hotel TV and the internet signal was strong, with a router in the room. The lanai was huge, with a table and chairs for outdoor enjoyment. The view from the room was spectacular.The staff were friendly and helpful. If you're there on a Tuesday evening, there is a Manager's reception for hotel guests on the roof of the hotel with amazing 360 degree views. I enjoyed chatting with Brian the manager and the two friendly ladies who were were serving the POG punch and the snacks.I can't wait to return.

Hotel is older, but rooms are updated and clean. It's located a few blocks away from Waikiki beach which made going to the beach a bit of a production. But, the location worked for us. Just outside of the load action packed strip, close enough to amenities and resturants. The roof top pool was nice, seculuded from the street and quiet. Mona at the front desk is extremely accommodating, helpful and pleasant. Staff is warm and friendly. Overall good value for what we paid, I would stay there again.

We had a wonderful stay at the Island Colony, for 6 nights, the entire staff was very helpful, especially the Manager Mr. Kovaloff. Our room was ideal, with all of the amenities we could ask for, including a small kitchen. We really enjoyed having a convenience store on the premise which was open late (till midnight), and provided all of the snacks and drinks we needed. We even enjoyed the Managers welcome cocktail party on the rooftop, which had magnificent views of Diamond Head. The Location was very close to great restaurants and shopping similar to Rodeo Drive, all within walking distance, a couple of short blocks away. We would definitely stay again. Perhaps the only draw back, which we were made aware of,is if you have a rental car, parking can be expensive, since the parking lot attached to the hotel is privately owned.

We stayed here for 4 nights on our honeymoon in October 2013 and it was great! It was our first time to Oahu. We got a free upgrade to a studio room with an amazing view of Waikki beach and Diamond Head. We also watched the sunrise from our balcony. It's just a short walk to the beach and restaurants. The only downside was the front desk clerk gave us wrong directions to Pearl Harbor and we ended up lost on the bus. We would definitely stay here again next time we come back!

review_body: I would not recommend staying here for many reasons. Yes the price is great, and there is a reason the saying goes "you get what you pay for". 1) The phone in my room didn't work, 2) the tv didn't work, 3) I am not sure how they get away with saying they are "newly renovated" when most of the floors haven't even had their renovations started yet, 4) I booked a king and got two doubles, 5) not every room has internet like they claim, 6) key card access to room doesn't work (had to insert and remove key 5 times each time I wanted to get into my room, 7) housekeeping replaced 3 towels, but only 1 wash cloth?, 8) I'll just stop here. Spend the extra money and go with one of the BRAND names, it's worth it!

I stayed at the Island Colony for 7 nights - 4/10/13 - 11/10/13. Awesome hotel and the newly renovated room was excellent. Upon arrival we were allocated a room on the 37th floor and the room was very nice. As we had had an overnight flight we were a slight bit tired so decided to have a couple of hours sleep. As we began to unpack there was a continuous loud drilling sound coming from we thought the room next to us but we later discovered it was actually from level 15. Wow did the noise travel!!I went down to Guest Services to explain the situation and Haziel was so helpful. She gave us a new room on the 43rd floor which was amazing and actually better than the first room and we could not hear any noise. Very helpful and we were very pleased.The location was great close to everything beach,shops,transport etc. All the staff were friendly and helpful and staying at the Island Colony made our trip to Hawaii a very enjoyable one!!I would thoroughly recommend this hotel as it is an excellent Hotel and great value for the price!!

Disappointing. - Not sure how these qualify as a condo - there was barely enough space to put our bags and two queen beds.They did not honor our request for a king bed since they were "sold out" the night before - there are 40 floors!- The location isn't central as well - its closer to the canals and a couple of blocks from the main action. We didn't mind being away from the noise but some might find this off putting. - There are no views - you are surrounded by condos.- Noisy. AC was loud and the glass doors were useless to stop the football hooligans all weekend.- Consolation: The pool was lovely. You have to pay an extra $5 to use the gym.

I stayed at the Island Colony for 2 nights in October with my husband and son. We had rooms on the 37th floor. The room was wonderful. The view was spectacular. The staff was very nice and the location was great. We were close to everything we needed. We had views of the beach on one side and the canal and mountains on the other. The beach was a very short walk away, The only thing we did not like was the bathroom. It was very very small and the shower head was too low for my very tall son and my husband. I loved our short stay and would happily return anytime. I highly recommend the Island Colony.

I stayed here last night in room 1810 and re-booked again for later this week when I return to Oahu (hopefully I will not get 1810). The front desk staff at checkin and checkout was very prompt and professional. The room had comfortable bedding and, for the most part, was clean. The router was not plugged in; I moved it around and housekeeping did not dust/clean the nightstand as dust was thick around the router. The radio part of the clock/radio did not work. Housekeeping should be checking items like this and report to the proper person. The shower was great, a rainshower, except it was less than six feet high and I had to stoop over to take a shower. Maintenance should have stopped the installation of this immediately as it's so obvious an average person could not fit under the shower head. For under $100 and close to everything, this was a great deal.

On the 20th September 2013 II realised stayed one night at the Aqua skyline at Island Colony, Honolulu. Few hours after my departure my wife told me that she forgot a pouch with all her jewelry, an Apple Shuffler NANO and head set. The following day I called the hotel and spoke with the house keeping Supervisor Maria Carmen. I asked her if she could check for my items. She came back after few minutes and found them. She took my coordinates and told me that she will mail them to me in Canada. I just spoke with her tonight and it was mailed this morning to Canada.Thank you so much to the staff and to Maria for her honesty and the service. It is really appreciated.Gilles M. Gatineau

While the hotel has security.. the parking is not secure. It allows anyone to park there, there are no security cameras so there have been a rash of car break ins and while staying there last week, another car break in and a physical attack on a woman late at night.. who is running this place? If Propark can not manage the parking.. and it is not that hard.. this is giving Aqua a bad image.. and the tiny sauna being co-ed is not cool or safe. Fix it.

We stayed at the Island Colony 1 bedroom 9Sep for three nights then we moved to studio. Beds are inferior in studio beware of people with bad backs 39th floor. Studio has two burner cooktop nice; no venting; no sink had to use one in bathroom, how inconvenient. Bedding clean, room comfortable, maids were a little shy about cleaning. Kept us in coffee. Staff very pleasant Yes, would stay again. Views,quiet all great.

Price was just okay, but satisfied for what we got. Clean rooms, comfy beds, big balcony (view of fireworks on Fridays), kitchenette is a super plus! If you're at a high floor, be prepared to wait a bit getting to your room and back down on the elevators.. Not enough elevators for a 44-story building. Location is great! thought we would be too far from the beach, but it was an easy few minutes walk. Parking is ample but $25/day. Staff was excellent!! Fast and easy check-in and check-out. Front desk always willing to help you with anything you need (special thanks to PT and Leilani, best hotel staff ever!) Happy that housekeeping always stacked us up with that delicious Kona coffee bags so I can always brew a fresh cup anytime! Okay, making this too long.. In short, stay here and you will not be disappointed!! Mahalo!!!

This is an older, newly renovated hotel located about 3 blocks from the beach and in the heart of Waikiki. Restaurants and stores are conveniently close to the hotel. My room was a double queen on the 40th floor, with a spectacular view. It was clean and nicely done...the best part of this hotel has to be the incredible staff... Everyone I interacted with was simply amazing and so helpful....P.T. .Maria...Steve...Hazil and Jesse. This group of wonderful folks truly embody the Aloha Spirit.. I wouldn't hesitate to return.

Lovely helpful staff !!  Fantastic location- not far from any of the main sights & close to transport meant we could walk or bus anywhere. We were upgraded room type (as we're the 2 other couples in front of us in line at check in) was a nice surprise. Room was VERY clean & I'd without a doubt stay again.

My friend and I stayed here for 5 nights in August and it was simply superb. From check in with the lovely PT right through to check out the service and friendliness of all staff was great. Our twin room was on the 40th floor and was spacious and neat, great city, canal and ocean views. Hardly any noise and great block out blinds. The pool was great too. I highly recommend this palce and would suggest all my friends to stay here if they are looking for a great located hotel in waikiki. Only 3 blocks from the beach, far enough away from the busy streets to enjoy the city.

We stayed there the 2nd week if August. Our rooms was great clean. The location was just of the main strip. But the people here at Island Colony were so friendly. We'd recommend this hotel to our families & friends.

Upon arrival, we were greeted by friendly and efficient staff. We were given room 912 which was clean and had two beds for the three of us, as requested. We arrived late and just went straight to bed. The next morning, we called down to the front desk to see if we could change rooms as we were not satisfied. The reason being is that there was no real door on the bathroom, just a piece of plastic that swung back and forth but not even a pocket door. It was not private for three people sharing a room. The other reason is that there were no plugs in the kitchenette area so you had to wash your dishes and brew your coffee in the bathroom! Steve (very helpful) at the front desk said to check out room 1210 which we did and found it a bit older but it was much better. Everything had its place and in perfect working order. The renovation in the first room seemed incomplete or not well designed. There is still work to be done. Our new room was clean, balcony with table and chairs, fridge, coffee maker, toaster, burners, cookware, microwave, cups and utensils, two very comfortable queen beds. The AC was a bit noisy however it worked. there is in room wifi and well as service in the lobby. Our wifi was not working one day so I called down and they had it fixed within no time. There is a cafe in lobby with coffee and snacks. The front desk provides towels and beach chairs for use during your stay. The location of this property is excellent as its only a few minutes walk to The Pantry (supermarket), Kalakaua Ave, restaurants and the beach. I have never stayed at a Waikiki hotel before that was in such a quiet area (beside the Ala Wai Canal) no horns or noisy people! The property has a large outdoor space on the 6th floor that has an outdoor pool, laundry facilities, BBQ's, sauna and a well stocked convenience store. There is no shade around the pool until the afternoon. This is a great place to stay and an excellent value for your money, especially in Waikiki. The staff also take good care of you and are very helpful!

Hello Aqua Skyline folks!! My Family and I wanted to thank everyone for an AMAZING vacation!! You all made it fun and easy. I cant mention everyone but PT, Steve, Brian... gezzz everyone... we had an amazing time and you all really REALLY went the extra mile. Thanks so much for spending so MUCH TIME and EFFORT to give us tips, locations, haha discounts... even free parking tips!! We loved the view of the FIREWORKS from our balcony twice a week. Thanks for free beach chairs and towels. Cleaning up our broken glass when my son wanted water in the middle of the night.. well thanks for just making us FEEL like we were welcomed and FAMILY!!!!I wished I can post a longer even more boring thank you but you get the point. WE WERE SO HAPPY WE PICKED YOUR HOTEL!! WE GOT TWO GREAT SUITES, WITH VIEWS, AND A WARM STAFF TO WATCH OVER US

The staff is very nice, courteous, and helpful. Hotel has free chairs and beach towels for guests to borrow. Waikiki beach is about 10-15 min walk away. Room is nice and spacious. There is no AC in the living room (we had a 1 bed room suites, with a bedroom, living room and kitchen area). The window in the living room could only be opened partially so during the day, the room was really hot. Between the cool air and the fan, sleeping in the living room was fine...just be ready to cool down first. We didn't spend time in the room during the day so it was fine with us. There is an enterprise rental behind the hotel, but it is pricier than renting from the airport. Our only complaint is that the hallways have strange odors (probably from the cooking smells from theother units), thankfully our unit/ room was odor free.
