review_body: The hotel is nothing special in itself, but I moved there after staying at Hilton Hawaiian village for a week on business travel, thus a direct comparison would be a bit unfair. The first room I got was quite old, with a noisy air conditioning system, a locker without a key and old furniture. It was ok, but I think a bit overpriced. I was offered to upgrade to a refurnished room for a few dollars per day more, and that was a really good choice: I got a room at the top floor, fully renovated, with a fantastic sight over Waikiki! I think for that room, the price was instead a bargain! Considering both rooms, I list the room quality is average (but the second one was almost better than the Hilton)Pro: in general good price, location is a bit far from the beach compared to more fancy hotels but is no big deal. Personnel is helpful and kind.Cons: no wifi in rooms (unless you get a mobile modem at the reception), but the wifi in the lobby is free so no big deal. There was some renovation going on during the stay, and I could see from the announcements posted next to the elevator that some rooms would be without water on a certain day for X hours. I was not effected, but I would have been annoyed had it been my room.

We stayed at Island Colony for 8 nights with two children. The renovated room is newer than expected which is great, everything is clean and in good condition. The microwave, fridge and cooktop are ideal for a familiy breakfast or late night snack. My kids love to start the day with a breakfast on the balcony. The location is good, a bit walk to the beach but still managable. It is close to a big two-storey Ross store - if you are a shopper, you know what I mean. When kids staying in the hotel swimming pool after a busy tour day, whoever loves shopping can spend a great time in the Ross store within walking distance. We also went to the Premium outlet, but some of the deals at Ross store was better than the outlet. Swimming pool was closed when we made the reservation, but it was open when we arrived, what a pleasant surprise! Although there are plenty of water activities all over the island, a vacation without swimming pool is not a real one!Overall it was a great stay and we enjoyed our vacation!

We booked through Hawaiian Paradise Retreats, and stayed in apartment 2720. There was some initial confusion with our booking when we arrived, but the apartment manager was able to help. Our apartment was clean and tidy, although the blinds needed some attention! We stayed here with our two adult children, and there was enough space - you're not in your room much anyway. The housekeeping lady was very helpful and organised an inflatable bed for our son. It was good having a kitchenette, we went to the local Food Pantry (Supermarket) and bought supplies and ate in some nights. The Aqua Skyline has lovely views over the canal, and out towards the sea. A block or so from the beach, and very convenient to shopping and restaurants.

After a 30 hour journey to get to Hawaii I was in desperate need of a hot shower and a cozy bed and i was not disappointed! The lady at check-in did a great a job! Was up in the room in 10mins from stepping out of the cab! My partner and I had a wonderful time at the hotel,making a little use of the pool as well! It was very clean and not much noise too! Oh and the aircon worked great too! Lol The little store on the 6th floor is superb!! Location wise - I was lucky! This hotel is walking distance to some great places to eat, the beach is just down the road and the walk is just nice!Highly recommend this hotel to those who want to have a comfy place to get back after a long day out and those who like to walk around experience the little hole-in-the-wall places.

We had a really nice time staying at this hotel. The room was clean, comfortable beds, the kitchen was perfect, everything we needed was right at our fingertips. The view was beautiful, we got to watch the fireworks from the Hilton hotel on our balcony. The balcony was perfect. This hotel is close to the beach, shopping and restaurants. The store in the hotel was very convienient to shop at...I thought the vending machine was cheap to purchase water and soda $1.00 can't beat that.....the office staff was very helpful and friendly....I would definately recommened this hotel.

I was shock how different the room were. I stayed here before and the rooms was alright but now it's excellent. Everybody has different experience at this hotel but my experience was very good from the chech-in with the front desk staff and down to housekeeping. I will definitely stay here again because me and my family made new friends with the hotel staff.

We were lucky to have 3 weeks in Hawaii and were looking for something that was relatively cheap for Waikiki but still close to everything we would need. We’d stayed at the Aqua Park Shore a few times before but found since it’s been renovated the prices are on the upper side of what we wanted to pay (and really what it’s worth), so were pleased to find another Aqua hotel, the Skyline Colony Island with a great price.Over our 3 weeks we technically had 2 separate stays as we checked out to spend 2 nights at the Trump Waikiki for our wedding anniversary. For both stays we were able to check in early which was a great surprise, especially for our first stay when we arrived about 8.30am expecting to leave our bags and return around 2pm to check in (like at the Park Shore and other hotels we’ve stayed at). However we were pleasantly surprised that our room was ready and we were allowed in with wine and chocolates awaiting our arrival to celebrate our anniversary courtesy of the hotel.The hotel has recently undergone some renovations and the rooms do reflect this. They’re stylish and modern and larger than a regular hotel room in this price bracket. Pros• Large tv with cable and so many channels your thumb hurts just doing one round of channel changes checking what’s on• Large room for the price• Great views if you’re on the upper levels (our first room faced out to the sunset, the second room faced Diamond Head)• Quiet (with the exception of our second room which was on a lower floor so we could hear the garbage removal trucks early some morings)• Great location, close to the bus stop, shops and restaurants• Everything you could need on site (small grocery store, café, laundry, pool)• Kitchen is good and has all you need• Shower head is massive• Balcony with table and chairs• Great value for money• Staff are really friendly and niceCons• Sometimes we would have to close the balcony door due to smokers• Air con unit was a little loud (but you got used to it)TipsFood Barn around the corner is great for stocking your fridge to avoid the ABC store pricesGo to the Mangers reception which is on Tuesday evenings, it’s a great photo op if you’re on a lower floor as it’s on the roof and one of the best views of Honolulu (and there is free cocktails!)

I had the pleasure of staying at this property in June 2013. I wasn't able to check in til about 8 p.m. When I arrived, I was greeted by name. It was a great way to start my stay there. I like that the elevators are secure and only guests have access to them. The room was very quaint. The decorations were modern. The bed was clean, neat and very comfortable. I didn't have to call housekeeping for extra supplies either. Everything was well stocked. I will definitely will stay at this hotel again.

We stayed at the Aqua Skyline at Island Colony over the 4th of July holiday. The view from our room on the 43rd floor gave us the perfect view of the fireworks at Magic Island (on the 4th of July) and of the fireworks at the Hilton Hawaiian Village (on Fridays). The hotel has a nice-sized pool/jacuzzi/recreation area on the 6th floor, this is where we spent the majority of our time - the kids loved swimming in the pool. Also on the 6th floor is a small store which is convenient. The location of the hotel was ideal for us - a short walking distance to the beach, the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center, and Kalakua Ave, but yet it was away from the noisier and busier streets. And lastly, the staff at the Aqua Skyline was helpful and curteous, especially the hotel manager, Mr. Kovaloff.

First of all, we booked directly through the hotel website and got a great rate...especially considering the astronomical prices of hotel rooms in Waikiki. I think we paid something like $130/night including all taxes, fees, etc. To be honest, before arriving, I was a little scared that it might be a "you get what you pay for" kind of experience. We arrived late at night, and our airport shuttle dropped us in the alley (more of an issue with the shuttle drivers than the hotel), so I was afraid my fears were being realized. However, once we were in the room, I was pleasantly surprised. The furnishings are updated and clean, even though you can see the traces of the older shell of the room (door fixtures, layers of paint). There is a kitchen area that provides dishes, pots and pans, a sink, microwave, coffee maker, etc. The room has an old fashioned wall/window type air conditioner that is quite noisy, so if you are a light sleeper or not used to such sounds, that may be an issue. Our room was not on one of the high levels (I think we were in the middle), so our view was not fantastic or of the ocean (overlooked the canal and golf course), but we didn't really care. It was high enough to be quiet! The bathroom is tiny, but manageable. So, there were a few small issues: the key cards kept becoming deactivated, which required multiple trips to the lobby; the concierge was less than friendly/helpful (isn't that his job?) but the front desk staff were very friendly; the lobby mysteriously smelled like garbage sometimes; our room was not cleaned one day; the A/C was noisy; the other rooms at our level were privately owned vacation rentals, which was kind of weird. They offer free replacement items (toothbrush, sewing kit, etc.), but when I asked for a sewing kit around 8:30 pm to fix an item of clothing that ripped, they said that housekeeping provides those items, and they had already left for the day. Overall, the issues were small and didn't make us regret our decision to stay at this hotel. However, it appears from other reviews that not all rooms at this hotel are created equal, and I can believe that. I think we were lucky.

My family and I made reservations to stay at the Aqua Skyline Hotel on June 12 & 13. We reserved 3 rooms. We were very unhappy with the experience for the following reasons:1) Pool & Jacuzzi were both SHUT DOWNa. We were not told of this to have the opportunity to potentially book at another locationb. No mention of this at check inc. We learned about this when we went to the pool itselfd. No options at other properties madee. In JUNE? In Hawaii? f. How could this NOT be a priority clean up2) We did not know this hotel was also a rental property so there are people who are NOT travelers mixed with guests – very odd and there were lots of very “different” types of people coming and going and intermingled with guests on floors. This gives unknown individuals access to guests. Extremely unsettling.3) The air conditioners are outdated and had BUCKETS which would fill with watera. The buckets overfilled and water was spread ALL OVER THE TILE BALCONYb. My adult son slipped and fell on his backside on the balconyc. The bucket in our room overfilled twice and required my husband to have to carry the bucket into the room, empty and replace. d. All buckets required the maids to emptye. NO ONE said anything when we checked in of this condition – WE SHOULD HAVE BEEN WARNED. There are no signs or messages on the balcony or sliding glass door4) All the card keys for ALL the rooms kept demagnetizing, this required several trips. This is all unacceptable conditions and seems to be contrary to all the promises of the type of experience we were promised. We were very unhappy and wish that the Aqua Colony Skyline was not at all proactive in advising us to mitigate any of the above conditions. We could have moved and made other arrangements. This was not an inexpensive trip or set of reservations and we were very let down.

Over the last several years this hotel has been updated, painted and updated. Our room was much nicer and more stylish than the old room we had last year. New mattresses were good. The room safe is included in the price at this hotel. Bathroom, while nice, is small. I would prefer my space in the main room, so a small bathroom is fine with me. The bathroom was all new except for the bath tub, but everything is nice, clean and new. The shower head is different, a big square "rain" type. It was nice, but I'm not going to put one in my house. The location is either good or bad depending what you want. It's as quiet as it gets in Waikiki, not too loud. It's a bit of a walk to the beach, but not bad. One block you are in the center of Waikiki. In room internet is new, was fast and all three of us used it at the same time with no issues. The one problem we had, and it seems to be common everywhere is getting enough towels. Check in we had three sets for three people. Some days we had two sets and had to call. Never got replacements for the kitchen towels. I know all I had to call to get more, but it got old after a while. It wasn't every day, but it was too often. That was my only complaint. (minor). The whole hotel is very nice, in a basic kind of way, not like a newer mega resort in Las Vegas. Was I glad to stay here: yes. Will I come back next year? Don't know. The price increases have been huge in the last few years and to be honest, Waikiki isn't as nice or as affordable as it used to be. But that is another issue.Prices are way up this year in Waikiki. Not just this hotel, but cheap eats are hard to find.

My best friend and I were transiting and we stayed for one night and loved the room for the low price I paid. Great location, great view, and comfortable beds! What more can I ask for. Walking distance to Waikiki Beach and great places to eat every where. Can walk out and catch the city bus easily. Definitely a satisfying experience that was worth every penny. :)

The pros first :The views from upper floors are beautiful, day and night.The hotel's location is good, right in the city center.The hotel is located in a quiet street.The front desk staff is efficient, friendly and really willing to help, but the owner's decisions seem to ruin their good intentions.Now the problems :Next to front desk there are signs saying there is no parking there, so we entered the hotel's parking in order to check in and found out later that we could park next to front desk. Misleading signs and not unintentionally.The parking costs 25$ per 24 hours and every time we got out the cashier tried to convince us to prepay for the entire period of our stay at that hotel. Why to prepay if you have the possibility to find free parking outside? What if you change your mind and leave earlier?In the lobby there are 2 computers but it's not free for guests. In the simplest motel it's free nowadays.The hotel is a renovated high rise, but cheaply renovated.We stayed in a suite where the living room's windows were far from being sealed. The wind entering the failed window seal was so noisy that in order to sleep we had to close curtains well, so that they stopped part of the wind from entering from the low quality windows. And the windows were "closed".The phone's red light in living room was flashing, but there were no instructions on the phone how to listen to the messages. We had to call the front desk and they told us to dial 55. We did so and listened to old messages that were left for former guests. Complete violation of former guests' privacy by that hotel.In the bedroom, the bed was so close to wall on one side, that I had to stick to wall in order to get in bed. There were only 31cm (12 inch) between bed and wall. On that side of the bed there is nothing : no lamp, no bedside chest, not even a shelf, nothing. The person sleeping in that side doesn't have even where to put the glasses, not to mention reading.The bed has a prominent frame all around it, which makes you get injured every time you get in or out of bed. Why do they put in such a small bedroom, where on one side there is only a 12 inches space between bed and wall, a bed with a prominent frame? Who is the genius that decided that poor decision?On bedroom's balcony there was no light at all - no light switch and no lamp.The phone in our bedroom didn't work.There is no clock radio in the suite ( basic item in the simplest motel in USA), so you cannot see what time it is at night.The bedroom's door was terribly squeaky. We couldn't close it at night because every time one of us opened it in order to go to bathroom, the terrible noise waked the other one. It took the maintenance service TWO DAYS to send somebody to grease the door hinge in less than 2 minutes.In the bathroom, the small shelf for soap above the tub was dirty and long dark hair was hanging from the tap.Above tub there is a shower with a "forest rain" head, but the water flaw pressure is weak, so all you can feel are scattered drops.In the wall between bedroom and bathroom there is a window, I can't see why. Every time one of us went to bathroom at night, the light from bathroom waked the other one - one more genius idea.Noisy ventilation system in bathroom.There was absolutely no place to put the cloths one takes off before taking a shower, no shelf and not even a hook.The hair drier was not hanging on the wall although it was made for hanging. It was just on a shelf under the sink and next to the sink there was not enough space for the whole appliance. So I had to take it out of the bathroom , to look for an electric outlet and to use it close to it in a completely uncomfortable way.The kitchen island's counter top was dirty.Noisy fridge.The hotel has trash chutes, one of the trash chutes' doors was next to our suite door and the stench was impossible and penetrated our suite.Waiting for the elevator took forever. There are only 4 elevators for that huge building, one of them was out of order during all our stay and nobody fixed it.The elevators are too small for the number of guests that have to use them and there is not enough room for luggage.Not only tourists stay at that hotel, all kinds of workers and persons actually live there and this hotel is definitely not a place for a woman alone to stay at.Among all TV channels, there was no weather channel - the most important TV channel for a tourist in Honolulu.We wasted 3 days of our vacation on getting angry, on conversations with the front desk staff and with the hotel's manager about the endless list of problems and inconveniences we encountered. And they take 325$ (!!!) per night for that outrageous hotel, no breakfast, no free parking, not even free computer for guests.Mr Brian K - the manager of that hotel, please do not thank me for taking the time to write that, I did it for future potential guests in order to warn them.And do me a favor, do not offer me to be your guest again. After paying 325$ !!! per night and getting for them so many problems and inconveniences that spoilt our precious vacation, do not expect us to come back, you wouldn't either.

We made a reservation based on the price ($140/nt) and the pictures from the hotel website. Had to wait 3 hours before we allowed to see a room. I find it hard to believe that there would be absolutely NO ROOM available before 3pm. I'm quite certain that all the rooms are not all being cleaned at the exact same time. That was the first dissapointment. The second dissapointment was that the pool was closed (I have a 12 year old child). The deal breaker was the room itself. The lanai was great, but couldn't get past the room itself. Just too old and dated. The paint was fresh, but there had been no updating to fixtures and such. So, after waiting for 3 hours and looking at 3 different rooms at Aqua Skyline, I scrambled to find us an acceptable room. We ended up at the Hyatt Regency with an oceanfront view of Waikiki Beach (Hotwire $189/night).

We stayed at the Island Colony for over a week in May, booking in a "studio kitchenette" room. My wife & I were very impressed by the newly renovated room & bathroom, which was well styled, comfortable and spacious. Our room had all the amenities to make our stay comfortable: Coffee-machine/kettle, sofa couch, study table, electronic safe, iron, kitchen facilities (stove, pots & pans), laundry facilities and a veranda. From our room on the 24th floor, we had views of the Waikiki buildings & canal. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. At the price we paid we’d definitely stay at the Island Colony again.Pros:* New renovated rooms, kitchenette is great for eating in for breakfast or dinner (we get a bit sick of eating out everyday). Big comfortable bed.* Close to the main attractions on Waikiki beach (under 10mins) and to the shuttle/bus stops (about 5 mins). Being 2 blocks away from Waikiki beach also means that the food & shopping is slightly cheaper! * Convenience store on level 6 (items cost about 10-15% more than ABC stores, but it’s convenient) *Individual wifi router in our room (was able to connect 2 phones and 1 tablet to the internet )*Great value for the price we booked at.Cons:*Noise- as more of the building is being converted from condo to hotel rooms, renovation work is ongoing. Unfortunately for us the workers would start work in the room directly above us at 8:30am during weekday mornings, with their hammering, power tools and things being dropped onto the concrete floor. Not ideal for us when we wanted to sleep in. We raised this with the front desk and was offered a room change, though by that point we had spread all our shopping & belongings over the room, making it too difficult to move. I wished they would start renovation work later in the morning considering that it’s a hotel for people on vacation. *Housekeeping – was a bit average. They did the minimum which was to change the towels, empty bins and tidy the bedsheets. Some days, our coffee & sugar supplies were not replenished. There was also no sweeping/vacuuming done during our 9 day stay, and the floors were getting a bit dirty towards the end. *Parking is a tad bit expensive at $25 a day, compared to $20 a day at other hotels in the area.Tips: If you need to buy bulk groceries there is a large supermarket 2 blocks away (Food Pantry)

First time in Waikiki and was very pleased choosing this hotel.Had an excellent view from our one bedroom corner unit and the staff were awesome. Short walk to the beaches and very close to all shopping.Tour companies do pick up at this hotel or just down the street at Ross dept store. Was there for 10 days June 5th-14th the pool was closed but with so many beautiful beaches and sites to see who needs the pool. Also the Ala Wai Canal right across the street is a nice place to sit and unwind for a bit and reflect on how beautiful this Island truly is.

Stayed for a week. Tip 1: Try hotels.com & expedia daily to score opportunity rates that pop out once in a while (always good to refresh the offer - this one came up suddenly). We arrived in the morning & official check wasn't until 1500 hrs but we wanted to shower and hit the Arizona memorial at Pearl Harbor. So the nice lady at the desk offered to store our luggage and the shower and changing facilities. Tip 2: I asked whether there were any rooms available at the moment. She said there was one on the higher floor that was currently being cleaned, that we would have to wait for a while, which wasn't a problem - waited about 15 mins to get the room just below the 40th floor.Room was large enough for my family, loved the balcony but the toilet was a squeeze but sufficient given this price point -definitely still value for money. Near Waikiki Beach, International marketplace etc. Tip 3: Don't forget to visit Marukame Udon nearby for excellent udon (go early or at breakfast to avoid long lines) and the newly opened Ross just down the street. Tip 4: Ask when are the fireworks on Waikiki Beach and whether your room can see it. If you love a fireworks show, a high floor and the nice balcony would be beneficial. By the way, don't leave unsecured items to dry on the balcony - they may just be blown away.Loved the wifi too. Connected all our phones, laptops and ipads and it still worked fine.

The Skyline is great value for the money one pays, especially in Waikiki, which is a very expensive destination.We stayed in a one bedroom suite which afforded us much needed space for my wife"s shopping outings! I loathe walking but all the shopping is only a short distance away.I was in a corner unit at Seaside & Ala Wai and overlooked the canal and had spectacular views of the ocean and the city at night. There is an unbelievable breeze that blew into our 25th floor suite from the canal side. Windows don't open far for obvious reasons as there is no balcony.A young man named PT has been mentioned in previous reviews and deserves mentioning again. A credit to the Aqua group he is and you need to hang on to him. All staff as a whole are very helpful.I have already recommended this establishment to many family and friends. Is there a commission to me if they book with you?Only disappointment was that some cretin had thrown a bottle into the hotel pool and we could not use it during our stay BUT that wasn't the hotels' fault.Cooking breakfast and eating on the oceanside balcony made for incredible starts to the dayIn Arnie's words...... I'll be back.

Enjoyed our stay at Aqua Skyline (we were there for 6 nights). Location is convenient. 2 blocks from the beach. Near to shopping strip and lots of eateries. Booked a studio kitchenette. Room is big enough for 4 of us (2 adults and 2 kids). Kids enjoyed being out on the balcony with the breeze and view. Toilet is small but has all the essentials, bath-tub, warm water, enough pressure etc. Aircon is a bit noisy and there is a bucket outside on the balcony that collects the water from the aircon and one day, it overflowed, and I had to throw the water into the toilet bowl on my own. Kitchenette is small but ok and I managed to cook on the stove and use the microwave to heat up stuff. Hotel also have laundry area where you can wash and dry your clothes - cost $1.25 each cycle. but do bring your own detergent. There is a small mini mart in the building that sell food, detergents, drinks etc etc., which is good. Free wifi in the room which is a plus! Carpark is expensive at $25/day for hotel guest. One downside was the swimming pool was closed for renovation as some guests threw / left behind broken glasses in and the management had to clean up the pool during the entire stay we were there. And it will be good if the hotel can provide portable beach chairs and beach towels that guests can borrowed to the beaches.Do ask for high floors and view to the Diamond head and golf area as there are fireworks on one of the night we were there and we thoroughly enjoyed the fireworks from our balcony.

Just had a short stay over for a couple days of business. I wanted a hotel within walking distance of Waikiki without all the noise. This hotel is clean, well managed and the staff is great. Free wi-fi in the lobby but getting it in your room can be a challenge. The price is very reasonable and all the rooms have private balconies. I will definitely stay here on my next trip to Honolulu.

I called the day before our arrival to request a king bed and a high enough floor for a view. The person that took my request was very efficient and accommodating. Every morning of our 7 day stay, my husband walked to the corner Jamba Juice and would get me oatmeal and coffee, returning to our beautiful lanai to watch the rest of the world go to work! Our room at the Aqua Skyline at Island Colony was perfect. The bed was very comfortable, the rain shower was a plus and the housekeeping service was excellent, with a very clean room each day.  The mini market on the 6th floor was very handy and the laundry facilities a plus. Pleasant Hawaiian tour operators are in the lobby and booked a tour of Pearl Harbor that was so worth it.  From Kuhio St one block away, you can get the bus to Diamond Head and have an awesome two hour experience hiking to the top with exquisite views. Hotel is great for easy walking to most designer shopping, restaurants, Waikiki shuttle stop, or just take a walk around the canal.  We will definitely be back!

We had only stayed two nights but found this to be the perfect stop over spot on Oahu. We were checked into a room on the top floor with a terrace overlooking the skyline and beach. We were given chocolate covered macadamia nuts and a bottle of white wine in our room upon check in. The room was clean and well decorated. Great proximity to Waikiki Beach and overall no complaints about our stay here!

review_body: Clean room. Friendly and extremely helpful staffs. We requested a high level for better views and we were given the 43rd floor! One below penthouse :) we stayed for 8 days altogether~~~would stay again without a thought :)

My husband and I had a pleasant stay at the Colony for 12 nights in May 2013. We arrived around 4 hours early but got checked in straight away by the friendly concierge, who also moved us to a room higher up to get a better view when we asked. The staff are friendly and the hotel is in a great location - close walking distance to the major shopping strip and markets, restaurants and the beach, but far enough away that street noise is not an issue (except for the nightly police sirens). Having a parking garage on site was also very handy, but pricey at $25 a day) . The hotel is undergoing some renovations so the pool is updated and the room we stayed in was more modern and had wifi. One issue - there was only one aircon unit in the suite which was located in the bedroom so the living room was often quite warm because their airflow wasn't great. But all in all it's a good hotel in a fantastic location and is really good value for money compared to other places we looked at staying. If we come back to Waikiki we'd stay here again.

Hotel: Stayed here for 1week, room was ok, but was not kept clean throughout the week. The beds were made and new towels were given daily, however the bathtub was never cleaned even when we left a note for the maid on the bed. When we arrived we had to ask for a different room, the 1st was right next to the garbage chute and the smell was strong. We were given a new room without any hassle. Location was good, close to shops and restaurants. Its a 10 min walk to Waikiki beach. Area is safe to walk around. Pay the parking in advance, will save you time every time you leave. Our room overlooked the pool (12th floor) it was quiet all day and night. Extra: We had a car so we would visit beaches around the entire island. You need a car, you'll miss way too much if you stay only in Waikiki. Hanauma bay was great for snorkelling. Hawaiian shark adventures tour was really cool, the sharks are peaceful! Diamond head was great, the hike worth it. I found it rough, but I need to hit the gym :( go early we started at 8, finished at 10, it was getting busy already. Went to a gun range, easier than I expected. Stop at the lookouts along the highways, good way to find nice beaches that you would have missed. Dole plantation was boring, but if you visit the area be sure to stop for a dolewhip ice cream with pineapple juice. Went to Polynesian center and luau for my bday. Food was ok, 2nd half of show was really good!!Be prepared to see lots of homeless people. I'm used to seeing this in Montreal but I was shocked by how many there were in Waikiki and surrounding areas.

We stayed for 7 night in Aqua Skyline and the experience was superb.Initially when we arrived, we were surprised that the hotel actually read our comment and gave us the highest room available which was just under the penthouse level! We also were able to get the room with a better view of the city and slight ocean view.However, we had a slight hiccup due to bed arrangement, this was quickly resolved as one of the most friendly staff, PT, came around to place an extra fold-able bed in our room and we were able to book into a room with the proper setup the next day. Although the level was slightly lower, we were still at one of the highest level.The rooms are clean and nicely renovated. All the staffs we came across were helpful and very friendly, including the security guard down in the lobby!The hotel is also in a great location! Located in a quiet street, yet very close to Waikiki beach!Overall we had a great experience in Aqua Skyline and would like to give thank to the BEST staff we've came across, PT!

review_body: We stayed at the Aqua Skyline at Island Colony for a week-long business trip in March 2013. In addition to being an excellent deal financially, the hotel was in a nice central location- within walking distance to shopping areas, the beach, and various nightlife and restaurants around Waikiki. Our room was on the 42nd floor, and had amazing views of both the beach and downtown; Diamond Head and Molokai were visible in the distance, and the sunrise and sunset from our spacious lanai was an added bonus. To top it off, despite being centrally located, we did not have difficulty with noise disturbance from traffic, other guests, or tourists in the area. Parking was available and affordable on several streets nearby, as well as within the hotel garage for a reasonable fee. Further, the hotel had various security measures in place to ensure that guests felt safe. Brian, a member of the management team, as well as several other staff members, treated us with respect and kindness, and were consistently available to answer questions. Our room was clean and came equipped with a kitchenette and large refrigerator, as well as a working air conditioner and comfortable, clean beds. We highly recommend this hotel and will be returning on our next visit!

We stayed in a one bedroom apartment on 42nd floor with our 15 month old boy. Glad we bought our porta cot as cots are $25 a day! Air conditioning was loud but our boy slept through it. Great location, short walk to beach and all happenings, AWESOME view! Nice clean room with kitchenette had everything we needed. Our boy was in the bedroom and we slept on the fold out couch which was perfectly comfortable. We hired a car for 3 days and parking was quite expensive ($25 a day - 24 hrs!) Some problems with the room door caused us to be locked out for over an hour with bubs which was not good, but other than that a great stay, thanks Island Colony! P.T, Steve and Lailani!

I would highly recommend this hotel. It is in a great location in Waikiki, close to everything, including the shops and restaurants. Approximately three blocks from the beach. The views on the high floors are magnificent. The room was nicely renovated and was very clean. The hotel also has good security. The hotel provided excellent customer service from the moment I checked in, from top management to staff level personnel. I've been to Hawaii four times and this was definitely the best experience I've had so far---a big reason was the hotel experience. I would recommend this hotel over other more well-known large hotel chains.

Aqua Skyline is a great place to stay. We were happy to be able to walk such a short distance to Kuhio and Kalakaua Avenue. Our room was very roomy with a kitchenette, living room and large bedroom. The view was just gorgeous overlooking the 41st floor. I would recommend this place to everyone and I'm looking forward to the next time I come to visit Oahu :) The employees are very friendly and helpful.

Aqua hotels took over management of the hotel portion of this condo-hotel in the center of Waikiki. It is and has been a favorite for Japanese and Canadian and now Chinese tourists because of its price and very convenient location at the center of Waikiki. For the price this is a value and best of the second tier resorts off the beach and better than anything on Kuhio Ave which is not the safest place at night with hookers and what seems to be weekly shootings and stabbings associated with the clubs and bars. Stick to the beach hotel bars where you can see the ocean and its mo bettah. The 6th floor pool area has been remodeled with wooden cabanas, a small jacuzzi, there are plenty outdoor BBQ stations and a tiny exercise room, large modern laundry room and a friendly mini mart. There is a lobby cafe with coffee and some hot foods.The major suggestion is that the sauna 2-3 max is way to small... there needs be bigger and separate ladies and mens saunas which was overlooked by the remodeling committee.The rooms are nice and clean with the higher floors 20-45 having sunrise and moonrise views of Diamondhead volcano on the East side, sunsets, Friday fireworks show and Manoa Valley on the west side. Every room has open air lanai/balconies for dining, sunbathing and with the best weather on the planet you can sleep with your sliding doors open year round.

I stayed at the hotel in December 2012. I had nothing but problems getting into hotel room. None of the keys worked. The card reader was broken. There answer was to print cards 10 at a time. Between and my roommate over the 4 days we had 100 cards. You get to the room and fiddle with the cards until the door opens. 15 minutes at leAst bad if u had a couple of drinks and/or need the bathroom.The hotels solution print more cards. They said they were awaiting for the locks to be fixed. Asked for another room but they would not accommodate finally met with the manager Mona and she was nice and apologized she said she would refund 1 night (out of 4 no bad). But she said i paid via agoda so she said she would refund via them. 6 months no refund! Called Agoda no idea what im talking about. Other than the hotel is OLD! Rooms have been refurbished and nice but lobby pool hallways look like they were 20 years ago (i know because i stayed there twenty years ago - reading on their website remodeled thought be fun to stay there!). But it is only the rooms with broken door locks which have been remodeled.10 15 minute walk to the beach.I would've recommended if trying to save money but the manager promising a refund and not delivering left a bad taste in my mouth.

For me location, comfort, value, cleanliness are key to a good hotel. I do not need the services of a 5 star resort, I need a good "home base" while I am out busy beach hopping or seeing the sights. This hotel fit the bill for that. It does not have a fancy spa onsite or room service, or any of the other amenities the 5 star places have. If you don't need that, this place will meet your needs. Most important was the value paid for the room...if was a fair price and I had no complaints other than the shower head was way too low for me and showering was very uncomfortable. I was on floor 34 and had a nice view of the ocean and Diamond Head and the balcony was quite large. Waikiki beach is not that far, but do yourself a favor and find another beach...there are so many great "locals beaches" a quick drive away that are 100 times better with 80% less people crowding the beach.

Honolulu is getting increasingly un-fun, but this is a pretty place. The remodeled rooms are quiet and comfortable and affordable. The higher you stay, the less noise you will hear, and the more of the topography you will see..Thanks, Island Colony, for upgrading our room.Sue S

My partner my 8 year old son and myself stayed at aqua skyline on 20th march for 13 nights, we have never been to hawaii and didnt know what to expect, the hotel was going through some reconstruction which didnt impact on our stay at all, we stayed on the 38th floor so didnt hear a peep. Perfect location, 10 min walk to the beach lovely view of the canal, 2 min stroll to the shops my best holiday by far, saving up again!!! Would recomend this hotel to everyone, would suit all ages and kinds of people!!! Didnt visit the fitness room or restaurant so cant comment

We are locals here and wanted a special get-away for our daughter's 14th Birthday / Slumber party! What a great find! The price was perfect and we were not disappointed with our stay. The room was so very clean and modern, loved the kitchen and large family room. It was great for a group of 5 teenage girls to enjoy their time together, playing board games, eating, watching movies, swimming, eating, singing and dancing, and of course eating! We actually saved so much by making full use of the kitchen, which was spotless. The bedroom was large, bedding smelled so clean, and the balcony was spacious. Mahalo nui loa, thank you so much for making her birthday so perfect!

review_body: Stayed at the hotel for 10 nights March 11th to 21st in a studio kitchenette on the 28th floor. the room was renovated and we loved the large Lanai. The bathroom is small but who spends alot of time in there! The housekeeping was better some days than others but overall fine. We enjoyed our view and sitting out on the Lanai for breakfast in the morning and drinks in the evening. We could see the fireworks from the Hilton on friday nights.The 6th floor has a pool and jacuzzi, BBQ's and plenty of room for lounging or having some quiet time to read etc... There is also a small fitness room we used for a morning work out and enjoyed the new equipment that was provided. They were still working around the pool and the jacuzzi was closed down half way through our vacation. It would have been nice to know about this prior to our arrival. Overall the pool area is great and there is lots of space compared to many other hotels/condos in the area. Towels are provide for the pool and beach at the front desk. We even took extra towels when we went on our road trips and it was not a problem. We went to a managers reception on the Tuesday and had drinks and snacks. There were two staff singing and playing guitars, which was a nice touch. The manager joined in for a couple songs as well and we chatted with other guest...very nice!!We found the location to work well for us. A short walk to the beach area and close to shopping and a variety of restaurants. We rented a car for the last 3 days of our vacation and parking was $25.00 per day at the hotel. Very easy to drive any where on the Island. We loved paddle boarding out at Kailua and went to the North Shore another day and found some great beach areas there. The West coast of the Island was nice as well and great to do some snorkelling.Our vacation was wonderful and we would have loved to stay another week. We would definitely stay again at the Aqua Skyline and recommend it to other friends and family. Thank you to all the staff who were very friendly and helpful. They always said hello, had a smile and asked about our day. Mahalo - Pt, Steve and Leilani for your exceptional customer service!!!! =)Vancouver, Canada

We loved the modern look and the kitchenette. The location was very convenient. The pool and hot tub looked very inviting. They are still doing some construction and remodeling but that did not impact our stay.

Lawai, Hawaii, United States

review_body: We had the opportunity of staying at this property from February 11 to March 7th. We were in room 3221, a one bedroom suite. In Hawaii, you spend very little time in your room.......right? Wrong....... we actually ran into some unfavorable weather with high winds and rain and cool temperttures, on those days you really appreciate the comfort of your room and the amenities of your hotel. My wife and I were very pleased. The property, staff and amenities are excellent.The 24 hour laundry with the newer washers and driers were appreciated. The new excercise room with the excellent equipment is a definite plus for the property. The hot tub and pool are very nice, however the hours of operation in the evening could be extended so the guests could relax after a long day.We appreciated the daily free newspaper, and the onsite store on level 6.All and all we had a wonderful vacation, thanks especially to Moana and of course Steve! Steve you "Are the Island Colony" We look forward to seeing you again next time we have the opportunity of visiting Hawaii.Thank you all so much!

In may of 2011 myself, wife and 82 year old mother stayed at the Aqua Skyline at Island Colony. At that time major renovations were being done at the hotel. Because of the construction and having a room next to the trash chute I wasn't sure how our stay would be. The convenient location of the hotel and the pleasant and helpful attitude of the staff made our stay a positive one. We are planning another trip to Hawaii in April 2013 this time taking our Grandson. After talking to the staff and especially the Manger Brian K.of the Aqua Skyline at Island Colony who really show the Aloha spirit we will be staying at the Aqua Skyline at Island Colony.

On the way to our room out of the elevator, we immediately smelled the aroma of rotting garbage. Our one bedroom room on the 26th floor was two doors away from the trash chute. If we did not keep our window open, the garbage smell would permeate the entire toom. The floors were not cleaned very well. There were hairs (not ours) in the entry tiled area as well as the edge of the carpets as soon as we got into the room. I'm not sure how good housekeeping is as those hairs were never cleaned and our bathroom mirror was never wiped down (same water spots everyday) during our entire stay. On one occasion the maid swept the tiled area with a broom and left whatever was collected right outside our door. The hotel must have a very good photograher since the pictures posted on their site are nicer than the actual room. Our room had one window air conditioner in the bedroom. There was a rubber hose connected to the A/C with it draining into a plastic bucket on the balcony. The view was very nice and the location was good however we will not be returning to this hotel because of the cleanliness issues.

The bathroom was extremely small, room was ok, nothing special! I really love the view from the balcony. I wish this property was closer to the beach. Had to do a lot of walking to get to the happenings..

We were traveling in January and staying at Military hotels. We couldn't get a room one night so I called triple A (AAA) and they called back with this hotel. It was very nice with a good location and reasonable price.

The room and view were superb: room 4403 on the top floor gave us a view of Diamond Head, part of Waikiki Beach, and part of the house-studded hill behind the Ala Wi Canal. As well, the staff were friendly and helpful. A young woman named Leilani, working on the check-in desk, was especially helpful. She has a gentle spirit and a kind way with strangers - very well suited to her job. Then, too, there was a resourceful young man named "PT" who helped us get beach mats on loan from the hotel. We're now toying with the idea of visiting your paradisal state in a year's time or so. Mahalo.

We had a great time at the island colony hotel. We were on the 28th floor and the room was really nice - the view was amazing! There was a full moon last night and the view of that over the Honolulu skyline was splendid! Plus during the day you can check the surf ;) Great king bed, small kitchenette with sink, microwave, refrigerator and even dish soap and sponge (came in handy with a baby!). Parking is $25/day with in and out privileges, free internet in the lobby. 6th floor has a sauna, pool, convenience store and bbq areas - fun place to lounge!

I was not expecting that the room was that big. The hotel service was great; they gave me the highest floor when I requested. They gave me some restaurant tips when I asked. Everything was great, I only had that one night but I am definitely going back with friends or family in this hotel. I was not expecting that my room comes with a stove with necessary kitchen utensils unlike other regular rooms. I am recommending it to my friends who are planning to visit Hawaii.

The room was great and the staff was even GREATER. PT at the front desk was the most helpful and friendly you could ever find. The hotel is still under renovations but that did not take away from the great stay. The view was wonderful and the room was always clean. I loved that there was a convenience store right inside the hotel with laundry facilities as well If I was to live in Hawaii I would pick this place to stay. Convenient to major tour pick up spot and the strip but far enough away to have quiet when you want it and only 15 minute walk to the golf course across the Canal. Loved it Loved it Loved it!!Thanks to everyone there for making my holiday the best.

Room was nice. We were on the thirty third floor and the view was splendid. Room was clean and smelled good. Good Crew cleaning up. Bathroom was good and clean. Beds were comfy.40 inch flat screen TV./ Walking distance to anything we desired. One block from McDonalds, but found a place just around the corner which was cheaper than Mickey's with far better food. They have a great pool w/hot tub. Also sauna. Snack shop/store on premises with good prices. Free barbeque grilles on floor 6 with tables and the works. Actually a very good place to stay.

Weary from walking all day and looking to book a place to stay for the last few days of our vacation after a visit to the Big Island, PT at the Aqua Skyline was a refreshingly pleasant hotel agent that handled our request with professionalism and welcoming hospitality. We loved everything about our stay; the room and its gorgeous views of Waikiki and Diamond Head was just what we hoped for. When we asked about a restaurant recommendation, we were directed to a very nice dining experience at Duke's Outrigger restaurant. All in all, I can't say enough about the cleanliness and high quality of our room and the experience there. This will definitely be a place to bookmark for future visits.

I stayed here with my husband, father and son the week of jan 29. This hotel is convienenly located in Waikiki. In a 5-10min walk I was near the main shops, resturants and nightlife. This hotel is near the ala wai golf course and canal. We had a studio kitchenette which was great because we could buy groceries and cook. There are also gas BBQ grills you can use. We cooked out twice it was a great money saver as the grocery store was a few blocks down. There is a pool, sauna and hot tub located on the property as well as plenty of places to sit outside and relax. We were invited to a managers reception with complementary cocktails and food which was great on our first day of arrival. This hotel is also a residence so you will see locals here and they are great with tips on getting around Hawaii. The room was modern, flat screen tv, and clean sheets and comfy beds. We also had a lanai to hang out on which was nice. This hotel is rated a 2 star but with the renovations I would put it at three stars. The staff was friendly, pt and hazel were very nice and accommodating. The maid service came in and cleaned everyday. This hotel was a great value for location and price. I would definitely stay here again.

we stayed here for 2 nights in early jan. I was quite surprised to notice an outdoor reception area .. we got an upgrade to a 1 bedroom panoramic unit on the 42nd floor. the view was to die for .. our bedroom lanai faced diamond head and though we were a few blocks from the ocean we still had a good view of waikiki beach.. since we were celebrating our anniversary we got a complimentary macadamia nut chocolate box from the hotel management, nice surprise !!! We had booked the snooze and cruise package which is a great deal if you are planning to drive around the island and not worry about parking in waikiki .. the lobby is a bit dated but the rooms are nicely renovated and clean .. we did not have air conditioning in the living room though .. All the rooms have been renovated with modern touches and I believe there are plans to upgrade the common areas soon .. we enjoyed our stay here, no complaints whatsoever ..

booked through expedia for a panaromic ocean view. We were placed in room 2412 and was disappointed. No one can hardly call a glimpse of the ocean a panaromic ocean view. The room however was clean and functional. The beds were good enough to sleep in and spacious lanai. The bathroom is a different story. It was quite small and if you are taller then 5'6 it would be hard to take a shower. It is in a good location and within walking distance to all the shops. The elevators are quite slow and you never know which one will be opening up. I would recommend if you're only staying a short while like we did which was overnight but for longer stays you may want to go elsewhere.

My partner and I decided to meet up in Hawaii for New Years and found accommodation hard to come by. Ideally we wanted Kitchen facilities to give us flexibility for eating options. Unable to secure a room with a kitchen for 30th and 31st of Dec 2012 so booked into Hawaii Pacific which was a nice experience until we paid the bill + Taxes [$NZD650 per night], Then relocated to our scheduled Five nights at Aqua Skyline at Island Colony with kitchen facilities, sheltered balcony; good size room, small bathroom and handy kitchen; Pool and Hot tub for 12+ adults. Great Location with onsite parking for our rental car. Room rate [$USD 159 + Taxes] - Service was very friendly - Best value in Waikiki.

We booked our family into a room and they were given a 37th floor room facing Diamond Head. Spectacular view of Diamond Head, Waikiki, Ala Wai Canal and the Pacific Ocean. It was a functional room with two double beds, full sized refrigerator, stove and kitchen sink. The bathroom was so tiny the door couldn't be completely opened. Not good. We booked a room the last two nights our family was there and were put on the 15th floor in a renovated room facing Diamond Head. Nice view also but lots wrong. First we found a pair of shorts hanging on the shower rod, the shower head was very fancy but so low we had to duck under it to get wet, the vent was falling out of the ceiling and had to be pushed back in, the sink was a small kitchen sink, very deep and the stopper was like a kitchen sink. At least we could open the door all the way. The beds were queen sized and the mattress sat on a wooden frame which was too big and we often ran into the corners. Moving the mattress didn't help because if anyone sat or laid on the bed it moved and the corner was exposed again. The toilet seat was so cheap it bent when sat on it and had a sharp point on it and the air conditioner was so loud, even with just the fan, you couldn't hear the t.v. if it was running plus our room was next to the trash shute and when we opened the door the smell would permeate the room. Yuck. The front desk folks were actually very nice especially PT and Marynoll. The pool area is on the sixth floor and it is extremely nice. It is also keyed, in and out. They have a hot tub, showers, bathrooms, sauna, washers and driers and several gas barbeque units that are available for use. There is no WiFI except in the lobby and it costs. Also local phone calls are $1. The hotel is convenient to restaurants and only three blocks from the beach. It is the tallest hotel in Waikiki, however, the elevators don't always work and the convenience store on the 6th is very expensive. Pool towels are available on the 5th floor parking area and a separate elevator goes there, then back to the lobby and on another elevator to the pool. All in all, for the money we paid, it was average in some ways and very disappointing in others plus the price is going up for the renovated rooms. By the way, the room keys are terrible and we had to have them rekeyed three times, a pain.

Stayed at this place over the Christmas/NY break. We had booked for a pamoramic ocean view room, but instead, were given a city view room. At check-out, I was charged for the OV room and when I asked the front desk about it, they gave me the credit. So, recommend that you always check your bill.Recently remodeled, clean place. Feels like a apt/condo bldg, not a hotel. They have a pool, mini-mart, and bbq area on the 6th floor. About 3-4 blocks from the beach, but really a short walk.Not bad for Plan B since the Sheraton Waikiki wasn't available.

We are kama'aina who needed a place to stay while our house was being termite-extermination tented. We opted to stay at the Aqua Skytower as its location on the Ala Wai provides convenient routes to out-of-area restaurants without being stuck in traffic. Brian Kovaloff handled our reservation requests professionally and promptly. We were greeted cordially and warmly by Leilani, who despite being the only person at the front desk, managed to juggle phone calls, check-ins and guest requests with an unflappable and calm friendliness. Our door keys failed to work after three attempts and on the last, Leilani accompanied us upstairs to help. My husband dislikes the Waikiki area to the point of winding himself into an angry frenzy anytime he he is in the area, so we drove out of Waikiki to have dinner. When we returned, Leilani informed us that the lock, rather than the keys, was broken and that we would be moved to another room. The first room was very comfortable, but the second room was a better upgrade. My husband, a geographer, even relaxed and was able to observe and point out the Kaimuki Dome and its place in the volcanic rift zone from Leahi to the Kaneohe Marine Corps area from the lanai of our new room. He thus lightened up a bit and was able to gain something from our stay. The only drawback for me was the lack of central air-conditioning in the second (one bedroom) room, which kept the bedroom cool, but left the living and dining area warm. Both Brain and Leilani were super! Accommodations in the hospitality industry have everything to do with how one is treated and I loved the cheery and efficient customer service provided us by these two outstanding professionals.

Having stayed here before Aqua hotels took over was just not what you'd expect from a hotel. Aqua hotels has greatly improved the level of service and the value for rooms in this property. The hotel manager was very professional and made our vacation a wonderful success. Brian is his name and his staff also showed us the real aloha we cone to expect from Hawaii. A good place to stay when coming to Waikiki. We will stay here again. Oh yeah the view Is amazing from our balcony of diamond head and the city lights.

My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel during our anniversary. The front desk I think her name was Haziel, she was really helpful and accommodating. We had such wonderful and very memorable stay and I would recommend it to anyone.

I was so pleased with our stay at Island colony. I booked our room with this helpful lady, Hazel, and she was very pleasant despite the fact that I wanted to stay at a higher floor. She was efficient and informative. When we checked in, the wait wasn't long. The room was clean and very nice and I loved our view from the balcony. I would definitely go back to this hotel.

Best hotel in Waikiki. Only a block and a half to the main Waikiki Beach and shops. Just down the road to the bus stops that can take you everywhere. Very affordable and the staff are so friendly and helpful. My daughter and I holidayed there, we had a double bed each, comfortable bathroom and kitchenette. The renovations have made it very new looking and trendy. Pool area is also good. 24 hr laundry and the mini mart on the 6th floor are added bonus' and cheap & handy. Free WiFi available in the beautiful lobby area. We will definately be staying here again, and would recommend to everyone.

We are locals and like to stay in Waikiki for the weekend sometimes. This is always our hotel of choice. Its location is convenient and safe. The renovation of the hotel is awesome! The renovated rooms are really nice and modern, and for the price, it's a REALLY great deal! I would recommend booking as soon as you are sure of your travel plans. We've had to go elsewhere a few times because of unavailability, and were very disappointed.

The new renovation of the hotel is incredible. Whenever I stay in Hawaii the Skyline is a must. Staff is incredible. Shows us the true Aloha Spirit.My only complaint is....hotel is so nice and convenient....rooms are getting booked. I just checked out today and had to move to another hotel because the word is getting out. Sold out....bummer...wish I was still there.I was tempted to give a bad rating just to make sure they have room for me every trip....but I can't...I love the hotel too much

The perfect experience will definately be back! Very clean and beautiful rooms. Great view from room. I would recommend this hotel very affordable and very very clean! Very friendly staff as well! It was a very enjoyable experience.

our stay in Hawaii was for about 2 weeks and we couldn't have stayed in a better hotel. we paid for newly renovated room and it was great. very clean and nice view. this hotel is right in the middle of everything walking distance from food places to shopping the beach is even in walking distance. this hotel contains many amenities such as its own laundry area a pool and a little store. everyone is so friendly and always willing to help. I recommend this hotel it was cheap for a nice room. the only problem is if you want to rent a car and park there the parking is 25 dollars a day.

My family and I didn't know what to expect since the price was very reasonable. We were pleasantly surprised with the updated look & feel of the rooms - everything was pretty much new. This building consists of homeowners and the hotel, there is a pool, sauna and hot tub on site, the staff was very helpful and friendly. The location was great - just far enough from all the Waikiki shopping madness. The shopping and beach is within walking distance. There is free parking if you search in the area or you can pay $25 a night. It was a great place to relax.

We stayed in the 1 bedroom suite on the 24th floor. Newly remodeled it was nice. Great lanai and nice pool area. Would have liked a higher floor the view would have been better but really do appreciate what I had. Mahalo
